verses.latin: Et factum est in trigesimo anno, in quarto, in quinta mensis, cum essem in medio captivorum juxta flumen Chobar, aperti sunt caeli, et vidi visiones Dei.
verses.english: It happened in the thirtieth year, on the fifth day of the fourth month—reckoned from a significant historical event—while I was among the captives by the Chebar River, that the spiritual heavens were opened, and I began to see visions from God.

verses.latin: In quinta mensis, ipse est annus quintus transmigrationis regis Joachim.
verses.english: This same fifth day of the month also marked the fifth year of the exile of King Joachim.

verses.latin: Factum est verbum Domini ad Ezechielem filium Buzi sacerdotem, in terra Chaldaeorum, secus flumen Chobar: et facta est super eum manus Domini.
verses.english: The word of the Lord came directly to Ezekiel, the son of Buzi, who was a priest, in the land of the Chaldeans, by the Chebar River. And at that moment, the powerful hand of the Lord came upon him, empowering him for this vision.

verses.latin: Et vidi, et ecce ventus turbinis veniebat ab aquilone, et nubes magna, et ignis involvens, et splendor in circuitu ejus: et de medio ejus quasi species electri, id est, de medio ignis:
verses.english: And as I looked, I saw a great whirlwind coming from the north. There was a massive cloud, with fire swirling within it, and brilliant light shone all around it. From the very center of this fire, there was something that gleamed like polished, glowing metal, shining from the heart of the flames.

verses.latin: et in medio ejus quasi similitudo quatuor animalium: et hic aspectus eorum, similitudo hominis in eis.
verses.english: And from the center of this shining fire, I saw the likeness of four living creatures emerge. This was their overall appearance: they had the form and likeness of human beings.

verses.latin: Et quatuor facies uni, et quatuor pennae uni.
verses.english: Each one of these creatures had four faces, and each one also had four wings.

verses.latin: Et pedes eorum pedes recti, et planta pedum eorum quasi planta pedis vituli: et scintillae quasi aspectus aeris candentis.
verses.english: Their legs were straight, terminating in feet whose soles were like the hoofs of a calf, perfectly rounded and gleaming. Their feet sparkled and shone like the appearance of burnished, glowing bronze.

verses.latin: Et manus hominis sub pennis eorum in quatuor partibus: et facies et pennae eorum per quatuor partes.
verses.english: Underneath their wings, on each of their four sides, there were human hands visible. Their faces and wings were arranged around their four sides.

verses.latin: Junctaeque pennae eorum alterius ad alterum: et non revertebantur cum incederent, sed unumquodque ante faciem suam gradiebatur.
verses.english: Their wings were joined one to another, connecting them. As they moved, they did not turn around; instead, each creature advanced straight forward, in the direction of its primary face.

verses.latin: Et similitudo vultus eorum, facies hominis et facies leonis a dextris ipsorum quatuor, facies quoque bovis a sinistris ipsorum quatuor, et facies aquilae desuper ipsorum quatuor.
verses.english: This was the likeness of their faces: Each of the four creatures had a human face in the front. On their right side, each had a lion's face. On their left side, each had an ox's face. And on the back (or above), each had an eagle's face.

verses.latin: Ipsae facies eorum, et pennae eorum extentae desuper: duae pennae singulorum junctae, et duae tegebant corpora eorum.
verses.english: Their faces were arranged in this manner, and their wings were spread out above them. Each creature had two wings joined together, and two other wings covered their bodies.

verses.latin: Et unumquodque ante faciem suam gradiebatur: ubi erat impetus spiritus, illuc gradiebantur: nec revertebantur cum incederent.
verses.english: Each one moved straight forward, in the direction of its primary face. Wherever the impulse or leading of the Spirit was, that is where they went. They never turned back as they moved, maintaining a consistent direction.

verses.latin: Et similitudo animalium, aspectus eorum quasi carbonum ignis ardentium, et quasi aspectus lampadum discurrentium in medio animalium, splendor ignis, et de igne fulgor egrediens.
verses.english: The living creatures themselves had an appearance like burning coals of fire, blazing brightly. There was also the appearance of lamps, moving quickly among the creatures, casting light. There was the intense brightness of fire, and from this fire, flashes of lightning constantly came forth.

verses.latin: Et animalia currebant et revertebantur quasi aspectus fulguris.
verses.english: The living creatures themselves moved back and forth with incredible speed, appearing like sudden flashes of lightning.

verses.latin: Et aspiciebam animalia: et ecce rota una super terram juxta animalia, et quatuor facies habens.
verses.english: As I continued to look at the living creatures, I saw a single wheel resting on the ground beside each of the creatures. This wheel also appeared to have four sides, or aspects, corresponding to the creature's orientation.

verses.latin: Et aspectus rotarum et opus earum quasi visio maris: et una similitudo ipsarum quatuor: et aspectus earum et opera quasi rota in medio rotae.
verses.english: The appearance of the wheels and their construction was like the shining, deep-blue color of the sea, or a sea-green gem. All four wheels had the same exact likeness. Their appearance and structure seemed to be like a wheel integrated within another wheel.

verses.latin: Cum irent, per quatuor partes gradiebantur: et non revertebantur cum incederent.
verses.english: When the creatures and wheels moved, they could go in any of their four directions without turning. They did not have to pivot or reverse course as they advanced.

verses.latin: Et rotarum gyri tam excelsi erant, et horribiles, et pleni oculis per circuitum rotarum omnium quatuor.
verses.english: The rims of the wheels were exceedingly high, majestic, and awe-inspiring to behold. And these rims were completely full of eyes all around the circumference of all four wheels.

verses.latin: Cumque incederent animalia, incedebant et rotae juxta ea: et cum elevarentur animalia de terra, elevabantur simul et rotae.
verses.english: When the living creatures moved, the wheels moved alongside them. And when the living creatures were lifted up from the ground, the wheels were also lifted up with them, always in perfect unison.

verses.latin: Quocumque ibat spiritus, illuc, et spiritus eundi: et rotae elevabantur juxta eum: spiritus enim vitae erat in rotis.
verses.english: Wherever the living spirit of the creatures desired to go, there the wheels and the creatures moved. And the wheels were lifted up alongside the spirit, because the same Spirit that animated the living creatures was also present and active within the wheels.

verses.latin: Cum irent, ibant: et cum starent, stabant: et cum elevarentur de terra, elevabantur simul et rotae juxta eas: spiritus enim vitae erat in rotis.
verses.english: When the creatures moved, the wheels moved; when they stood still, the wheels also stood still. And when the creatures were lifted from the earth, the wheels were lifted up together with them, because the same animating Spirit of life was in the wheels.

verses.latin: Et similitudo super capita animalium firmamenti, quasi crystalli terribilis, et extensi super capita eorum desuper.
verses.english: Above the heads of the living creatures, there was an appearance of an expanse, or a firmament. It looked like dazzling, awe-inspiring crystal, spread out high above their heads.

verses.latin: Et sub firmamento pennae eorum rectae alterius ad alterum: duae unius cooperientes, et duae alterius similiter ad tegendum.
verses.english: Underneath this crystal-like expanse, their wings were stretched out straight, one wing towards another. Each creature had two wings covering its body in humility and reverence, while the other two were extended outward.

verses.latin: Et audiebam vocem alarum, quasi vocem aquarum multarum, quasi vocem Dei sublimis, cum ambularent, vocem sonitus, quasi vocem castrorum: cumque starent, demittebantur pennae eorum.
verses.english: I heard the sound of their wings as they moved, like the roar of mighty rushing waters. It was like the voice of Almighty God Himself speaking from on high. When they walked, the sound was like the clamor of a vast army. And when they stood still, their wings were lowered, becoming silent.

verses.latin: Vox de super firmamentum quod erat super caput eorum, cum starent, et demitterent alas suas.
verses.english: And a voice came from above the crystal-like expanse that was over their heads when they stopped moving and lowered their wings.

verses.latin: Et super firmamentum quod erat super caput eorum, quasi aspectus lapidis sapphiri, similitudo throni: et super similitudinem throni, similitudo quasi aspectus hominis desuper.
verses.english: Above the expanse that was over their heads, there was something like a throne, appearing like a sapphire stone in its brilliant blue. And seated upon this throne, there was a figure that appeared in the likeness of a man.

verses.latin: Et vidi quasi speciem electri, velut aspectum ignis intrinsecus ejus per circuitum: a lumbis ejus et desuper, et a lumbis ejus usque deorsum, vidi quasi speciem ignis micantis, et splendoris in circuitu ejus.
verses.english: I saw what appeared to be polished, glowing metal, with the appearance of fire all around within it. From what appeared to be his waist upwards, and from his waist downwards, I saw what looked like sparkling, vibrant fire, and a brilliant light surrounded him.

verses.latin: Sicut aspectus arcus, cum fuerit in nube in die pluviae, sic erat aspectus splendoris per circuitum. Hoc est visio similitudinis gloriae Domini. Vidi, et cecidi in faciem meam, et audivi vocem loquentis.
verses.english: The brilliant light surrounding Him was like the appearance of a rainbow in a cloud on a rainy day. This entire vision was the visionary appearance of the glory of the Lord Himself, a visible manifestation of His divine majesty. When I saw all this, I immediately fell on my face in reverence and awe, and then I heard a voice speaking to me.

verses.latin: Et dixit ad me: Fili hominis, sta super pedes tuos, et loquar tecum.
verses.english: And He said to me, "Son of man" (meaning, 'you, a human being'), "stand up. I will speak with you directly."

verses.latin: Ingrediebaturque in me spiritus postquam locutus est mihi, et statuit me super pedes meos: et audivi loquentem ad me.
verses.english: And the Spirit entered into me right after He had finished speaking, and the Spirit made me stand on my feet, allowing me to fully receive the message. And I heard Him speaking to me directly.

verses.latin: Et dixit: Fili hominis, mitto ego te ad filios Israel, ad gentes apostatrices, quae recesserunt a me: ipsi et patres eorum praevaricati sunt in me usque ad diem hanc.
verses.english: And He then said, "Son of man, I am sending you to the children of Israel—to the rebellious generations of people who have turned away from me. Both they and their ancestors have rebelled against me, right up to this very day."

verses.latin: Et filii duri facie, et indomabili corde sunt, ad quos ego mitto te: et dices ad eos: Haec dicit Dominus Deus.
verses.english: The people are stubborn-faced and hard-hearted. To these people I am sending you. You shall say to them: 'This is what the Lord God says.'

verses.latin: Et ipsi sive audierint, sive quiescant, quoniam domus exasperans est, scient quia propheta fuerit in medio eorum.
verses.english: And whether they listen or choose to ignore you (because they are a rebellious nation), they will know that a prophet from God has been among them.

verses.latin: Tu ergo, fili hominis, ne timeas eos, neque sermones eorum metuas: quoniam increduli et reprobi sunt tecum, et cum scorpionibus habitas. Sermones eorum ne timeas, et vultus eorum ne pertimcas, quoniam domus exasperans est.
verses.english: Therefore, son of man, do not fear them, and do not be afraid of what they say. For you are living among faithless and corrupt people—you are dwelling among what seem like scorpions to you. Do not fear their words, and do not be terrified by their faces, because they are a rebellious nation.

verses.latin: Et loqueris verba mea ad illos, sive audiant, sive quiescant: quoniam exasperantes sunt.
verses.english: And you shall speak my words to them, whether they listen or choose to ignore you, because they are rebellious.

verses.latin: Tu ergo, fili hominis, audi quae loquor ad te: noli esse exasperans sicut domus exasperans est: aperi os tuum, et comede quaecumque ego do tibi.
verses.english: Therefore, son of man, listen to what I am speaking to you. Do not be rebellious like that rebellious nation. Open your mouth and eat whatever I give to you, meaning, 'fully internalize and accept my message'.

verses.latin: Et vidi: et ecce manus missa ad me, in qua erat volumen libri: et expandit illud coram me, quod erat scriptum intus et foris: et scriptae erant in eo lamentationes, et carmen, et vae.
verses.english: And I saw a hand reaching out to me, holding a scroll, like a book. The hand unrolled the scroll before me, and it was written on both the inside and the outside, indicating the complete fullness of its message. Written on it were messages of grief, a mournful song of judgment, and declarations of inevitable sorrow.

verses.latin: Et dixit ad me: Fili hominis, quodcumque inveneris, comede: comede volumen istud, et vadens loquere ad filios Israel.
verses.english: And He said to me: “Son of man, whatever you find, eat it. Eat this scroll, and then go and speak to the children of Israel.”

verses.latin: Et aperui os meum, et cibavit me volumine illo.
verses.english: So I opened my mouth, and He fed me that scroll.

verses.latin: Et dixit ad me: Fili hominis, venter tuus comedet, et viscera tua complebuntur volumine isto quod ego do tibi. Et comedi: et factum est in ore meo sicut mel dulce.
verses.english: And He said to me: “Son of man, your stomach will digest this, and your innermost being will be filled with this scroll that I am giving you.” So I ate it, and in my mouth, it was as sweet as honey.

verses.latin: Et dixit ad me: Fili hominis, vade ad domum Israel, et loqueris verba mea ad eos.
verses.english: And He said to me: “Son of man, go now to the entire nation of Israel, and you will speak My words to them.”

verses.latin: Neque enim ad populum profundi sermonis et ignotae linguae mitteris, sed ad domum Israel.
verses.english: For you are not being sent to a people whose language is too deep or unknown for you to understand, but to the nation of Israel.

verses.latin: Neque ad populos multos profundi sermonis et ignotae linguae, quorum non possis audire sermones: et si ad illos mittereris, ipsi audirent te.
verses.english: Nor are you sent to many peoples with deep speech and unknown languages, whose words you could not comprehend. Indeed, if you were sent to them, they would actually listen to you.

verses.latin: Porro domus Israel nolunt audire te, quia nolunt audire me: omnes quippe domus Israel sunt frontis durae, et indomabilis cordis.
verses.english: However, the nation of Israel will not want to listen to you, because they do not want to listen to Me. For all the people of Israel are stubborn and hard-hearted, with untamed spirits.

verses.latin: Ecce dedi faciem tuam firmissimam contra facies eorum, et frontem tuam durissimam contra frontes eorum.
verses.english: Behold, I have made your face very strong against their faces, and your forehead very hard against their foreheads.

verses.latin: Quasi adamantem et ut silicem dedi faciem tuam: ne timeas eos, neque metuas vultum eorum, quia domus exasperans est.
verses.english: I have made your face like a diamond and like flint. Do not fear them, nor be afraid of their expressions, for they are a rebellious and provoking nation.

verses.latin: Et addidit, et dixit ad me: Fili hominis, omnes sermones meos, quos ego locutus sum ad te, assume in cor tuum, et auribus tuis audi.
verses.english: And He added and said to me: “Son of man, take all My words that I have spoken to you into your heart, and hear them with your ears.”

verses.latin: Et vade, ingredere ad transmigrationem, ad filios populi tui, et loqueris ad eos, et dices eis: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus: si forte audiant, et quiescent.
verses.english: “And go, proceed to the exiles, to the children of your people. Speak to them, and tell them: ‘Thus says the Lord God.’ Perhaps they will listen, and then they will find peace and cease their rebellion.”

verses.latin: Et assumpsit me spiritus, et audivi post me vocem commotionis magnae: Benedicta gloria Domini de loco suo.
verses.english: Then the Spirit lifted me up, and I heard behind me the sound of a great rumbling: “Blessed be the glory of the Lord from His place!”

verses.latin: Et sonitum alarum animalium percutientium alteram ad alteram, et sonitum rotarum subsequentium, et vocem commotionis magnae.
verses.english: This was the sound of the wings of the living creatures striking against one another, and the sound of the wheels following them, and a voice of great commotion.

verses.latin: Spiritus quoque levavit me, et assumpsit me: et abii amarus in indignatione spiritus mei: manus enim Domini erat confortans me.
verses.english: The Spirit also lifted me up and took me away, and I went, bitter and indignant in my spirit. For the hand of the Lord was strengthening me, even through my emotions.

verses.latin: Et veni ad transmigrationem in acervum novarum frugum, ad eos qui habitabant juxta flumen Chobar: et sedi ibi septem diebus, mœrens in medio eorum.
verses.english: And I came to the exiles in Tel-abib (the settlement by the 'mound of fresh produce'), to those who lived by the Chebar River. I sat there for seven days, mourning in their midst.

verses.latin: Cumque pertransissent septem dies, factum est verbum Domini ad me, dicens:
verses.english: And when seven days had passed, the word of the Lord came to me, saying:

verses.latin: Fili hominis, speculatorem dedi te domui Israel: et audies de ore meo verbum, et annunciabis eis ex me.
verses.english: “Son of man, I have appointed you as a watchman for the nation of Israel. You will hear a word from My mouth, and you will declare it to them on My behalf.”

verses.latin: Si dicente me ad impium: Morte morieris: non annunciaveris ei, neque locutus fueris ut avertatur impius a via sua impia, et vivat, ipse impius in iniquitate sua morietur: sanguinem autem ejus de manu tua requiram.
verses.english: “If I say to a wicked person: ‘You will surely die,’ and you do not warn him, nor speak to turn that wicked person from his wicked way so that he may live, that very wicked person will die in his iniquity. But I will require his blood from your hand.”

verses.latin: Si autem tu annunciaveris impio, et ille non fuerit conversus ab impietate sua, et a via sua impia, ipse quidem in iniquitate sua morietur: tu autem animam tuam liberasti.
verses.english: “But if you do warn the wicked person, and he does not turn from his wickedness and from his wicked way, he indeed will die in his iniquity. But you will have delivered your own soul.”

verses.latin: Sed et si justus averterit se a justitia sua, et fecerit iniquitatem, ponamque offendiculum coram eo: hic in peccato suo morietur: et non recordabitur justitiarum quas fecerat: quoniam annunciaveris ei, in sanguine suo morietur: sanguinem autem ejus de manu tua requiram.
verses.english: “But also if a righteous person turns away from his righteousness and commits iniquity, and I place a stumbling block before him: this one will die in his sin. His righteous deeds which he had done will not be remembered. And even if you *should* warn him, he will die in his own sin, and I will require his blood from your hand.”

verses.latin: Si autem tu annunciaveris justo ut non peccet, et ipse non peccaverit, vivens vivet, et tu animam tuam liberasti.
verses.english: “But if you do warn a righteous person not to sin, and he does not sin, he will surely live, and you will have delivered your own soul.”

verses.latin: Et facta est super me manus Domini, et dixit ad me: Surgens vade per campum, et ibi loquar tecum.
verses.english: And the hand of the Lord came upon me there, and He said to me: “Arise, go out into the plain, and there I will speak with you.”

verses.latin: Et surrexi, et egressus sum in campum: et ecce gloria Domini stabat ibi, quasi gloria quam vidi juxta flumen Chobar: et cecidi in faciem meam.
verses.english: So I arose and went out into the plain. And behold, the glory of the Lord stood there, just like the glory I had seen by the Chebar River. And I fell on my face in reverence.

verses.latin: Et intravit in me spiritus, et statuit me super pedes meos: et locutus est ad me, et dixit mihi: Ingredere, et claude ostium tuum intrinsecus.
verses.english: Then the Spirit entered into me and set me upon my feet. And He spoke to me and said: “Go in, and shut your door within your house.”

verses.latin: Et tu, fili hominis, ecce alligaverunt te vinculis, et ligabunt te in eis: et non egredieris de medio eorum.
verses.english: “And as for you, Son of man, behold, they (the people of Israel) have figuratively bound you with cords, and they will keep you bound by them. You will not be able to go out among them to speak freely.”

verses.latin: Et linguam tuam arctabo palato tuo, et eris mutus, nec quasi vir objurgans: quia domus exasperans est.
verses.english: “And I will make your tongue cleave to the roof of your mouth, so you will be silent. You will not be a man constantly reproving, because they are a rebellious and provoking nation.”

verses.latin: Cum autem locutus fuero tibi, aperiam os tuum, et dices ad eos: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus: qui audit, audiat: et qui quiescit, quiescat: quia domus exasperans est.
verses.english: “But when I speak to you, I will open your mouth, and you will say to them: ‘Thus says the Lord God: Let him who hears, hear. And let him who refuses to listen, remain unyielding,’ for they are a rebellious and provoking nation.”

verses.latin: Tu itaque fili hominis sume tibi laterem et pones illum coram te et describas in eo civitatem Hierusalem.
verses.english: You, son of man, take a clay brick, place it before you, and engrave a drawing of the city of Jerusalem on it.

verses.latin: Et circumdabis eam munitione et exstrues circa eam aggerem et pones in circuitu ejus castra et fundes arietem in gyro.
verses.english: Then, depict a siege around it: build siege works, construct a siege ramp, set up enemy camps, and position battering rams all around it.

verses.latin: Et tu sume tibi sartaginem ferream et pones eam ex adverso quasi murum ferreum inter te et civitatem et obfirmabis faciem tuam ad eam et erit in obsidionem et circumdabis eam haec signum est domui Israël.
verses.english: Now, take an iron griddle and place it between yourself and the city, as if it were an iron wall. Set your face resolutely against the city, indicating the severity of the siege. This action shows a siege being laid against it, and this entire representation is a symbolic sign for the house of Israel.

verses.latin: Et tu dormies super latus tuum sinistrum et pones in eo iniquitates domus Israël secundum numerum dierum quibus dormies super illud inies iniquitatem eorum.
verses.english: Then, you must lie on your left side and bear the sins of the house of Israel upon yourself. You will carry their sin for as many days as you lie in this position.

verses.latin: Ego enim dedi tibi annos iniquitatis eorum numero dierum trecentos et nonaginta dies et portabis iniquitatem domus Israël.
verses.english: For I have appointed to you a period of 390 days, each day representing a year of their rebellion. During this time, you will symbolically bear the iniquity of the house of Israel.

verses.latin: Et cum conpleveris haec dormies super latus tuum dextrum et portabis iniquitatem domus Juda quadraginta diebus diem pro anno diem pro anno dedi tibi.
verses.english: When those days are completed, you are to lie on your right side and bear the iniquity of the house of Judah for 40 days. Again, I have appointed each day to represent a year of their sin.

verses.latin: Et ad obsidionem Hierusalem firmabis faciem tuam et brachium tuum erit exertum et prophetabis adversus eam.
verses.english: During this time, you will keep your face fixed on the representation of the siege of Jerusalem. Your arm will be bared, ready for action, as you prophesy against the city.

verses.latin: Ecce circumdedi te vinculis et non converteris a latere tuo in latus tuum donec conpleas dies obsidionis tuae.
verses.english: Listen, I have bound you with cords so that you cannot turn from one side to the other until you have completed the full number of days for your symbolic siege.

verses.latin: Tu autem sume tibi frumentum et hordeum et fabam et lentem et milium et farraginem et mittes ea in vas unum et facies tibi panes juxta numerum dierum quos dormies super latus tuum trecentos et nonaginta diebus comedes illud.
verses.english: Now, take wheat, barley, beans, lentils, millet, and spelt. Mix all these grains into a single vessel and use them to bake bread for yourself. You will eat this bread for the 390 days you are lying on your side, fulfilling your symbolic act.

verses.latin: Et cibus tuus quo vesceris erit in pondere viginti stateres in die ab tempore usque ad tempus comedes illud.
verses.english: The food you eat will be strictly rationed: twenty shekels by weight each day. You must eat this small amount at specific intervals throughout the day, ensuring it lasts.

verses.latin: Et aquam mensura bibes sextam partem hin ab tempore usque ad tempus bibes eam.
verses.english: And you will drink water by measure as well: a sixth of a hin each day. You will drink this small amount at specific intervals, just like your food.

verses.latin: Et quasi hordiacium panem comedes illum et stercore hominum operies eum in conspectu eorum.
verses.english: You will eat this bread, coarse and unappetizing like barley cakes, and in their presence, you must bake it using human waste as fuel. This will be a shocking sign of extreme defilement.

verses.latin: Et dixit Dominus Sic comedent filii Israël panem suum pollutum in gentibus ad quas ejiciam illos.
verses.english: The Lord declared: 'In this very manner, the children of Israel will eat their bread, defiled and unclean, among the pagan nations to which I will drive them into exile.'

verses.latin: Et dixi A A A Domine Deus ecce anima mea non est polluta et morticinum et laceratum a bestiis non comedi ab infantia mea usque nunc et non introivit in os meum omnis caro inmundissima.
verses.english: Then I cried out, 'Oh no, Lord God! My soul has never been defiled by such things. I have never eaten anything that died a natural death or was torn by wild animals, nor has any unclean meat entered my mouth since my childhood!'

verses.latin: Et dixit ad me Ecce dedi tibi fimum boum pro stercore hominum et facies panem tuum in eo.
verses.english: And He said to me, 'Very well, I grant your request. Look, I will allow you to use cow dung instead of human waste. You may now prepare your bread using that as fuel.'

verses.latin: Et dixit ad me fili hominis ecce ego conteram baculum panis in Hierusalem et comedent panem in pondere et in sollicitudine et aquam in mensura et in angustia bibent.
verses.english: Then He said to me, 'Son of man, listen! I am about to cut off Jerusalem's food supply, effectively breaking its staff of bread. They will eat their bread in carefully weighed portions, consumed with great anxiety, and drink their water by exact measure, filled with distress.'

verses.latin: Ut deficiat panis et aqua et maereant unusquisque ad fratrem suum et contabescant in iniquitatibus suis.
verses.english: This severe rationing is so that their supply of bread and water will utterly fail. They will mourn and lament to one another in their suffering, and they will waste away because of their sins.

verses.latin: Et tu fili hominis, sume tibi cultrum acutum, radentem capillos et barbam: et assumens stateram ponderis, divide ea.
verses.english: And you, son of man, take a sharp razor—one for shaving hair and beard. Then take weighing scales and divide the hairs you have shaved off.

verses.latin: Tertiam partem igni combures in medio civitatis, juxta completionem dierum obsidionis: et assumens tertiam partem, concides gladio per circuitum ejus: tertiam vero aliam disperges in ventum, et gladium evaginabo post eos.
verses.english: You shall burn a third of these hairs in the middle of the city—Jerusalem—in the time of the siege. Then, take another third and strike it with a sword all around the city. And the last third you shall scatter to the wind, but I will draw a sword and pursue those who scatter.

verses.latin: Et sumes inde paucitatem in numero, et ligabis eos in summitate pallii tui.
verses.english: Yet, from these scattered hairs, take a very small number, and bind them into the folds of your cloak.

verses.latin: Et ex his rursum tolles, et projes eos in medium ignis, et combures eos igni: et ex ipso egredietur ignis in omnem domum Israel.
verses.english: But even from these few hairs you just bound, you must again take some, throw them into the fire, and burn them with fire. From that burning, fire will spread to consume the whole house of Israel.

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus Deus: ista est Jerusalem, in medio gentium posui eam, et in circuitu ejus terras.
verses.english: Thus says the Lord God: This is Jerusalem. I placed her in the center of the nations, with many lands surrounding her.

verses.latin: Et contempta judicia mea in impietate magis quam gentes: et praecepta mea non fecit, nec juxta judicia gentium quae in circuitu ejus sunt, nec juxta praecepta mea: quia respuit judicia mea.
verses.english: But she has despised My laws in her wickedness even more than the nations did. She did not keep My commandments, nor did she even follow the laws of the nations surrounding her, much less My own commandments. This is because she utterly rejected My laws.

verses.latin: Propterea haec dicit Dominus Deus: Quia ad impietatem plura fecistis quam gentes quae in circuitu vestro sunt, et in praeceptis meis non ambulastis, et judicia mea non fecistis, nec juxta judicia gentium quae in circuitu vestro sunt fecistis:
verses.english: Therefore, thus says the Lord God: Because you have acted with more wickedness than the nations around you, and have not walked in My commandments, nor have you kept My laws, nor have you even lived according to the laws of the nations around you—

verses.latin: propterea haec dicit Dominus Deus: Ecce ego ad te, et faciam in medio tui judicia, in conspectu gentium.
verses.english: Therefore, thus says the Lord God: Behold, I am coming against you, and I will execute My judgments in your midst, for all the nations to see.

verses.latin: Et faciam in te quod non feci, et quale numquam faciam, propter omnes abominationes tuas.
verses.english: And I will do to you what I have never done before, and what I will never do again, because of all your abominable practices.

verses.latin: Idcirco patres comedent filios in medio tui, et filii comedent patres suos: et faciam in te judicia, et ventilabo universam reliquam tuam in omnem ventum.
verses.english: Therefore, fathers will eat their children in your midst, and children will eat their fathers. I will execute judgments in you, and I will scatter all your remaining survivors to every wind.

verses.latin: Propterea vivo ego, dicit Dominus Deus: quia sanctum meum polluisti in omnibus idolis tuis, et in omnibus abominationibus tuis: ego quoque radam te, et non parcet oculus meus, et non miserebor.
verses.english: Therefore, as I live, says the Lord God, because you have defiled My holy temple with all your idols and with all your detestable practices, I also will cut you off. My eye will not show pity, and I will have no mercy on you.

verses.latin: Tertia pars tui morte morietur, et fame consumetur in medio tui: et tertia pars gladio cadet in circuitu tuo: et tertiam partem in omnem ventum dispergam, et gladium evaginabo post eos.
verses.english: A third of your people will die by plague and be consumed by famine in your midst. Another third will fall by the sword around you. And the last third I will scatter to every wind, and I will draw a sword and pursue them.

verses.latin: Et complebo furorem meum, et requiescere faciam indignationem meam in eis: et consolabor: et scient quia ego Dominus locutus sum in zelo meo, cum implevero indignationem meam in eis.
verses.english: Thus, I will complete My furious judgment and make My indignation rest fully upon them. And I will be satisfied; then they will know that I, the Lord, have spoken in My righteous zeal, when I have accomplished My indignation against them.

verses.latin: Et ponam te in desertum, et in opprobrium in gentibus quae in circuitu tuo sunt, in conspectu omnis praetereuntis.
verses.english: I will turn you into a desolate place and make you an object of disgrace among the nations surrounding you, in the full view of everyone who passes by.

verses.latin: Et eris opprobrium, et blasphemia, exemplum et stupor gentibus quae in circuitu tuo sunt, cum fecero in te judicia in furore, et in indignatione, et in increpationibus irae: ego Dominus locutus sum.
verses.english: So you will become a disgrace, a cause for scorn, a warning, and an object of horror to the nations around you, when I execute My judgments against you with fury, and with indignation, and with furious rebukes. I, the Lord, have spoken.

verses.latin: In eo quod misero in vos sagittas famis pessimam, et erunt in interitum, quas mittam in vos ad perdendum vos: et famem augebo super vos, et conteram vobis baculum panis.
verses.english: Because I will send upon you the deadly arrows of famine, which will be for your destruction—indeed, I will send them upon you to utterly destroy you. I will intensify the famine among you, and I will break your very supply of bread.

verses.latin: Et emittam in vos famem et bestias pessimas, et interibunt te: et pestilentia et sanguis transibit per te, et gladium inducam super te: ego Dominus locutus sum.
verses.english: And I will send upon you famine and deadly wild animals, and they will ravage you and cause you to perish. Disease and bloodshed will pass through you, and I will bring the sword upon you. I, the Lord, have spoken.

verses.latin: Et factus est sermo Domini ad me dicens:
verses.english: Then the word of the Lord came directly to me, His prophet, saying:

verses.latin: Fili hominis, pone faciem tuam ad montes Israel, et prophetabis ad eos, et dices:
verses.english: Son of Man, turn your attention towards the mountainous regions of Israel. Prophesy against them, and tell them:

verses.latin: Montes Israel, audite verbum Domini Dei: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus montibus et collibus, rupibus et convallibus: Ecce ego inducam super vos gladium, et disperdam excelsa vestra:
verses.english: You mountains of Israel, listen to the message of the Lord God! The Lord God says this to the mountains, the hills, the rocky outcrops, and the valleys: 'Behold, I am about to bring war upon you, and I will utterly destroy your pagan shrines and places of idol worship.'

verses.latin: et demolibor aras vestras, et confringam simulacra vestra: et dejiciam interfectos vestros ante idola vestra:
verses.english: I will demolish your pagan altars, and I will shatter your idol-statues. I will cast down the corpses of your slain worshippers right in front of your useless idols.

verses.latin: et dabo cadavera filiorum Israel ante simulacra vestra: et dispergam ossa vestra circa aras vestras.
verses.english: I will also spread the corpses of the children of Israel before your idols, and I will scatter your bones all around your altars, desecrating them.

verses.latin: In omnibus habitationibus vestris urbes desertæ erunt, et excelsa demolientur: et contrita confringentur idola vestra, et cessabunt simulacra vestra, et delebuntur opera vestra.
verses.english: In all the places where you live, your cities will become deserted ruins, and your pagan shrines will be torn down. Your idol-statues will be utterly shattered and broken to pieces, your detestable images will cease to exist, and all your evil works will be completely erased.

verses.latin: Et corruet interfectus in medio vestri: et scietis quia ego Dominus.
verses.english: Many of your people will fall dead in your midst, and then you will truly know that I am the Lord, the one true God.

verses.latin: Et reliquero in vobis salvos de gente, cum fueritis dispersi in terris ad gentes.
verses.english: But I will allow some of your people to survive, preserving a remnant from the nation, even when you are scattered and dispersed throughout the various lands among foreign peoples.

verses.latin: Et recordabuntur vestri qui fugerint de vobis in gentibus, ad quas captivi ducti sunt, quia contrivi cor eorum fornicans, et discedens a me, et oculos eorum fornicantes post idola sua: et displicebunt sibimetipsis super malis quæ fecerunt in omnibus abominationibus suis.
verses.english: And those who escape and flee from you into the foreign nations where they have been led captive, they will remember Me. They will remember how I broke their spiritually unfaithful heart, which had strayed far from Me, and their eyes, which lusted after their idols. They will detest themselves for all the evil things and abominations they have committed.

verses.latin: Et scient quia ego Dominus locutus sum non frustra, ut afferrem illis mala hæc.
verses.english: And they will then know for certain that I, the Lord, have not spoken idly or in vain, and that I have indeed brought all these calamities and evils upon them, exactly as I promised.

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Percute manu tua, et plaude pede tuo, et dic: Heu, montes Israel, super omnes abominationes pessimæ domus Israel, qui casuri sunt gladio, fame, et peste.
verses.english: This is what the Lord God says: 'Strike your hand together in despair! Stamp your foot on the ground in mourning! And cry out, 'Alas, for the mountains of Israel!' For all the utterly evil abominations committed by the entire house of Israel, they are about to perish by war, by starvation, and by plague.

verses.latin: Qui longe est, peste morietur: et qui prope est, gladio corruet: et qui residuus fuerit et obsessus, fame morietur: et implebo indignationem meam in eis.
verses.english: Those who are far away will die from plague. Those who are close by will fall in war. And those who survive and are trapped in besieged cities will die from starvation. In this way, I will completely unleash My furious wrath upon them.

verses.latin: Et scietis quia ego Dominus, cum fuerint interfecti vestri in medio idolorum vestrorum, per circuitum ararum vestrarum, in omni colle sublimi, et in cunctis summitatibus montium, et subter omne lignum frondosum, et subter omne lignum spissum: in loco, ubi thura turificabant universis idolis suis.
verses.english: Then you will know that I am truly the Lord, when your slain people lie dead among your idols, all around your pagan altars. This will happen on every high hill, on all the mountaintops, under every leafy tree, and under every dense oak tree—these are the very places where you offered sweet-smelling incense to all your detestable idols.

verses.latin: Et extendam manum meam super eos: et faciam terram in solitudinem, et in desolationem, a deserto Deblatha in omni habitationum eorum: et scient quia ego Dominus.
verses.english: And I will stretch out My judging hand against them. I will turn their land into a desolate and uninhabitable wasteland, from the desert of Diblah across all the places where they dwell. And then they will know without a doubt that I am the Lord, the one true God.

verses.latin: Et factum est verbum Domini ad me, dicens:
verses.english: The word of the Lord came to me, saying:

verses.latin: Et tu, fili hominis, haec dicit Dominus Deus terrae Israël: Finis venit, finis super quatuor plagas terrae.
verses.english: “And you, son of man, this is what the Lord God says to the land of Israel: ‘The end has come, the end is coming upon all parts of the land.

verses.latin: Nunc finis super te: et mittam furorem meum in te, et judicabo te juxta vias tuas: et ponam super te omnes abominationes tuas.
verses.english: Now the end is upon you. I will send My wrath upon you, and I will judge you according to your ways, and I will bring all the consequences of your abominations upon you.

verses.latin: Et non parcet oculus meus, et non miserebor: sed vias tuas super te ponam, et abominationes tuae in medio tui erunt: et scietis quia ego Dominus.
verses.english: My eye will not spare you, nor will I have mercy. Instead, I will bring the consequences of your ways upon you, and your abominations will be made clear in your midst. Then you will know that I am the Lord.’

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus Deus: Afflictio una, afflictio ecce venit.
verses.english: This is what the Lord God says: ‘A single, unique disaster — behold, it comes!

verses.latin: Finis venit, venit finis, evigilavit contra te, ecce venit.
verses.english: The end has come, the end has come! It has awakened against you; behold, it comes!

verses.latin: Venit matutinus super te, qui habitas in terra: venit tempus, prope est dies occisionis, et non gloriæ montium.
verses.english: The dawn of your judgment has come upon you, you who dwell in the land. The time has come; the day of slaughter is near, and there will be no joyful shouts on the mountains.

verses.latin: Nunc prope est diei mei, ut effundam iram meam super te, et compleam furorem meum in te: et judicem te juxta vias tuas, et ponam super te omnes abominationes tuas.
verses.english: Now My day is near, that I may pour out My burning anger upon you and fulfill My fury in you. I will judge you according to your ways, and I will bring all the consequences of your abominations upon you.

verses.latin: Et non parcet oculus meus, neque miserebor: sed vias tuas super te ponam, et abominationes tuae in medio tui erunt: et scietis quia ego Dominus percussi.
verses.english: My eye will not spare you, nor will I have mercy. Instead, I will bring the consequences of your ways upon you, and your abominations will be made clear in your midst. Then you will know that I am the Lord, who has struck you.’

verses.latin: Ecce dies, ecce venit: egressus est matutinus, floruit virga, germinavit superbia.
verses.english: Behold, the day! Behold, it comes! The dawn has arrived. The rod of punishment has blossomed, and pride has fully sprouted.

verses.latin: Violentia surrexit in virgam impietatis: non ex eis, et non ex turba eorum, et non eorum ex aliqua parte: et non est requies in eis.
verses.english: Violence has risen into a rod of wickedness. Nothing is left of them, neither of their crowd, nor of any part of them; there is no peace among them.

verses.latin: Venit tempus, adpropinquavit dies: qui emit, non gaudeat: et qui vendit, non lugeat: quia ira super omnem populum ejus.
verses.english: The time has come, the day has drawn near. Let him who buys not rejoice, and let him who sells not mourn, for wrath is upon all its people.

verses.latin: Quia qui vendit, ad id quod venditum est, non revertetur: et adhuc in viventibus vita eorum non confortabitur: quoniam visio ad omnem multitudinem ejus non regredietur, et vir in iniquitate vitae suae non confortabitur.
verses.english: For the seller will not return to what was sold, even if he remains among the living, for their lives will not be strengthened. The vision of their future will not return to all their multitude, and no man will be made strong by the wickedness of his life.

verses.latin: Canite tuba, præparate omnia: et non est qui vadat ad prælium: quia ira mea super omnem multitudinem ejus.
verses.english: Blow the trumpet, prepare everything! Yet no one goes forth to battle, because My wrath is upon all its multitude.

verses.latin: Gladius foris, et pestis et fames intus: qui in agro est, gladio morietur: et qui in civitate, famem et pestem devorabunt eum.
verses.english: The sword is outside, and pestilence and famine are inside. Whoever is in the open country will die by the sword, and whoever is in the city, famine and pestilence will consume him.

verses.latin: Et salvabuntur de eis fugientes, et erunt in montibus quasi columbæ convallium, omnes trementes, unusquisque in iniquitate sua.
verses.english: And those who flee from them will be saved, but they will be on the mountains like trembling doves of the valleys, each one overwhelmed by his own iniquity.

verses.latin: Omnes manus dissolventur, et omne genu adflueret aquis.
verses.english: All hands will hang limp, and every knee will become weak as water.

verses.latin: Et accingent se ciliciis, et operiet eos formido: et in omni facie confusio, et in universis capitibus eorum calvitium.
verses.english: And they will gird themselves with sackcloth; terror will cover them. Shame will be on every face, and all their heads will be shaved bald in mourning.

verses.latin: Argentum eorum foras abjicient, et aurum eorum in sterquilinium erit: argentum eorum et aurum eorum non poterit liberare eos in die iræ Domini: animam suam non saturabunt, et ventres eorum non implebunt: quia scandalum iniquitatis eorum factum est.
verses.english: They will cast their silver into the streets, and their gold will be as refuse. Their silver and their gold will not be able to deliver them on the day of the Lord’s wrath. They will not satisfy their souls, nor will they fill their bellies, because their wealth became a stumbling block for their iniquity.

verses.latin: Et ornamentum monilium suorum posuerunt in superbiam, et imagines abominationum suarum, et simulacra eorum fecerunt ex eo: propter hoc dedi eis illud in immunditiam.
verses.english: They used their beautiful jewelry for pride, and they made from it images of their abominations and their idols. Therefore, I have given it to them as an unclean and defiled thing.

verses.latin: Et dabo illud in manus alienorum in direptionem, et impiis terrae in praedam, et polluent illud.
verses.english: And I will give it into the hands of foreigners as plunder, and to the wicked of the land as prey, and they will defile it.

verses.latin: Et avertam faciem meam ab eis, et contaminabunt secretum meum: et venient ad eos raptores, et polluent illud.
verses.english: And I will turn My face away from them, and they will defile My secret, holy place (the Temple). Plunderers will come to them and defile it.

verses.latin: Fac catenam: quia terra repleta est judicio sanguinis, et civitas plena iniquitate.
verses.english: ‘Make a chain, for the land is full of bloody violence, and the city is full of iniquity.

verses.latin: Et adducam pessimos gentium, et possidebunt domos eorum: et quiescere faciam superbiam potentium, et possidebunt sanctuaria eorum.
verses.english: Therefore, I will bring the worst of the nations, and they will possess their houses. I will make the pride of the powerful cease, and they will possess their sanctuaries.

verses.latin: Angustia supervenit: et requirunt pacem, et non erit.
verses.english: Anguish will come upon them. They will seek peace, but there will be none.

verses.latin: Conturbatio super conturbationem veniet, et auditus super auditum: et quaerent visionem a propheta, et lex peribit a sacerdote, et consilium a senioribus.
verses.english: Disturbance upon disturbance will come, and rumor upon rumor. They will seek a vision from the prophet, but the law will perish from the priest, and counsel from the elders.

verses.latin: Rex lugebit, et princeps induetur moerore, et manus populi terrae conturbabuntur: vias eorum convertam in eos, et judiciis eorum judicabo eos: et scient quia ego Dominus.
verses.english: The king will mourn, and the prince will be clothed with sorrow. The hands of the people of the land will be troubled and paralyzed. I will bring their ways back upon them, and I will judge them by their own judgments. Then they will know that I am the Lord.’”

verses.latin: Et factum est in anno sexto, in sexto mense, in quinta die mensis, ego sedebam in domo mea, et senes Judææ sedebant coram me, et cecidit ibi super me manus Domini Dei.
verses.english: And it happened in the sixth year, on the fifth day of the sixth month (that is, the sixth year of King Jehoiachin's captivity, meaning 592 BC). I was sitting in my house, and the elders of Judah were sitting before me, and the hand of the Lord God fell upon me there.

verses.latin: Et vidi : et ecce similitudo quasi aspectus ignis : ab aspectu lumborum ejus et deorsum, ignis : et a lumbis ejus et sursum, quasi aspectus splendoris, ut visio electri.
verses.english: And I looked, and behold, I saw a figure like the appearance of fire. From what appeared to be its loins downward, there was fire. And from its loins upward, there was an appearance of brightness, like the shining vision of electrum (a gleaming, golden-silver alloy).

verses.latin: Et emissa similitudo manus apprehendit me in cæsarie capitis mei : et elevavit me spiritus inter terram et cælum, et adduxit me in Jerusalem in visione Dei, juxta ostium interius, quod respicit ad Aquilonem, ubi erat statutum idolum zelotypiæ, provocans ad æmulationem.
verses.english: And a likeness of a hand was sent out and took hold of me by the hair of my head. And the Spirit lifted me between the earth and the sky (the atmosphere), and brought me to Jerusalem in a divine vision, to the inner gate that faced north. There, the idol of jealousy (a pagan image that provoked God's wrath) had been set up, stirring Him to rivalry.

verses.latin: Et ecce ibi gloria Dei Israël, secundum visionem quam videram in campo.
verses.english: And behold, the glory of the God of Israel was there, just as in the vision I had seen in the plain.

verses.latin: Et dixit ad me : Fili hominis, leva oculos tuos ad viam Aquilonis. Et levavi oculos meos ad viam Aquilonis : et ecce ab Aquilone portæ altaris, idolum zelotypiæ in ipso introitu.
verses.english: And He said to me, "Son of Man, lift your eyes toward the way of the North." And I lifted my eyes toward the way of the North, and behold, to the north of the altar gate, there was the idol of jealousy right at the entrance itself.

verses.latin: Et dixit ad me : Fili hominis, putasne certe, vides tu quid isti faciunt ? abominationes magnas nimis, domus Israël, hic faciunt : ut procul recedam a sanctuario meo. Et adhuc conversus videbis abominationes majores.
verses.english: And He said to me, "Son of Man, do you really see what these people are doing? The house of Israel is committing exceedingly great abominations here, so much so that I must withdraw far from My sanctuary. And turning again, you will see even greater abominations."

verses.latin: Et introduxit me ad ostium atrii : et vidi, et ecce foramen unum in pariete.
verses.english: And He brought me to the door of the (inner) courtyard, and I looked, and behold, there was a single hole in the wall.

verses.latin: Et dixit ad me : Fili hominis, fode parietem. Et cum fodissem parietem, ecce ostium unum.
verses.english: And He said to me, "Son of Man, dig through the wall." And when I had dug through the wall, behold, there was a single door.

verses.latin: Et dixit ad me : Ingredere, et vide abominationes pessimas, quas isti faciunt hic.
verses.english: And He said to me, "Enter, and see the most wicked abominations that these people are doing here."

verses.latin: Et ingressus vidi : et ecce omnis similitudo reptilis, et animantium, abominatio, et universa idola domus Israël, depicta erant in pariete in circuitu per totum.
verses.english: So I entered and saw. And behold, every likeness of creeping things, and detestable beasts, and all the idols of the house of Israel, were depicted on the wall all around the entire room.

verses.latin: Et seniores domus Israël, septuaginta viri, et Jezonias filius Saphan, princeps in medio eorum, stabant ante eos : et unusquisque habebat thuribulum in manu sua : et nebula thymiæmatis ascendebat.
verses.english: And seventy elders of the house of Israel were standing before them (the depicted idols), with Jaazaniah, the son of Shaphan, as a chief among them. Each man had a censer in his hand, and the cloud of ascending incense filled the room.

verses.latin: Et dixit ad me : Certe vides, fili hominis, quæ seniores domus Israël faciunt in tenebris, unusquisque in conclavi parietis sui : dicunt enim : Non videt Dominus nos, dereliquit Dominus terram.
verses.english: And He said to me, "Do you truly see, Son of Man, what the elders of the house of Israel are doing in the darkness? Each one is in the secret chamber of his (idolatrous) wall, for they say, 'The Lord does not see us; the Lord has forsaken the land.'"

verses.latin: Et dixit ad me : Adhuc conversus videbis abominationes majores, quas isti faciunt.
verses.english: And He said to me, "Turning again, you will yet see even greater abominations that these people are doing."

verses.latin: Et introduxit me per ostium portæ domus Domini, quod respiciebat ad Aquilonem : et ecce ibi mulieres sedebant plangentes Adonidem.
verses.english: And He brought me through the door of the gate of the house of the Lord, which faced north. And behold, there were women sitting, weeping for Adonis (a pagan god whose death was lamented in fertility rites).

verses.latin: Et dixit ad me : Certe vides, fili hominis ? adhuc conversus videbis abominationes majores his.
verses.english: And He said to me, "Do you truly see, Son of Man? Turning again, you will yet see abominations even greater than these."

verses.latin: Et introduxit me in atrium interius domus Domini : et ecce in ostio templi Domini, inter vestibulum et altare, quasi viginti quinque viri, terga habentes ad templum Domini, et facies suas ad Orientem : et adorabant ad Orientem solem.
verses.english: And He brought me into the inner courtyard of the house of the Lord. And behold, at the entrance of the temple of the Lord, between the vestibule (the porch leading into the temple) and the altar, there were about twenty-five men. They had their backs to the temple of the Lord (turning their backs on God's true worship), and their faces were toward the East, and they were worshiping the rising sun toward the East.

verses.latin: Et dixit ad me : Certe vides, fili hominis ? Numquid leve est domui Juda, quod fecerunt abominationes istas hic ? quia replentes terram iniquitate, conversi sunt ut provocarent me. Et ecce ipsi applicant ramum ad nares suas.
verses.english: And He said to me, "Do you truly see, Son of Man? Is it a light thing for the house of Judah that they have committed these abominations here? For they have filled the land with iniquity, and they have turned again and again to provoke Me. And behold, they even put the branch (a symbol of pagan ritual) to their nostrils (in contempt or pagan veneration)."

verses.latin: Ergo et ego faciam eos in furore : non parcet oculus meus, nec miserebor : et cum clamaverint ad aures meas voce magna, non exaudiam eos.
verses.english: Therefore, I Myself will deal with them in fury. My eye will not spare them, nor will I have pity. And when they cry to My ears with a loud voice, I will not hear them.

verses.latin: Et clamavit in auribus meis voce magna dicens: Appropinquavit visitatio urbis, et unicuique vas interfectionis in manu ejus.
verses.english: And he cried out into my hearing with a loud voice, saying: "The time for the city's judgment has drawn near, and each man has an instrument of destruction in his hand."

verses.latin: Et ecce sex viri veniebant de via portæ superioris, quæ respicit ad aquilonem, et uniuscujusque vas interfectionis in manu ejus: vir quoque unus in medio eorum vestitus lineis, et atramentarium scriptoris ad renes ejus. Et ingressi sunt, et steterunt juxta altare æreum.
verses.english: And behold, six men were coming from the direction of the upper gate, which faces north. Each of them had an instrument of destruction in his hand. There was also one man among them, clothed in linen, who had a writer's inkhorn at his waist. They entered and stood beside the bronze altar.

verses.latin: Et gloria Domini Israël assumpta est de cherub, quæ erat super illud, ad limen domus: et vocavit virum, qui vestitus erat lineis, et cujus atramentarium scriptoris erat ad renes ejus.
verses.english: And the Glory of the Lord of Israel, which had been above the cherubim, was taken up and moved to the threshold of the Temple. He then called the man who was clothed in linen, and who had the writer's inkhorn at his waist.

verses.latin: Et dixit Dominus ad eum: Transi per mediam civitatem, in medio Jerusalem: et signa Thau super frontes virorum gementium et dolentium super cunctis abominationibus, quæ fiunt in medio ejus.
verses.english: And the Lord said to him: "Go through the midst of the city, right through the heart of Jerusalem. Mark with the sign of the cross (the letter Tau) on the foreheads of the men who are sighing and mourning over all the abominations that are being committed in its midst."

verses.latin: Et his dixit, audiente me: Transite per civitatem, et cædite: non parcat oculus vester, neque misereamini.
verses.english: And to the other six, He said, while I listened: "Go through the city and strike them down! Let your eye not spare anyone, and show no pity."

verses.latin: Senem, adolescentem, et virginem, parvulum, et mulieres interficite usque ad internecionem: omnem vero super quem videritis signum, ne occidatis: et a sanctuario meo incipite. Cæperunt ergo a viris senioribus, qui erant ante faciem domus.
verses.english: "Kill all the old men, young men, virgins, little children, and women until utter destruction. But anyone on whom you see the mark of the cross, do not kill him. And begin the slaughter at My sanctuary, the Temple." So they began with the elder men who were in front of the Temple.

verses.latin: Et dixit eis: Contaminate domum, et implete atria interfectis: egredimini. Et egressi sunt, et cædebant eos, qui erant in civitate.
verses.english: And He said to them: "Defile the Temple, and fill its courtyards with the slain. Go forth now!" And they went forth and began to strike down those who were in the city.

verses.latin: Et factum est, cum cæderent eos, et ego derelictus essem, cecidi super faciem meam, et clamans dixi: Heu! heu! heu! Domine Deus, ergone disperdes omnes reliquias Israël, effundens iram tuam super Jerusalem?
verses.english: And it came to pass, as they were striking them down, and I was left alone, I fell upon my face. I cried out and said: "Alas, alas, alas! O Lord God, will You then destroy all the remnant of Israel by pouring out Your wrath upon Jerusalem?"

verses.latin: Et dixit ad me: Iniquitas domus Israël et Juda grandis est nimis, et repleta est terra sanguinibus, et civitas subversione: dixerunt enim: Dereliquit Dominus terram, et Dominus non videt.
verses.english: And He said to me: "The iniquity of the house of Israel and Judah is exceedingly great. The land is filled with bloodshed, and the city is full of perversion. For they have said: 'The Lord has abandoned the land, and the Lord does not see what we do.'"

verses.latin: Ideo et ego oculus meus non parcet, neque miserebor: viam eorum super capita eorum reddam.
verses.english: "Therefore, My eye will also not spare, nor will I have pity. I will bring their conduct and consequences directly upon their own heads."

verses.latin: Et ecce vir, qui vestitus erat lineis, qui habebat atramentarium in renibus suis, respondit sermonem, dicens: Feci sicut præcepisti mihi.
verses.english: And behold, the man who was clothed in linen, who had the inkhorn at his waist, reported back, saying: "I have done exactly as You commanded me."

verses.latin: Et vidi, et ecce in firmamento quod erat super caput cherubim, quasi lapis sapphirus, quasi species similitudinis throni apparuit eis.
verses.english: And I looked, and behold, in the created expanse that was above the heads of the cherubim, something appeared to them that looked like a sapphire stone, resembling the appearance of a throne.

verses.latin: Et dixit viro qui indutus erat lineis, et ait: Ingredere in medium rotarum, quæ sunt subter cherubim, et imple manum tuam carbonibus ignis qui sunt inter cherubim, et effunde super civitatem. Ingressusque est in conspectu meo.
verses.english: Then He spoke to the man who was clothed in linen, instructing him: “Go into the midst of the wheels that are beneath the cherubim. Fill your hand with burning coals that are between the cherubim, and then pour them over the city as judgment.” And the man entered in my sight.

verses.latin: Cherubim autem stabant a dextris domus, quando ingrediebatur vir: et nubes implevit atrium interius.
verses.english: Now the cherubim were standing on the right side of the Temple as the man entered, and a thick cloud, signifying God's presence, filled the inner court.

verses.latin: Et elevata est gloria Domini super cherub, ad limen domus: et impleta est domus nube, et atrium repletum est splendore gloriæ Domini.
verses.english: And the glory of the Lord was lifted up from the cherub and moved to the threshold of the Temple. The Temple itself was filled with the cloud of God's presence, and the court was filled with the radiant splendor of the Lord's glory.

verses.latin: Et sonitus alarum cherubim audiebatur usque ad atrium exterius, quasi vox Dei omnipotentis loquentis.
verses.english: The sound of the cherubim's wings could be heard even as far as the outer court, a sound like the very voice of Almighty God speaking.

verses.latin: Et cum præcepisset viro qui indutus erat lineis, dicens: Sume ignem de medio, et de inter rotas cherubim: ingressus ille stetit juxta rotam.
verses.english: So when He had given the command to the man clothed in linen, saying: “Take fire from the midst, specifically from among the wheels of the cherubim,” the man then entered and stood beside one of the wheels.

verses.latin: Et extendit cherub manum suam de medio cherubim ad ignem, qui erat inter cherubim: et sumpsit, et dedit in manus ejus qui indutus erat lineis: qui accipiens egressus est.
verses.english: Then a cherub reached out his hand from among the cherubim to the fire that was located between them. He took some of the fire and placed it into the hands of the man who was clothed in linen. The man received it and then went out.

verses.latin: Et apparuit in cherubim quasi manum hominis subter alas eorum.
verses.english: And it was seen on the cherubim that there was what looked like a human hand under their wings.

verses.latin: Et vidi, et ecce quatuor rotæ juxta cherubim, rota una juxta cherub unum, et rota alia juxta cherub aliud: et species rotarum quasi visio lapidis chrysolithi.
verses.english: And I looked, and behold, there were four wheels positioned beside the cherubim — one wheel next to each cherub. The appearance of these wheels was like the sparkling vision of a chrysolite stone.

verses.latin: Et aspectus earum unus quadrigæ erat: quasi si esset rota in medio rotæ.
verses.english: All four wheels had the same integrated appearance, like a single divine chariot, as if one wheel were set within another.

verses.latin: Cum pergerent, per quatuor partes gradiebantur: et non convertebantur in eundo: sed ad locum ad quem primus impulsus erat, ceteri sequebantur, nec vertebantur.
verses.english: When the wheels moved, they went in their four primary directions without needing to turn as they moved. Rather, wherever the first wheel was impulsed to go, the others followed, maintaining their orientation.

verses.latin: Et omne corpus earum, et colla, et manus, et pennæ, et ipsæ rotæ, plena erant oculis in circuitu, quatuor rotarum.
verses.english: And their entire bodies, including their backs, their hands, their wings, and the very wheels of all four of them, were completely full of eyes all around, signifying divine knowledge and omnipresence.

verses.latin: Istæ sunt rotæ, quas audieram appellari volubiles.
verses.english: These are the same wheels which I had previously heard being called 'the whirling ones' — implying constant motion and intricate design.

verses.latin: Et quatuor facies habebat unum cherub: facies una, facies cherub: et facies secunda, facies hominis: et in tertio, facies leonis: et in quarto, facies aquilæ.
verses.english: And each cherub had four distinct faces: one face was the face of a cherub (which means it had the form of a winged bull); the second face was the face of a man; the third face was the face of a lion; and the fourth face was the face of an eagle.

verses.latin: Et elevata sunt cherubim ipsa est enim animal, quod videram juxta flumen Chobar.
verses.english: And the cherubim themselves were then lifted up. For this was the very same type of living creature that I had seen earlier by the Chebar River.

verses.latin: Et cum incederent cherubim, movebantur et rotæ juxta ea: et cum elevassent cherubim alas suas, ut elevarentur de terra, nec rotæ eadem ratione mutabantur.
verses.english: And when the cherubim moved forward, the wheels also moved alongside them. When the cherubim lifted up their wings to rise from the earth, the wheels, in the same synchronized manner, did not change their relative position but ascended with them.

verses.latin: Cum starent, stabant: et cum elevarentur, elevabantur simul: quia spiritus vitæ erat in eis.
verses.english: When the cherubim stood still, the wheels also stood still. When the cherubim ascended, the wheels ascended along with them simultaneously. This perfect coordination was because the spirit of life, a divine animating force, was in both the creatures and the wheels.

verses.latin: Et egressa est gloria Domini a limine templi, et stetit super cherubim.
verses.english: And the glory of the Lord, God's manifest presence, then moved out from the threshold of the Temple itself and came to rest upon the cherubim.

verses.latin: Et elevantes cherubim alas suas, et rotas juxta se, sunt elevata de terra, et abierunt: et stetit in introitu portæ domus Domini orientalis, et gloria Dei Israël erat super ea.
verses.english: And the cherubim lifted their wings, and the wheels alongside them, and they were lifted up from the earth and departed. Then the entire manifestation of God's glory stood at the entrance of the eastern gate of the Lord's Temple, and the radiant glory of the God of Israel was positioned over them.

verses.latin: Ipsa est animal, quam vidi subter Deum Israël juxta flumen Chobar: et intellexi quia cherubim erant.
verses.english: This was the very same living creature that I had seen beneath the glorious manifestation of the God of Israel by the Chebar River. And at that moment, I finally understood that these creatures were cherubim.

verses.latin: Quatuor facies uni, et quatuor alæ uni: et similitudo manuum hominis subter alas eorum.
verses.english: Each cherub had four faces, and each had four wings. And there was the appearance of human hands under their wings.

verses.latin: Et similitudo faciei eorum, ipsæ facies, quas videram juxta flumen Chobar, et introitus et ipsi. Singuli a facie sua proficiscebantur.
verses.english: And the likeness of their faces was indeed the same faces that I had seen by the Chebar River. Their manner of moving and their very presence were unchanged. Each of them moved straight forward, according to the direction of its face.

verses.latin: Et levavit me spiritus, et introduxit me ad portam domus Domini orientalem, quae respicit solis ortum: et ecce in introitu portae quinque et viginti viri: et vidi in medio eorum Jazaniam filium Azur, et Pheltiam filium Banaiae principes populi.
verses.english: Then God's Spirit lifted me up, and in this prophetic vision, carried me to the eastern gate of the Lord’s Temple, the one facing the rising sun. And there, at the entrance of the gate, were twenty-five men. Among them, I saw Jazania, the son of Azur, and Pheltya, the son of Banaiah; these were prominent leaders among the people.

verses.latin: Et dixit ad me: Fili hominis, hi sunt viri qui cogitant scelus, et inchoant urbi consilium nequam.
verses.english: And the Lord said to me: “Son of Man, these are the very men who plot evil and devise wicked schemes against this city, Jerusalem.”

verses.latin: Dicentes: Numquid non in propinquo sunt domus aedificandae? haec est lebes, nos autem carnes.
verses.english: They boast, saying: ‘Isn't it true that new houses are to be built soon? This city is like a protective cooking pot, and we are the choice meat, safe inside it!’

verses.latin: Propterea vaticinare super eos, vaticinare fili hominis.
verses.english: Therefore, Son of Man, prophesy against them! Declare God's judgment upon them!

verses.latin: Et irruit in me spiritus Domini, et dixit ad me: Loquere: Haec dicit Dominus: Sic locuti estis domus Israël, et cogitationes cordis vestri ego scio.
verses.english: Then the Spirit of the Lord rushed upon me, and He commanded me: “Speak! This is what the Lord says: O house of Israel, indeed, these are the words you have spoken. And I know every secret thought of your hearts!”

verses.latin: Plures occidistis interfectos in urbe hac, et implestis vias ejus interfectis.
verses.english: “You have murdered many people in this city, filling its streets with the slain bodies of your victims.”

verses.latin: Propterea haec dicit Dominus Deus: Interfecti vestri quos posuistis in medio ejus, hi sunt carnes, et haec est lebes: et educam vos de medio ejus, ait Dominus Deus.
verses.english: “Therefore, this is what the Lord God says: The corpses of those you have murdered and left in the city — *they* are the 'meat' in the 'pot' (Jerusalem). And as for you, I will forcefully remove you from this city,” declares the Lord God.

verses.latin: Gladius attulistis, et gladium inducam super vos, ait Dominus Deus.
verses.english: “You have brought the sword of violence upon others, and now I will bring the sword of judgment upon you,” declares the Lord God.

verses.latin: Et ejiciam vos de medio ejus, et dabo vos in manu hostium, et faciam in vobis judicia.
verses.english: “I will drive you out from the midst of Jerusalem, and I will hand you over to your enemies, and I will execute my divine judgments against you.”

verses.latin: Gladio cadetis, in finibus Israël judicabo vos, et scietis quia ego Dominus.
verses.english: “You will fall by the sword. I will carry out my judgment against you within the very borders of Israel, so that you will know with certainty that I am the Lord.”

verses.latin: Haec non erit vobis in lebetem, et vos non eritis in medio ejus carnes, in finibus Israël judicabo vos:
verses.english: “Indeed, Jerusalem will not be a protective pot for you, nor will you be safe meat within it. I will execute judgment against you within the borders of Israel.”

verses.latin: et scietis quia ego Dominus: quia in praeceptis meis non ambulastis, et judicia mea non fecistis, sed juxta judicia gentium quae in circuitu vestro sunt, fecistis.
verses.english: “And then you will know that I am the Lord. For you have not lived according to My commands, nor have you performed My judgments. Instead, you have acted according to the wicked practices of the surrounding pagan nations.”

verses.latin: Et factum est cum prophetarem, Pheltiam filium Banaiae mortuum. Et cecidi in faciem meam, et clamavi voce magna, et dixi: Heu, heu, heu, Domine Deus, complere tu facis reliquias Israël?
verses.english: It happened that as I was prophesying, Pheltya, the son of Banaiah, suddenly died. Overwhelmed, I fell on my face and cried out with a loud voice: “Oh, alas, alas, Lord God! Are You going to completely destroy the small remnant of Israel that remains?”

verses.latin: Et factus est sermo Domini ad me, dicens:
verses.english: Then the word of the Lord came to me, saying:

verses.latin: Fili hominis, fratres tui, fratres tui viri propinqui tui, et omnis domus Israël universa, quibus dixerunt habitatores Jerusalem: Longe facite vos a Domino: nobis data est terra in possessionem.
verses.english: “Son of Man, your brothers, your own relatives, and the entire house of Israel who are in exile — these are the ones about whom the inhabitants of Jerusalem arrogantly declared: ‘Stay far away from the Lord! This land has been given exclusively to *us* as our possession!’”

verses.latin: Propterea haec dicit Dominus Deus: Quia longe feci eos in gentibus, et quia dispersi eos in terris, et ero eis in sanctificationem parvulam in terris ad quas venerunt.
verses.english: “Therefore, this is what the Lord God says: Although I have sent them far away among the nations, and even though I have scattered them throughout various lands, I will nonetheless be a sacred dwelling for them — a little sanctuary, a place of holiness — in the very lands where they have been sent as exiles.”

verses.latin: Propterea loquere: Haec dicit Dominus Deus: Congregabo vos de populis, et colligam vos de terris in quibus dispersi vos, et dabo vobis terram Israël.
verses.english: “Therefore, speak to them and say: This is what the Lord God says: I will gather you from among the peoples, and I will bring you together from the lands where I have scattered you, and I will restore to you the land of Israel.”

verses.latin: Et ingredientur illuc, et auferent omnes offensiones ejus, et universas abominationes ejus de illa.
verses.english: “And when they return to that land, they will remove all its detestable idols and all its abominable practices from it.”

verses.latin: Et dabo eis cor unum, et spiritum novum tribuam in visceribus eorum: et auferam cor lapideum de carne eorum, et dabo eis cor carneum:
verses.english: “And I will give them a unified heart, and I will place a new spirit within their innermost beings. I will take away their heart of stone from their flesh and give them a heart of flesh, one that is responsive to Me.”

verses.latin: ut in praeceptis meis ambulent, et judicia mea custodiant, et faciant ea: et sint mei populus, et ego sim eis Deus.
verses.english: “I will do this so that they may live according to My commands, observe My judgments, and actually do them. In this way, they will truly be My people, and I will truly be their God.”

verses.latin: Quorum cor post offendicula et abominationes suas ambulat, viam eorum in caput eorum reddam, ait Dominus Deus.
verses.english: “But as for those whose hearts persist in following their detestable idols and abominable practices, I will bring their own sinful ways down upon their own heads,” declares the Lord God.

verses.latin: Et elevaverunt cherubim alas suas, et rotae cum eis, et majestas Dei Israël super erat super ea.
verses.english: Then the cherubim lifted their wings, and the chariot wheels moved with them, and the majestic glory of the God of Israel was still above them.

verses.latin: Et ascendit majestas Domini de medio civitatis, et stetit super montem, qui est ad orientem urbis.
verses.english: And the glorious presence of the Lord ascended from the midst of the city, and then it stood above the mountain located to the east of the city — which is the Mount of Olives.

verses.latin: Et spiritus levavit me, et introduxit me in Chaldæam ad transmigrationem in visione spiritus Dei: et sublata est a me visio quam videram.
verses.english: Then the Spirit lifted me up again and, in a vision from God's Spirit, brought me back to Chaldea, where the exiles lived. And after this, the vision I had seen was removed from me.

verses.latin: Et locutus sum ad transmigrationem omnia verba Domini, quae ostenderat mihi.
verses.english: And I immediately spoke to the exiled people all the words of the Lord which He had revealed to me.

verses.latin: Et factum est verbum Domini ad me dicens:
verses.english: Then the Lord spoke to me directly.

verses.latin: Fili hominis, in medio domus exasperantis tu habitas, qui oculos habent ut videant, et non vident: et aures habent ut audiant, et non audiunt: quia domus exasperans est.
verses.english: Son of Man, you are living among a truly rebellious people. They have eyes to see what I am doing, but they refuse to see, and they have ears to hear my words, but they refuse to listen, because they are a rebellious people.

verses.latin: Tu ergo, fili hominis, para tibi vasa transmigrationis, et transmigrabis per diem in conspectu eorum: et transmigrabis de loco tuo ad locum alterum in conspectu eorum, si forte aspiciant quia domus exasperans est.
verses.english: Therefore, Son of Man, gather your belongings as if preparing for exile. During the daytime, in their full sight, you are to leave your home and go to another place, as if going into exile. Perhaps by doing this, they will finally see and understand that they are a rebellious people.

verses.latin: Et efferes vasa tua quasi vasa transmigrantis per diem in conspectu eorum: tu autem egressus in vesperam in conspectu eorum, sicut egreditur migrans.
verses.english: Then, in their sight, you are to bring out your belongings, as if you are someone going into exile during the day. But then, as evening falls, you yourself are to go out, in their sight, just as a person goes into exile.

verses.latin: Perfode tibi parietem in conspectu eorum, et egredieris per eum.
verses.english: While they watch, dig a hole through the wall of your house, and go out through it.

verses.latin: In tenebris in conspectu eorum efferes in humero, in nocte egredieris, et facies tuum velabitur, et non videbis terram: quia portentum te dedi domui Israel.
verses.english: Carry your belongings out on your shoulder in the dark, in their sight. You will go out into the night, and your face will be covered so you cannot see the land. I am making you a prophetic sign for the people of Israel.

verses.latin: Feci ergo sicut praeceperat mihi: Vasa mea efferebam quasi vasa transmigrantis per diem, et vespere perfodi mihi parietem manu: et egressus sum in tenebris, in humero portabam in conspectu eorum.
verses.english: So I did exactly as the Lord commanded me. During the day, I brought out my baggage as if I were going into exile. Then, as evening came, I used my hands to dig a hole through the wall of my house. In the dark, I went out, carrying my belongings on my shoulder, all in their full sight.

verses.latin: Et factum est verbum Domini ad me mane, dicens:
verses.english: The next morning, the Lord spoke to me again.

verses.latin: Fili hominis, numquid non dixerunt tibi domus Israel, domus exasperans: Quid tu facis?
verses.english: Son of Man, didn't the rebellious people of Israel ask you, 'What are you doing?'

verses.latin: Dic ad eos: Haec dicit Dominus Deus: Onus istud in Jerusalem, et omni domui Israel, quae est in medio eorum.
verses.english: Tell them: 'This is what the Lord God declares: This prophetic action concerns Jerusalem and all the people of Israel who live within it.'

verses.latin: Dic: Ego portentum vestrum: sicut feci, sic fiet illis: in migratione et in captivitate ducentur.
verses.english: Say this: 'I, Ezekiel, am a sign to you. Just as I have acted, so it will happen to them: they will be led away into exile and captivity.'

verses.latin: Et dux qui est in medio eorum, in humero portabit, et in tenebris egredietur: parietem perfodiet ut escas efferat per eum: facies ejus velabitur, et terram non videbit oculis suis.
