verses.english: The leader among them, the king, will carry his belongings on his shoulder and go out in the dark. He will dig a hole through the wall to bring his provisions out through it. His face will be covered, so he will not see the land with his own eyes.

verses.latin: Et expandam rete meum super eum, et comprehendetur in cassibus meis: et inducam eum in Babylonem, terram Chaldaeorum, et ipsam non videbit, et ibi morietur.
verses.english: I will spread my net over him, and he will be caught in my traps. I will lead him to Babylon, the land of the Chaldeans. Even though he will arrive there, he will not see that land with his own eyes, and there he will die.

verses.latin: Et omnes qui circa eum sunt, praesidium ejus, et omnes turmas ejus dispergam in omnem ventum: et gladium evaginabo post eos.
verses.english: And all who are around him, his personal guard, and all his troops, I will scatter to every direction of the wind. I will draw a sword and pursue them.

verses.latin: Et scient quia ego Dominus, cum dispergam eos in gentes, et ventilem illos in terras.
verses.english: Then they will know that I am the Lord, when I scatter them among the nations and disperse them across many lands.

verses.latin: Et relinquam ex eis viros paucos a gladio, et fame, et peste: ut narrent omnia scelera eorum in gentibus ad quas ingredientur: et scient quia ego Dominus.
verses.english: But I will spare a few of them from death by sword, famine, and plague. These survivors will then confess all their wicked deeds among the nations where they are scattered. In doing so, they will know that I am the Lord.

verses.latin: Et factum est verbum Domini ad me dicens:
verses.english: Then the Lord spoke to me again, saying:

verses.latin: Fili hominis, panem tuum in conturbatione comedes, et aquam tuam in perturbatione et sollicitudine bibes.
verses.english: Son of Man, you must eat your bread with trembling, and drink your water with shaking and deep anxiety.

verses.latin: Et dices ad populum terrae: Haec dicit Dominus Deus ad eos qui habitant in Jerusalem in terra Israel: Panem suum in sollicitudine comedent, et aquam suam in desolatione bibent: ut desoletur terra a multitudine sua, propter iniquitatem omnium qui habitant in ea.
verses.english: Then you are to say to the people of the land: 'This is what the Lord God declares to those who live in Jerusalem, in the land of Israel: They will eat their bread with anxiety and drink their water in utter desolation. This will happen so that the land becomes desolate, emptying itself of its many inhabitants, because of the wickedness of all who live there.'

verses.latin: Et civitates inhabitatae desolabuntur, et terra inculta erit: et scietis quia ego Dominus.
verses.english: All the inhabited cities will become desolate, and the land itself will turn into an uncultivated wilderness. Then you will know that I am the Lord.

verses.latin: Et factum est verbum Domini ad me dicens:
verses.english: Again, the Lord's word came to me:

verses.latin: Fili hominis, quod est proverbium istud vobis in terra Israel dicentium: In longum tempus, et periit omnis visio?
verses.english: Son of Man, what is this proverb that you have among you in the land of Israel, that says: 'The days drag on, and every prophetic vision turns out to be false'?

verses.latin: Propterea dic ad eos: Haec dicit Dominus Deus: Quiescere faciam proverbium istud, neque ultra dicetur in Israel: et loquere ad eos: Quoniam prope est dies, et sermo omnis visionis.
verses.english: Therefore, tell them: 'This is what the Lord God declares: I will put an end to this proverb, and it will no longer be spoken in Israel. Instead, tell them: The day of fulfillment is drawing near, and so is the outcome of every prophetic vision.'

verses.latin: Non enim erit ultra omnis visio mendax, et divinatio fallax in medio filiorum Israel.
verses.english: For there will no longer be any false visions or misleading divinations among the children of Israel.

verses.latin: Quoniam ego Dominus loquar: et quodcumque locutus fuero, verbum implebitur, et non prolongabitur ultra: in diebus enim vestris, domus exasperans, loquar verbum, et faciam illud, ait Dominus Deus.
verses.english: For I am the Lord, and what I speak will come to pass. My word will be fulfilled, and there will be no further delay. Indeed, in your lifetime, you rebellious people, I will speak my word, and I will bring it to pass, declares the Lord God.

verses.latin: Et factum est verbum Domini ad me dicens:
verses.english: Once more, the Lord's word came to me:

verses.latin: Fili hominis, ecce dicunt domus Israel: Visio quam hic videt, in dies multos, et in tempora longa prophetat iste.
verses.english: Son of Man, listen to what the people of Israel are saying: 'The vision this man Ezekiel sees is for a distant future, and he prophesies about events far off in time!'

verses.latin: Propterea dic ad eos: Haec dicit Dominus Deus: Non prolongabitur ultra omnis sermo meus, et verbum, quod locutus fuero, implebitur, ait Dominus Deus.
verses.english: Therefore, tell them: 'This is what the Lord God declares: None of my words will be delayed any longer. Every word I have spoken will be fulfilled, declares the Lord God.'

verses.latin: Et factus est sermo Domini ad me, dicens:
verses.english: God's message then came to me, saying:

verses.latin: Fili hominis, propheta ad prophetas Israël, qui prophetant: propheta, et dices his qui prophetant ex corde suo: Audite verbum Domini.
verses.english: "Son of man, prophesy against the prophets of Israel who are prophesying right now. Prophesy and say to those who prophesy from their own thoughts and desires, not from God: 'Listen to the message of the Lord!'"

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Væ prophetis insipientibus, qui sequuntur spiritum suum, et nihil vident.
verses.english: "Thus says the Lord God: Woe to the foolish prophets who follow only their own thoughts and desires and see no true vision from God!"

verses.latin: Quasi vulpes in desertis, prophetæ tui, Israël, erant.
verses.english: "Your prophets, O Israel, are like scavenging foxes in empty ruins."

verses.latin: Non ascendistis ex adverso, neque opposuistis murum pro domo Israël, ut staret in prælio in die Domini.
verses.english: "You have not risen up to face the enemy, nor have you built a protective wall for the house of Israel, so that it might stand firm in battle on the day of the Lord's judgment."

verses.latin: Vana viderunt, et divinantes mendacium, dicentes: Ait Dominus, cum Dominus non misisset eos: et perseveraverunt firmare sermonem.
verses.english: "They have seen false visions and divined lies, claiming, 'Thus says the Lord,' when the Lord had not sent them. Yet they persisted in trying to make their own deceptive words come true."

verses.latin: Numquid non visionem vanam vidistis, et divinationem mendacem locuti estis, dicentes: Ait Dominus, cum ego non sim locutus vobis?
verses.english: "Have you not seen false visions and spoken lying divinations, saying, 'Thus says the Lord,' when I myself have not spoken to you?"

verses.latin: Propterea hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Quia locuti estis vana, et vidistis mendacium, idcirco ecce ego ad vos, dicit Dominus Deus.
verses.english: "Therefore, thus says the Lord God: Because you have spoken falsehoods and seen lying visions, behold, I am against you, says the Lord God."

verses.latin: Et erit manus mea super prophetas qui vident vana, et divinant mendacium: in concilio populi mei non erunt, et in scriptura domus Israël non scribentur, et in terram Israël non ingredientur: et scietis quia ego Dominus Deus.
verses.english: "My hand will be upon the prophets who see false visions and divine lies. They will not be included in the assembly of My people, nor will their names be recorded in the register of the house of Israel, and they will not enter the promised land of Israel. Then you will know that I am the Lord God."

verses.latin: Eo quod deceperint populum meum, dicentes: Pax, et non est pax: et ipse ædificabit parietem, illi autem linient eum luto absque stipulis.
verses.english: "This is because they have deceived My people, constantly proclaiming, 'Peace!' when there is no true peace. And when the people attempt to build a weak wall for protection, these prophets plaster it over with flimsy mortar that has no straw, making it even weaker."

verses.latin: Dic ad eos qui liniunt absque stipulis, quod casurus sit: erit enim imber inundans, et dabo lapides grandinis irruentes desuper, et spiritum tempestatum dissipantem.
verses.english: "Tell those who plaster with flimsy mortar that their wall will collapse! For I will send a torrential downpour, and I will unleash great hailstones from above, and a violent, scattering storm wind."

verses.latin: Ecce si ceciderit paries, numquid non dicetur vobis: Ubi est litura quam linistis?
verses.english: "When the wall collapses, will people not then ask you, 'Where is the shoddy plaster you used?'"

verses.latin: Propterea hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Et effundam spiritum iræ meæ in imbre inundante, et lapides grandinis in furore complente, et spiritum procellarum in perditione.
verses.english: "Therefore, thus says the Lord God: I will pour out My wrath like a torrential flood, and My fury will bring forth hailstones that consume everything, and a destructive storm wind."

verses.latin: Et dissipabo parietem quam linistis absque stipulis, et dejiciam eum in terram, et revelabitur fundamentum ejus: et corruet, et consumentini vos in medio ejus: et scietis quia ego Dominus.
verses.english: "I will tear down the wall you plastered with flimsy mortar, bringing it crashing to the ground. Its very foundation will be exposed, and when it falls, you yourselves will be crushed in its rubble. Then you will know that I am the Lord."

verses.latin: Et complebo iram meam in pariete, et in his qui liniunt eum absque stipulis: et dicam vobis: Non est paries, et non sunt qui liniunt eum.
verses.english: "I will completely spend My wrath upon the wall and upon those who plastered it with flimsy mortar. Then I will declare to you: 'There is no wall left, and there are no plasterers either!'"

verses.latin: Prophetæ Israël, qui prophetant ad Jerusalem, et vident ei visionem pacis, et non est pax, dicit Dominus Deus.
verses.english: "These are the prophets of Israel who prophesy to Jerusalem, who see visions of peace for her when, in fact, there is no peace," says the Lord God.

verses.latin: Et tu, fili hominis, pone faciem tuam contra filias populi tui, quæ prophetant de corde suo: et propheta ad illas,
verses.english: "And you, son of man, set your face against the women of your people who prophesy from their own thoughts and desires. Prophesy against them!"

verses.latin: et dices: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Væ quæ consuunt pulvillos sub omni cubito manus, et faciunt cervicalia sub capite universæ ætatis ad capiendas animas: cum caperent animas populi mei, et vivificarent animas suas.
verses.english: "And say: 'Thus says the Lord God: Woe to those who sew magic armbands for every wrist and make special head-coverings for people of every age, all in order to ensnare souls! They trap the souls of My people, while ensuring their own souls prosper."

verses.latin: Et violabatis me ad populum meum propter pugillum hordeii, et fragmen panis, ut interficeretis animas quæ non moriuntur, et vivificaretis animas quæ non vivunt, mentientes populo meo credenti mendaciis.
verses.english: "You have profaned My holy name before My people for a mere handful of barley and a few crumbs of bread. You put to death those souls who were not destined to die, and you promise life to those souls who were not destined to live, all by lying to My people who readily believe your falsehoods."

verses.latin: Propter hoc hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Ecce ego ad pulvillos vestros, quibus vos capitis illic animas volantes: et scindam illos de brachiis vestris, et dimittam animas quas vos cepistis, animas volantes.
verses.english: "Therefore, thus says the Lord God: Behold, I am against your magic armbands with which you ensnare souls like flying birds! I will tear them from your arms and release the souls you have trapped, those souls meant to be free."

verses.latin: Et scindam cervicalia vestra, et liberabo populum meum de manu vestra, neque erunt ultra in manu vestra ad prædandum: et scietis quia ego Dominus.
verses.english: "I will also tear apart your special head-coverings and deliver My people from your power. They will no longer be prey in your hands. Then you will know that I am the Lord."

verses.latin: Eo quod mœrere fecistis cor justi mendaciter, quem ego non contristavi: et confortastis manus impii, ut non reverteretur de via sua mala, et viveret.
verses.english: "This is because you have falsely made the heart of the righteous sad, those whom I Myself had not intended to grieve. And you have strengthened the hands of the wicked, encouraging them not to turn back from their evil ways and repent to live."

verses.latin: Propterea vana non videbitis ultra, et divinationes non facietis in posterum: et eruam populum meum de manu vestra, et scietis quia ego Dominus.
verses.english: "Therefore, you will no longer see false visions or practice divination in the future. I will rescue My people from your power. Then you will truly know that I am the Lord."

verses.latin: Et venerunt ad me viri de senioribus Israël, et sederunt coram me.
verses.english: And then, men from the elders of Israel came to me, and they sat down before me.

verses.latin: Et factum est verbum Domini ad me, dicens:
verses.english: And the word of the Lord came to me, saying:

verses.latin: Fili hominis, viri isti posuerunt idola sua in cordibus suis, et scandalum iniquitatis suæ statuerunt contra faciem suam: numquid interrogatus respondebo eis?
verses.english: Son of man, these men have cherished their idols deep within their hearts, and they have placed the stumbling block of their sins directly before themselves. So, when they come to inquire of Me, should I even answer them?

verses.latin: Propter hoc loquere eis, et dices ad eos: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Homo, homo de domo Israël, quicumque posuerit idola sua in corde suo, et scandalum iniquitatis suæ statuerit contra faciem suam, et venerit ad prophetam interrogans per me: Ego Dominus respondebo ei secundum multitudinem idolorum ejus,
verses.english: Therefore, speak to them, and tell them: 'This is what the Lord God says: Any man, any man from the house of Israel, who cherishes his idols in his heart, and places the stumbling block of his sins directly before himself, and then comes to a prophet to inquire of Me—I, the Lord, will answer him, but My answer will be a judgment fitting the multitude of his idols.'

verses.latin: ut apprehendam domum Israël in cordibus suis, quæ recessit a me in idolis suis universis.
verses.english: I will do this to catch the house of Israel by their own hearts, for they have all strayed far from Me because of their idols.

verses.latin: Propterea dic ad domum Israël: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Convertimini, et recedite ab idolis vestris, et abominationibus vestris avertite facies vestras:
verses.english: Therefore, say to the house of Israel: 'This is what the Lord God says: Repent and turn away from your idols! Turn your faces away from all your detestable practices!'

verses.latin: quia omnis homo de domo Israël, et de advenis qui peregrinantur apud vos, si se separaverit a me, et posuerit idola sua in corde suo, et scandalum iniquitatis suæ statuerit contra faciem suam, et venerit ad prophetam ut interroget per me: Ego Dominus respondebo ei per me.
verses.english: For every man from the house of Israel, and even any foreigner who lives among you, if he separates himself from Me and cherishes his idols in his heart, and places the stumbling block of his sins directly before himself, and then comes to a prophet to inquire of Me—I, the Lord, will answer him directly by Myself.

verses.latin: Et ponam faciem meam super hominem illum, et faciam eum in signum et in proverbium: et disperdam illum de medio populi mei, et scietis quia ego Dominus.
verses.english: And I will set My face against that man, and I will make him an example and a warning. I will cut him off from the midst of My people, and then you shall know that I am the Lord.

verses.latin: Prophetam quoque cum erraverit, et locutus fuerit verbum, ego Dominus decepi prophetam illum: et extendam manum meam super eum, et delebo eum de medio populi mei Israël.
verses.english: And if a prophet is deceived and speaks a false word, it is because I, the Lord, have allowed that prophet to be led astray, as a judgment upon the inquirer. And I will stretch out My hand against that prophet and destroy him from the midst of My people Israel.

verses.latin: Et portabunt iniquitatem suam, secundum iniquitatem interrogantis, secundum iniquitatem prophetæ erit.
verses.english: So they will bear their guilt. The guilt of the prophet will be the same as the guilt of the one who inquired of him, because both were in sin.

verses.latin: ut non erret ultra domus Israël a me, neque polluatur ultra in omnibus iniquitatibus suis: sed sit eis in populum, et ego sim eis in Deum, ait Dominus exercituum.
verses.english: This is so that the house of Israel may no longer stray from Me, and no longer defile themselves with all their sins. Instead, they shall be My people, and I will be their God, says the Lord of hosts.

verses.latin: Et factum est verbum Domini ad me, dicens:
verses.english: And the word of the Lord came to me again, saying:

verses.latin: Fili hominis, terra cum peccaverit mihi, ut prævaricetur præceptum, et extendam manum meam super eam, et conteram in ea virgam panis, et immittam in eam famem, et interficiam de ea hominem et jumentum:
verses.english: Son of man, when a land sins against Me by breaking My commandments and committing a serious trespass, I will stretch out My hand against it. I will break its supply of food, bringing famine upon it, and I will cut off from it both man and beast.

verses.latin: et fuerint tres viri isti in medio ejus, Noë, Daniel et Job: ipsi justitia sua liberabunt animas suas, ait Dominus exercituum.
verses.english: Even if these three righteous men—Noah, Daniel, and Job—were in the midst of that land, they would only deliver their own souls by their righteousness, says the Lord of hosts.

verses.latin: Si et bestias pessimas induxero super terram, ut vastem illam, et fuerit deserta, eo quod non sit qui transeat propter bestias:
verses.english: If I bring savage beasts upon that land to devastate it, and it becomes so desolate that no one can pass through because of the wild animals,

verses.latin: tres isti viri si fuerint in medio ejus, vivo ego, dicit Dominus Deus, quoniam filios et filias non liberabunt: ipsi soli liberabuntur, hæc autem desolabitur.
verses.english: even if these three men were in its midst—as I live, says the Lord God—they would save neither sons nor daughters. Only they themselves would be delivered, but the land would be utterly laid waste.

verses.latin: Sive induxero super terram gladium, et dixero: Gladius, transi per terram: et interficiam de ea hominem et jumentum:
verses.english: Or if I bring a sword upon that land, and command it, saying: 'Sword, sweep through the land!'—and I cut off from it both man and beast,

verses.latin: et tres isti viri fuerint in medio ejus, vivo ego, dicit Dominus Deus, non liberabunt filios et filias, sed ipsi soli salvabuntur.
verses.english: even if these three men were in its midst—as I live, says the Lord God—they would save neither sons nor daughters, but only they themselves would be delivered.

verses.latin: Sive immisero pestilentiam super terram illam, et effudero indignationem meam super eam in sanguine, ut interficiam de ea hominem et jumentum:
verses.english: Or if I send a devastating plague upon that land, and pour out My fury upon it with bloodshed, cutting off from it both man and beast,

verses.latin: et Noë et Daniel et Job fuerint in medio ejus, vivo ego, dicit Dominus Deus, filium et filiam non liberabunt: sed ipsi justitia sua liberabunt animas suas.
verses.english: even if Noah, Daniel, and Job were in its midst—as I live, says the Lord God—they would save neither son nor daughter. Only they themselves, by their righteousness, would deliver their own souls.

verses.latin: Quia hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Quin potius cum quatuor judicia mea pessima, gladium, et famem, et bestias malas, et pestilentiam, misero super Jerusalem, ut interficiam de ea hominem et jumentum:
verses.english: For this is what the Lord God says: 'How much worse will it be when I send My four most severe judgments—the sword, and the famine, and the savage beasts, and the plague—upon Jerusalem, to cut off from it both man and beast?'

verses.latin: tamen in ea salvabuntur reliquiæ, qui educentur ex ea filii et filiæ: ecce ipsi ingredientur ad vos, et videbitis viam eorum et opera eorum: et consolabimini super malo quod induxi super Jerusalem, in omnibus quæ induxi super eam.
verses.english: Yet, a remnant will be saved in it—sons and daughters who will be brought out from Jerusalem. Behold, they will come out to you, and you will see their wicked ways and their evil deeds. Then you will find comfort concerning the disaster I have brought upon Jerusalem, concerning all that I have brought upon it.

verses.latin: Et consolabimini, cum videritis vias eorum et opera eorum: et scietis quia non frustra feci omnia quæ feci in ea, ait Dominus Deus.
verses.english: You will be comforted when you see their ways and their deeds, and you will know that I did not bring all of this upon Jerusalem for no reason, says the Lord God.

verses.latin: Et factus est sermo Domini ad me, dicens:
verses.english: And the word of the Lord came to me, saying:

verses.latin: Fili hominis, quid est lignum vitis super omnia ligna silvarum, traducta palmitis inter ligna saltuum?
verses.english: “Son of man, what is the wood of a vine worth compared to all other trees of the forest? What is a branch from a vine among the trees of the groves? The Lord asks this to highlight its lack of inherent value.

verses.latin: Numquid tolletur de eo lignum, ut fiat opus? aut sumetur de eo paxillus, ut pendeat in eo quodlibet vas?
verses.english: Can wood be taken from it to make anything useful? Or can a peg be taken from it to hang any vessel upon it? The answer is no, because vine wood is weak and unsuitable for construction or support.

verses.latin: Ecce igni datum est in escam: ignis consumpsit utraque ejus extrema, et medietas ejus succensa est: numquid utile erit in opus?
verses.english: Look, it is given to the fire as fuel. The fire consumes both of its ends, and its middle is scorched. Will any of it be useful for work then? No, it only serves to burn.

verses.latin: Etiam cum esset integrum, non erat aptum ad opus aliquod: quanto magis cum illud ignis devoraverit, et fuerit succensum, nihil ex eo fiet in opus?
verses.english: Even when it was whole and unburnt, it wasn't suitable for any work. How much less will anything useful be made from it after the fire has consumed it and it has been scorched? Nothing at all.

verses.latin: Propterea haec dicit Dominus Deus: Sicut lignum vitis inter ligna silvarum, quod dedi igni in escam, sic tradam habitatores Jerusalem.
verses.english: Therefore, thus says the Lord God: Just as the wood of the vine among the trees of the forest is given to the fire as fuel, so will I hand over the inhabitants of Jerusalem. They are like useless vine wood, destined for destruction due to their unfruitfulness.

verses.latin: Et ponam faciem meam in eos: de igne egressi sunt, et ignis consumet eos: et scietis quia ego Dominus, cum posuero faciem meam in eos.
verses.english: And I will set my face against them, meaning my judgment will be upon them. Though they have escaped some previous judgment or disaster, another fire will consume them completely. And you will know that I am the Lord when I have set my face against them in judgment.

verses.latin: Et dabo terram inviam et desolatam, eo quod praevaricatores fuerint, dicit Dominus Deus.
verses.english: And I will make their land an impassable and desolate wilderness, because they have been unfaithful and rebellious against my covenant,” says the Lord God.

verses.latin: Factum est verbum Domini ad me, dicens:
verses.english: Then the word of the Lord came to me, saying:

verses.latin: Fili hominis, ostende Ierusalem abominationes suas,
verses.english: “Son of man, show Jerusalem its detestable actions,

verses.latin: et dices: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus ad Ierusalem: Radix tua, et generatio tua de terra Chanaan: pater tuus Amorrhæus, et mater tua Hetthæa.
verses.english: and say, ‘These are the words of the Lord God to Jerusalem: “Your origins and your family come from the land of Canaan. Your father was an Amorite, and your mother was a Hittite.”

verses.latin: In nativitate tua, in die qua nata es, non est umbilicus tuus præcisus, nec lavata es aqua in salutem, nec sale salita, nec pannis involuta.
verses.english: “At the time of your birth, on the day you were born, your umbilical cord wasn't cut, and you weren't washed clean with water to make you healthy, nor were you salted to cleanse you, nor were you wrapped in cloths.

verses.latin: Oculus nullus compunctus est super te ad faciendum tibi unum ex his, misertus tui: sed projecta es in faciem agri, in contemptum animæ tuæ in die nativitatis tuæ.
verses.english: “No one looked upon you with pity, to do any of these things for you. No one had mercy on you. Instead, you were thrown out in a field on the day you were born, despised because you were a child.

verses.latin: Et transivi super te, et vidi te conculcatam in sanguine tuo: et dixi tibi: In sanguine tuo vive! dixi tibi: In sanguine tuo vive!
verses.english: “As I passed by you, I saw you trampled in your own blood. And I said to you, ‘Live!’ I said to you, ‘Live!’

verses.latin: Et multiplicavi te quasi germen agri: et crevit, et multiplicata es, et venisti in decorem mulierum: ubera tua creverunt, et capilli tui coaluerunt: et nuda eras, et confusa.
verses.english: “I caused you to grow like a plant of the field. You grew and became great. You attained the beauty of a woman, and your breasts developed, and your hair grew. But you were naked and ashamed.

verses.latin: Et transivi super te, et vidi te, et ecce tempus tuum tempus dilectionum: et extendi pallium meum super te, et operui ignominiam tuam: et juravi tibi, et ingressus sum pactum tecum, dicit Dominus Deus: et facta es mea.
verses.english: “Then I passed by you again and saw that it was the time of love. I spread my cloak over you and covered your nakedness, and I swore an oath to you and entered into a covenant with you,” says the Lord God. “And so you became mine.

verses.latin: Et lavavi te aqua, et expuli sanguinem tuum de te, et unxi te oleo.
verses.english: “Then I washed you with water and washed away your blood. I anointed you with oil.

verses.latin: Et circumdedi te variis coloribus, et calceavi te de hyacintho, et cinxi te bysso.
verses.english: “I clothed you with embroidered cloth, and I put sandals of fine leather on your feet, and I wrapped you in fine linen.

verses.latin: Et ornavi te monilibus, et dedi armillas manibus tuis, et torquem gutturi tuo.
verses.english: “I adorned you with jewelry and put bracelets on your arms and a necklace around your neck.

verses.latin: Et dedi in naso tuo annulum, et in auribus tuis circulos, et coronam decoris in capite tuo.
verses.english: “I put a ring in your nose and earrings on your ears and a beautiful crown on your head.

verses.latin: Et orata es auro et argento, et vestita bysso et serico, et amictu picturarum: et comedisti similam, et mel, et oleum: et pulchra es facta valde, et prosperata es in regnum.
verses.english: “You were adorned with gold and silver, and your clothing was of fine linen, silk, and embroidered cloth. You ate fine flour, honey, and oil. You became exceedingly beautiful, and you advanced to the position of queen.

verses.latin: Et exivit fama tua in gentibus pro pulchritudine tua: quia perfecta eras in decore meo, quem posueram super te, dicit Dominus Deus.
verses.english: “Your fame spread among the nations because of your beauty. It was perfect because of my splendor that I had bestowed on you,” says the Lord God.

verses.latin: Tu autem confisa es in decore tuo, et fornicata es in fama tua, et effudisti fornicationem tuam super omnem transeuntem: data es illis.
verses.english: “But you were confident in your beauty, and you played the prostitute because of your fame. You poured out your prostitution on every passerby, and you gave yourself to them.

verses.latin: Et sumpsisti vasa decoris tui de auro et argento meo, quæ dedi tibi, et fecisti tibi imagines masculinas, et fornicata es in eis.
verses.english: “You took your jewelry of gold and silver, which I had given you, and made male images and committed prostitution with them.

verses.latin: Et tulisti vestimenta varietatis tuæ, et operuisti ea: et oleum meum et incensum meum posuisti coram eis.
verses.english: “You took the clothing I had given you and covered them with it. You set my oil and my incense before them.

verses.latin: Et panem meum, quem dedi tibi, similam et oleum et mel, quibus pascebam te, posuisti coram eis in odorem suavitatis: et factum est, dicit Dominus Deus.
verses.english: “And you set before them the bread I gave you, the fine flour, oil, and honey that I fed you, as a soothing fragrance. It happened,” says the Lord God.

verses.latin: Et accepisti filios tuos et filias tuas, quos genueras mihi, et immolasti ea illis ad devorandum: parumne est fornicationem tuam?
verses.english: “You took your sons and daughters, whom you had borne to me, and sacrificed them to them to be devoured. Was your prostitution too little?

verses.latin: Et occidisti filios meos, et tradidisti eos, consecrans illos, et dedisti eos illis.
verses.english: “You slaughtered my sons and gave them to them, consecrating them, giving them over to them.

verses.latin: Et in fornicationibus tuis non es memorata antiquitatis tuæ, quando eras parva, et nuda, et volutabaris in sordibus sanguinis tui.
verses.english: “In all your acts of prostitution, you didn’t remember your days as a child, when you were naked and rolling in your own blood.

verses.latin: Et post omnes abominationes tuas, et fornicationes tuas, non es recordata dierum adolescentiæ tuæ, quando eras nuda et confusa, et volutabaris in sanguine tuo.
verses.english: “After all your abominations and acts of prostitution, you did not remember the days of your youth, when you were naked and ashamed, rolling in your blood.

verses.latin: Et factum est, post omnem malitiam tuam (væ, væ tibi! dicit Dominus Deus):
verses.english: “And it happened, after all your wickedness (woe, woe to you!), says the Lord God,

verses.latin: ædificasti tibi lupanar, et fecisti tibi excelsa in omni platea.
verses.english: “that you built yourself a brothel and made yourself a high place in every street.

verses.latin: In omni via ædificasti caput tuum, et deturpastisti decorem tuum, et dilatasti pedes tuos omni transeunti, et multiplicasti fornicationes tuas.
verses.english: “At every crossroads, you built a head, and you defiled your beauty and spread your legs to every passerby, and you multiplied your acts of prostitution.

verses.latin: Et fornicata es cum filiis Ægypti, vicinis tuis, magnis carnibus, et multiplicasti fornicationem tuam ad irritandum me.
verses.english: “You committed prostitution with the Egyptians, your neighbors, whose bodies were large, and you multiplied your prostitution, provoking me.

verses.latin: Quapropter ecce, ego extendam manum meam super te, et diminuam victum tuum, et tradam te in voluntatem filiarum tuarum, quæ oderunt te, et auferam te.
verses.english: “Therefore, behold, I will stretch out my hand against you and reduce your allowance. I will give you over to the will of your daughters, who hate you. I will take you away.

verses.latin: Et tradam te in manu eorum, et subvertent lupanar tuum, et destruent excelsa tua: et exuent te vestimentis tuis, et tollent vasa decoris tui, et relinquent te nudam, et confusam.
verses.english: “And I will hand you over to them, and they will tear down your brothel and destroy your high places. They will strip you of your clothes and take away your jewelry, and they will leave you naked and ashamed.

verses.latin: Et revelabo ignominiam tuam, et fornicationem tuam, et stultitiam tuam: et deducam te cum dedecore, et dabo te in manum eorum.
verses.english: “I will expose your nakedness and your prostitution and your foolishness. I will bring you down in disgrace and hand you over to them.

verses.latin: Et faciam hæc tibi, quoniam fornicata es cum gentibus, et contaminata es in idolis eorum.
verses.english: “I will do these things to you because you have committed prostitution with the nations and have defiled yourself with their idols.

verses.latin: In via sororis tuæ ambulasti: et dabo calicem ejus in manu tua.
verses.english: “You have walked in the way of your sister, and I will put her cup into your hand.”

verses.latin: Quæ bibisti calicem sororis tuæ, profundum et latum: et facta es in risum, et subsannationem, continens non capiens.
verses.english: “You drank the cup of your sister, which was deep and wide. And you became an object of laughter and mockery, unable to hold yourself back.

verses.latin: Plena es ebrietate et dolore: calix fratris tui, qui datus est tibi a Domino.
verses.english: “You were filled with drunkenness and sorrow. It is the cup of your brother that was given to you by the Lord.

verses.latin: Et biberis illum, et exhauries eum: et frusta comminues, et ubera tua confringes: quia oblita es mei, dicit Dominus Deus.
verses.english: “You will drink from it and drain it. You will crush the fragments, and you will break your breasts, because you have forgotten me,” says the Lord God.

verses.latin: Ideo ego quoque dedi te in manu eorum, quos oderas, propterea quod spreveras me.
verses.english: “Therefore, I have also given you into the hands of those you hated, because you despised me.

verses.latin: Cum ergo venerint ad te, et accipiant te, facient in te omnia opera sua, et filios tuos, et filias tuas tolent: et occident te gladio, et relinquant te famosam, et opera fornicationis tuæ in te perficient.
verses.english: “When they come to you, and take you, they will do all their works on you and take away your sons and daughters, and they will kill you with the sword, and leave you famous, and they will carry out your acts of prostitution on you.

verses.latin: Et judicabo te secundum judicia adulterarum, et effundent sanguinem tuum in furore, et in zelo.
verses.english: “And I will judge you according to the judgments of adulteresses and will pour out your blood in fury and zeal.

verses.latin: Et tradam te in manum eorum, et destruent lupanar tuum, et demolientur excelsa tua: et exuent te vestimentis tuis, et tollent vasa decoris tui, et relinquant te nudam et confusam.
verses.english: “And I will hand you over to them, and they will tear down your brothel and demolish your high places. They will strip you of your clothes and take away your jewelry, and they will leave you naked and ashamed.

verses.latin: Et facient in te hæc, in odio, et furoris zelo: et auferent te, et relinquent te in deserto nudam.
verses.english: “And they will do these things to you in hatred and with the zeal of fury, and they will take you away and leave you naked in the wilderness.

verses.latin: Et ascendent super te multitudinem, et lapidibus te oppriment, et confringent te: et gladiis tuis interficient te.
verses.english: “They will bring up a crowd against you, and they will stone you and crush you, and they will kill you with their swords.

verses.latin: Et succendent domos tuas igni, et facient in te judicia coram oculis mulierum multarum: et quiescere faciam te a fornicationibus tuis, et dabis ultra munera, non dabis amplius.
verses.english: “They will burn your houses with fire and execute judgments against you in the sight of many women, and I will cause you to cease your prostitution, and you will no longer give gifts.

verses.latin: Et quiescere faciam indignationem meam in te: et aemulatio mea recedet a te, et quiescam, nec irascar amplius.
verses.english: “Then I will satisfy my wrath against you, and my jealousy will depart from you, and I will be at rest, and I will no longer be angry.

verses.latin: Quia non es recordata dierum adolescentiæ tuæ, sed incitasti me in omnibus, propterea ecce ego et ego quoque viam tuam retribuo in caput tuum, dicit Dominus Deus: quia non es operata scelus super omnia abominationes tuas.
verses.english: “Because you did not remember the days of your youth but enraged me in all things, therefore, behold, I, even I, will repay your way upon your head,” says the Lord God, “because you have not committed wickedness above all your abominations.

verses.latin: Ecce omnis qui profert proverbium, proferet super te dicens: Qualis mater, talis et filia.
verses.english: “Behold, everyone who utters a proverb will utter it about you, saying, ‘Like mother, like daughter.’”

verses.latin: Filia matris tuæ tu es, quæ reliquit virum suum, et filios suos: et soror fratrum tuorum tu es, qui reliquerunt viros suos, et filios suos: mater vestra Hetthæa, et pater vester Amorrhæus.
verses.english: “You are the daughter of your mother, who abandoned her husband and her sons, and you are the sister of your brothers, who abandoned their husbands and their sons. Your mother was a Hittite, and your father an Amorite.

verses.latin: Et soror tua major Samaria, ipsa et filiæ ejus, quæ habitant ad sinistram tuam: et soror tua minor, quæ habitat ad dextram tuam, Sodoma et filiæ ejus.
verses.english: “Your elder sister is Samaria, who lives with her daughters to your left, and your younger sister, who lives to your right, is Sodom and her daughters.

verses.latin: Et non es ambulata in viis earum, nec fecisti secundum abominationes eorum, quasi parum hoc tibi, sed quoniam corrupisti plus illis in omnibus viis tuis.
verses.english: “You did not walk in their ways, nor did you do according to their abominations, but it was as if that were too little for you, but you have corrupted more than them in all your ways.

verses.latin: Vivo ego, dicit Dominus Deus, quia non fecit soror tua Sodoma, ipsa et filiæ ejus, sicut fecisti tu, et filiæ tuæ.
verses.english: “As I live,” says the Lord God, “your sister Sodom and her daughters have not done what you and your daughters have done.

verses.latin: Hoc enim fuit iniquitas sororis tuæ Sodomæ: superbia, saturitas, et otium ipsi et filiæ ejus, et manum pauperis et egeno non sustinuerunt.
verses.english: “For this was the iniquity of your sister Sodom: pride, fullness of bread, and idleness were in her and in her daughters, and they did not support the hand of the poor and the needy.

verses.latin: Et superbi sunt, et fecerunt abominationem coram me, et abstuli eas sicut vidisti.
verses.english: “They were haughty and committed abominations before me. So I took them away, as you have seen.

verses.latin: Et Samaria non est commissa dimidio peccatis tuis: multiplicasti enim abominationes tuas plus illis, et justificasti sorores tuas in omnibus abominationibus tuis quas fecisti.
verses.english: “And Samaria has not committed even half of your sins. You have multiplied your abominations more than they did, and you have justified your sisters in all your abominations that you have done.

verses.latin: Tu ergo porta confusionem tuam, quæ judicasti sorores tuas: in peccatis tuis, quibus pepercisti eis, plus quam illæ justæ sunt.
verses.english: “Therefore, bear your shame, since you have judged your sisters. In your sins, which you spared them, they are more righteous than you.

verses.latin: Sed et tu porta confusionem tuam, quæ judicasti sorores tuas: in peccatis tuis, quibus pepercisti eis, plus quam illæ justæ sunt: ut justifices sorores tuas, cum peccaveris, quæ et tu eris in ignominia, quæ et portasti eas.
verses.english: “But you also bear your shame, since you have judged your sisters. In your sins, which you spared them, they are more righteous than you, so that you may justify your sisters when you have sinned, and you will be in disgrace, since you have borne them.”

verses.latin: Convertere itaque, et tu porta confusionem tuam, in eo quod justificasti sorores tuas.
verses.english: “Therefore, turn back, and bear your shame for justifying your sisters.

verses.latin: Et sorores tuæ, Sodoma et filiæ ejus, revertentur ad antiquitatem suam: et Samaria et filiæ ejus, revertentur ad antiquitatem suam: et tu, et filiæ tuæ, revertemini ad antiquitatem vestram.
verses.english: “And your sisters, Sodom and her daughters, will return to their former state, and Samaria and her daughters will return to their former state, and you and your daughters will return to your former state.

verses.latin: Et non fuit os sororis tuæ Sodomæ in ore tuo in die superbiæ tuæ,
verses.english: “And your sister Sodom did not even speak in your mouth on the day of your pride,

verses.latin: antequam revelaretur malitia tua, sicut in tempore contumeliæ filiarum Syriæ, et omnium quæ sunt in circuitu ejus, filiarum Philisthinorum, quæ circumdederunt te per circuitum.
verses.english: before your wickedness was revealed, as in the time of the insults of the daughters of Syria, and all those who are around her, the daughters of the Philistines, who surrounded you all around.

verses.latin: Fornicationem tuam et abominationes tuas tu portasti, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: “You have borne your prostitution and your abominations,” says the Lord.

verses.latin: Quia hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Faciam tibi sicut fecisti, quæ sprevisti juramentum, et irritum fecisti pactum.
verses.english: “For these are the words of the Lord God: ‘I will deal with you as you have done, since you have despised the oath and broken the covenant.

verses.latin: Et recordabor pacti mei tecum in diebus adolescentiæ tuæ, et statuam tibi pactum æternum.
verses.english: “‘Yet I will remember my covenant with you in the days of your youth, and I will establish an eternal covenant with you.

verses.latin: Et recordaberis viarum tuarum, et confunderis, cum acceperis sorores tuas, majores et minores: et dabo eas tibi in filias, sed non in pactum tuum.
verses.english: “‘Then you will remember your ways and be ashamed when you receive your sisters, both older and younger, and I will give them to you as daughters, but not as a covenant with you.

verses.latin: Et ego statuam pactum meum tecum: et scies quia ego Dominus,
verses.english: “‘And I will establish my covenant with you, and you will know that I am the Lord,

verses.latin: ut recorderis, et confundaris, et non aperias os tuum præ confusione tua, cum propitiavero tibi in cunctis quæ fecisti, dicit Dominus Deus.
verses.english: so that you will remember and be ashamed and never open your mouth again because of your shame, when I have forgiven you for all you have done,’” says the Lord God.

verses.latin: Et factum est verbum Domini ad me, dicens:
verses.english: The Lord spoke to me, saying:

verses.latin: Fili hominis, propone aenigma, et narra parabolam ad domum Israël,
verses.english: “Son of man, speak a riddle, and tell a parable to the house of Israel,

verses.latin: et dices: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Aquila grandis, magnarum alarum, longo volatu, plena plumis et varietate, venit ad Libanum, et tulit cedrum:
verses.english: And say, 'The Lord God says this: A great eagle with great wings, a long flight, full of feathers and varied colors, came to Lebanon, and took a cedar:

verses.latin: summitatem ramorum ejus fregit, et detulit illud in terram Chanaan, et misit illud in urbem negotiatorum.
verses.english: He broke off the top of its branches, and brought it to the land of Canaan, and placed it in the city of merchants.'

verses.latin: Et tulit de semine terræ, et misit illud in terram iniquitatis, et posuit illud quasi salictum aquarum.
verses.english: He took from the seed of the land, and put it in a land of iniquity, and placed it like a willow by the waters.

verses.latin: Et germinavit, et crevit in vineam humili staturae, et directis ad eam radicibus, et propagavit palmites ejus in eam:.
verses.english: And it sprouted, and grew into a vine of low stature, and its roots turned towards it, and it sent out its branches toward it.

verses.latin: Erat ergo aquila magna, habens magnas alas, et crinitas, et plena plumis, quæ veniebat de Libano: et tulit cedrum.
verses.english: There was therefore a great eagle, having large wings, and many hairs, and full of feathers, which came from Lebanon: and took the cedar.

verses.latin: In vineam bonam juxta aquas multas posuit illud, ut faciat ramulos, et portet fructum, et sit in ea vitis generosa.
verses.english: He placed it in a good vine near many waters, to make branches, and bear fruit, and to be a noble vine.

verses.latin: Dic: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Ergo prosperabitur? Nonne radices ejus evellet, et fructum ejus auferet, et arefaciet? In omnibus gemmæ germinis ejus arescunt, et non in magna virtute, nec in multitudine populi, ut evelleret eam radicitus.
verses.english: Say, 'The Lord God says this: Will it then prosper? Will he not uproot its roots, and take away its fruit, and wither it? All the buds of its germination will wither, and not with great strength, nor with a multitude of people, to uproot it by the roots.

verses.latin: Ecce, plantata est: numquid prosperabitur? Nonne cum tetigerit eam ventus urens, omnino arescet, et in areis germinis ejus arescet?
verses.english: Behold, it is planted: will it prosper? Will it not, when the scorching wind touches it, utterly wither, and in the fields of its germination wither?'

verses.latin: Et factum est verbum Domini ad me, dicens:
verses.english: The word of the Lord came to me, saying:

verses.latin: Dic ad domum iniquitatis: Nescitis quid ista significent? Dic: Ecce venit rex Babylonis in Jerusalem, et assumpsit regem ejus, et principes ejus, et adduxit eos secum in Babylonem.
verses.english: Say to the house of iniquity: Do you not know what these things mean? Say: Behold, the king of Babylon came to Jerusalem, and took its king and its princes, and brought them with him to Babylon.

verses.latin: Et tulit de semine regni, et pepigit cum eo pactum, et accepit ab eo juramentum, sed et potentes terræ abstulit:
verses.english: And he took from the seed of the kingdom, and made a covenant with him, and received an oath from him, but he also removed the powerful of the land:

verses.latin: ut esset regnum humile, et non levaret se, sed custodiret pactum ejus, et servaret illud.
verses.english: So that the kingdom would be humble, and would not exalt itself, but keep its covenant, and observe it.

verses.latin: Qui recessit ab eo, et misit legatos suos in Ægyptum, ut daret ei equos et multam plebem: numquid prosperabitur, et effugiet qui hæc facit? Et qui dissolvit pactum, evadet?
verses.english: Who departed from him, and sent his messengers to Egypt, to give him horses and much people: will he prosper, and escape who does these things? Will he who has broken the covenant escape?

verses.latin: Vivo ego, dicit Dominus Deus, quia in loco regis, qui constituit eum, spreverat eum, et dissolvit pactum ejus, quod pepigit cum eo: in medio Babylonis morietur.
verses.english: As I live, says the Lord God, because in the place of the king who established him, he despised him, and broke his covenant, which he made with him: in the midst of Babylon he will die.

verses.latin: Et non in exercitu magno, nec in populo multo, sed morietur in bello, et spargentur reliquiæ ejus in omnem ventum: et non in hoc erit fortitudo ejus.
verses.english: And not in a great army, nor in a large people, but he will die in war, and his remains will be scattered in every wind: and in this will not be his strength.

verses.latin: Et contempsit juramentum, ut dissolveret pactum, et ecce dedit manum suam, et fecit omnia hæc: non evadet.
verses.english: And he despised the oath, that he might break the covenant, and behold, he has given his hand, and done all these things: he will not escape.

verses.latin: Propterea hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Vivo ego, quia juramentum meum, quod sprevit, et pactum meum, quod trans gressus est, dabo in caput ejus.
verses.english: Therefore, the Lord God says this: As I live, because my oath, which he despised, and my covenant, which he transgressed, I will put on his head.

verses.latin: Et extendam super eum rete meum, et capietur in sagitta mea: et adducam eum in Babylonem, et judicabo ibi super eum in iniquitate qua prævaricatus est in me.
verses.english: And I will spread my net over him, and he will be caught in my arrow: and I will bring him to Babylon, and I will judge him there for the iniquity by which he has transgressed against me.

verses.latin: Et omnes profugos ejus, cum universa manu ejus, gladio cadent, et qui reliqui fuerint, in omnem ventum dispergentur: et scietis quia ego Dominus locutus sum.
verses.english: And all his fugitives, with all his hand, will fall by the sword, and those who remain will be scattered in every wind: and you will know that I the Lord have spoken.

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Et sumam ego de summitate cedri sublimis, et ponam: de vertice ramorum ejus tenerum, et frangam, et plantabo super montem excelsum et eminentem.
verses.english: The Lord God says this: And I will take from the top of the high cedar, and plant: from the top of its branches a tender one, and I will break, and I will plant it on a high and eminent mountain.

verses.latin: In monte excelso Israël plantabo illud: et faciet ramos, et portabit fructum, et erit in eo cedrus magnifica: et habitabunt sub eo omnes volucres, universum volatile sub umbra ramorum ejus nidificabit.
verses.english: On the high mountain of Israel I will plant it: and it will make branches, and bear fruit, and it will be a magnificent cedar: and all the birds will dwell under it, every flying thing will nest under the shadow of its branches.

verses.latin: Et scient omnia ligna regionis, quia ego Dominus humiliavi lignum sublime, et exaltavi lignum humile: et siccavi lignum viride, et fructificare feci lignum aridum. Ego Dominus, qui feci, et faciam.
verses.english: And all the trees of the region will know that I the Lord have humbled the high tree, and exalted the low tree: and I have dried up the green tree, and caused the dry tree to bear fruit. I the Lord have done it, and I will do it.

verses.latin: Factum est verbum Domini ad me, dicens:
verses.english: The Word of the Lord came to me, and said:

verses.latin: Quid est vobis quod parabolam istam utimini in terra Israel, dicentes: Patres comederunt uvam acerbam, et dentes filiorum obstupuerunt?
verses.english: “Why do you keep using this proverb in the land of Israel, saying: ‘The parents ate sour grapes, and the children’s teeth are on edge’?

verses.latin: Vivo ego, dicit Dominus Deus, quia non erit vobis ultra proverbium istud in Israel.
verses.english: “As I live, says the Lord God, this proverb will no longer be used by you in Israel.

verses.latin: Ecce omnes animae meae sunt: sicut anima patris, ita et anima filii mea est: anima quae peccaverit, ipsa morietur.
verses.english: “Behold, all souls are Mine: as the soul of the father, so also the soul of the son is Mine: the soul that sins shall die.

verses.latin: Vir autem si fuerit justus, et fecerit judicium et justitiam:
verses.english: “Now if a man is just, and does what is right:

verses.latin: qui in montibus non comederit, et oculos suos non levaverit ad idola domus Israel, et uxorem proximi sui non violaverit, et ad mulierem menstruatam non accesserit:
verses.english: “He doesn’t eat on the mountains, and doesn’t lift his eyes to the idols of the house of Israel, and doesn’t violate the wife of his neighbor, and doesn’t go to a menstruating woman:

verses.latin: et virum non contristaverit, foenus non acceperit et usuram non sumpserit: a iniquitate manum suam averterit, judicium verum fecerit inter virum et virum:
verses.english: “He doesn’t hurt any man, doesn’t take interest, and doesn’t take usury; he turns his hand from iniquity, and executes true judgment between man and man:

verses.latin: in praeceptis meis ambulaverit, et judicia mea custodierit, ut faciat veritatem, ipse justus est: vita vivet, dicit Dominus Deus.
verses.english: “He walks in My precepts, and keeps My judgments, to do what is true, he is just: he shall live, says the Lord God.

verses.latin: Si autem genuerit filium latronem, effundentem sanguinem, et facientem aliquid ex his:
verses.english: “But if he has begotten a son who is a robber, who sheds blood, and does any of these things:

verses.latin: et qui aliquid horum fecerit, et omne quod frater ejus non fecit, et simul cum his comederit in montibus, et uxorem proximi sui violaverit:
verses.english: “Who does any of these things, and does everything that his brother did not do, and who eats with these on the mountains, and violates the wife of his neighbor:

verses.latin: pauperem et mendicum contristaverit, rapinam vi extorserit, pignus non reddiderit, et ad idola oculos levaverit, et abominationem fecerit:
verses.english: “He oppresses the poor and the needy, violently extorts plunder, does not restore the pledge, and lifts his eyes to idols, and commits abomination:

verses.latin: foenus dederit et usuram acceperit: numquid vivet iste? Non vivet: cum haec cuncta patraverit, morte morietur, sanguis ejus super ipsum erit.
verses.english: “He has given interest and taken usury: shall he live? He shall not live: since he has done all these things, he shall die; his blood shall be upon himself.

verses.latin: Porro si genuerit filium, qui viderit omnia peccata patris sui, quae ipse fecit, et non faciat similia illis:
verses.english: “But if he has begotten a son, who sees all the sins of his father that he has done, and does not do the like:

verses.latin: qui super montibus non comederit, et oculos suos non levaverit ad idola domus Israel, et uxorem proximi sui non violaverit:
verses.english: “Who does not eat on the mountains, and does not lift his eyes to the idols of the house of Israel, and does not violate the wife of his neighbor:

verses.latin: et virum non contristaverit, et pignus non rapuerit, et rapinam non extorserit, et esuriem suam dederit esurienti, et panem suum pauperibus tribuerit:
verses.english: “He does not hurt any man, and does not take a pledge, and does not violently extort plunder, and gives his food to the hungry, and gives his bread to the poor:

verses.latin: a iniquitate manum suam averterit, foenus non acceperit et usuram non sumpserit: judicia mea fecerit, in praeceptis meis ambulaverit: iste in iniquitate patris sui non morietur, vita vivet.
verses.english: “He turns his hand from iniquity, does not take interest and does not take usury: he does My judgments, and walks in My precepts: this one shall not die for the iniquity of his father; he shall live.

verses.latin: Pater enim in iniquitate sua mortuus est: filius autem fecit judicium et justitiam, vitam vivet.
verses.english: “For the father died in his iniquity: but the son did judgment and justice, he shall live.

verses.latin: Et vos dicitis: Quare non portavit filius iniquitatem patris sui? Filius fecit judicium et justitiam: omnia praecepta mea custodivit, et fecit ea: vita vivet.
verses.english: “And you say: ‘Why does not the son bear the iniquity of his father?’ The son did judgment and justice: he has kept all My commandments, and done them: he shall live.

verses.latin: Anima quae peccaverit, ipsa morietur: filius non portabit iniquitatem patris, et pater non portabit iniquitatem filii: justitia justi cum eo erit, et impietas impii cum eo erit.
verses.english: “The soul that sins shall die: the son shall not bear the iniquity of the father, and the father shall not bear the iniquity of the son: the justice of the just shall be with him, and the wickedness of the wicked shall be with him.

verses.latin: Si autem impius egerit poenitentiam de omnibus peccatis suis, quae operatus est, et custodierit omnia praecepta mea, et fecerit judicium et justitiam, vita vivet: non morietur.
verses.english: “But if the wicked man does penance for all his sins that he has committed, and keeps all My commandments, and does judgment and justice, he shall live: he shall not die.

verses.latin: Omnium iniquitatum ejus quas operatus est, non recordabor: in justitia sua quam operatus est, vivet.
verses.english: “I will not remember all his iniquities that he has committed: in his justice which he has done, he shall live.

verses.latin: Numquid voluntatis meae est mors impii, dicit Dominus Deus, et non ut convertatur a viis suis, et vivat?
verses.english: “Do I desire the death of the wicked, says the Lord God, and not that he be converted from his ways, and live?

verses.latin: Quod si averterit se justus a justitia sua, et fecerit iniquitatem, juxta omnes abominationes quas operatur impius, numquid vivet? Omnium justitiarum ejus quas fecerat, non memorabor: in praevaricatione qua praevaricatus est, et in peccato quo peccavit, in his morietur.
verses.english: “But if the just man turns away from his justice, and commits iniquity, according to all the abominations that the wicked man does, shall he live? I will not remember all his justices that he has done: in the prevarication with which he has prevaricated, and in the sin with which he has sinned, in these shall he die.

verses.latin: Et dixistis: Non est aequa via Domini. Audite ergo domus Israel: numquid via mea non est aequa? magis viae vestrae non sunt aequae.
verses.english: “And you say: ‘The way of the Lord is not equitable.’ Hear now, house of Israel: is not My way equitable? Rather, your ways are not equitable.

verses.latin: Cum enim averterit se justus a justitia sua, et fecerit iniquitatem, morietur in eis: in iniquitate quam operatus est, morietur.
verses.english: “For when the just man turns away from his justice, and commits iniquity, he shall die in them: in the iniquity that he has committed, he shall die.

verses.latin: Et cum se averterit impius a impietate sua quam operatus est, et fecerit judicium et justitiam, ipse animam suam vivificabit.
verses.english: “And when the wicked man turns away from his wickedness which he has committed, and does judgment and justice, he shall save his soul alive.

verses.latin: Quia vidit et secessit a omnibus iniquitatibus suis quas operatus est, vita vivet: non morietur.
verses.english: “Because he sees and withdraws from all his iniquities which he has committed, he shall live: he shall not die.

verses.latin: Et dixit domus Israel: Non est aequa via Domini. Numquid viis meis non sunt aequae, domus Israel? An non viis vestris potius iniquae?
verses.english: “And the house of Israel said: ‘The way of the Lord is not equitable.’ Are not My ways equitable, house of Israel? Rather, are not your ways wicked?

verses.latin: Ideo ego secundum vias vestras judicabo vos, domus Israel, dicit Dominus Deus. Convertimini, et agite poenitentiam ab omnibus iniquitatibus vestris, et non erit vobis in ruinam iniquitas.
verses.english: “Therefore I will judge you according to your ways, house of Israel, says the Lord God. Turn back and do penance from all your iniquities, and iniquity shall not be to you for ruin.

verses.latin: Proiicite a vobis omnes iniquitates vestras, in quibus praevaricati estis, et facite vobis cor novum et spiritum novum: et quare vultis mori, domus Israel?
verses.english: “Cast away from yourselves all your iniquities in which you have prevaricated, and make for yourselves a new heart and a new spirit: and why do you want to die, house of Israel?

verses.latin: Nolo enim mortem ejus qui moritur, dicit Dominus Deus: convertimini, et vivite.
verses.english: “For I do not want the death of him who dies, says the Lord God: turn back, and live.

verses.latin: Quia nolo mortem morientis, dicit Dominus Deus. Convertimini itaque, et vivite.
verses.english: “Because I do not want the death of him that is dying, says the Lord God. Therefore be converted, and live.

verses.latin: Tu autem sume lamentationem super principem Israël.
verses.english: You should begin a funeral song for the leaders of Israel.

verses.latin: Et dices: Quid mater tua leaena inter leones! in medio leonum cubavit, in leonibus enutrivit catulos suos.
verses.english: Then say: What kind of mother was your leader, a lioness among other lions! She laid down among lions. She raised up her cubs among the lions.

verses.latin: Et eduxit unum ex eis, et factus est leo: et didicit capere praedam, et comedere hominem.
verses.english: One of her cubs became a lion, and learned to kill and devour humans.

verses.latin: Et audierunt de eo gentes, et in fouea eorum adductus est: et duxerunt eum in compedibus in terram Aegypti.
verses.english: The nations heard about him. He was caught in their trap. They led him in chains to the land of Egypt.

verses.latin: Vidensque mater sua quod expectasset, et perisset spes eius, tulit alium de catulis suis, et fecit eum leonem.
verses.english: When his mother saw that her hopes were lost, she took another cub of hers and made him a lion.

verses.latin: Qui cum ambularet inter leones, didicit capere praedam, et comedere homines.
verses.english: This one lived among lions, learned to kill, and devoured humans.

verses.latin: Et coepit diripere civitates eorum, et desolare regiones: et vastata est terra, et plenitudo eius, a voce rugitus eius.
verses.english: He began to tear down cities and destroy the lands. The land and its people were laid waste by his roaring.

verses.latin: Et congregatae sunt adversus eum gentes de circuitu provinciarum, et expanderunt super eum rete suum: et captus est in fouea eorum.
verses.english: The nations around him gathered against him, and spread their net over him. He was caught in their trap.

verses.latin: Et miserunt eum in caveam in compedibus, et adductus est in regem Babylonis: ut non audiretur vox eius ultra in montibus Israël.
verses.english: They put him in a cage, in chains, and brought him to the king of Babylon, so that his voice would never be heard again on the mountains of Israel.

verses.latin: Mater tua sicut vinea in sanguine tuo plantata est juxta aquas: fructus eius et rami eius venerunt ex aquis plurimis.
verses.english: Your mother was like a vine, planted near the waters. She produced many shoots because she was by many waters.

verses.latin: Et facti sunt virgae eius fortes in virga regum, et exaltata est celsitudo eius usque ad cacumen, et elevatus est in ramis suis.
verses.english: Her strongest branches became the scepters of kings. Her height was exalted to the heavens, and she was raised up among her branches.

verses.latin: Et projecta est in iram, et conculcata est terra, et ductus est fructus eius in ventum: rami eius aridi sunt, et confracti sunt. Ignis comedit eos.
verses.english: But she was cast down in anger. The land was trampled, and her fruit was carried away by the wind. Her branches withered and broke, and fire consumed them.

verses.latin: Et nunc plantata est in deserto, in terra absque aqua: et egressus est ignis de virga ramorum eius, et comedit fructum eius: non est in ea virga fortis ad sceptrum regni.
verses.english: Now she is planted in the desert, in a land without water. Fire has come out of her branches and consumed her fruit. There is no strong branch left for a scepter of a kingdom.

verses.latin: Lamentatio: et erit in lamentationem.
verses.english: This is a funeral song; it shall become a funeral song.

verses.latin: Factum est autem in septimo anno, in quinto, mensis decimi, venit verbum Domini ad me, dicens:
verses.english: In the seventh year, in the fifth month, on the tenth day, the Lord spoke to me, saying:

verses.latin: Fili hominis, pone faciem tuam contra Pharaonem regem Aegypti, et propheta adversus eum, et contra omnem Aegyptum.
verses.english: “Son of man, direct your face toward Pharaoh, the king of Egypt, and prophesy against him and against all of Egypt.

verses.latin: Loquere, et dices: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Ecce ego contra te Pharao rex Aegypti, draco magnus, qui cubas in fluminibus tuis, et dicis: Flumen meum est, et ego feci me.
verses.english: Speak, and say: Thus says the Lord God: Behold, I am against you, Pharaoh, king of Egypt, the great dragon that lies in the midst of your rivers, that says: ‘My river is my own, and I have made myself.’

verses.latin: Quia dixi: Flumen meum est, et ego feci me: idcirco ego dabo frenos in maxillis tuis, et alligabo pisces fluminum tuorum squamis tuis, et educam te de medio fluminum tuorum, et omnem pisces fluminum tuorum squamis tuis alligabo.
verses.english: Because you said: ‘The river is mine, and I have made myself,’ therefore, I will put hooks in your jaws, and I will cause the fish of your rivers to stick to your scales, and I will bring you up out of the midst of your rivers, and all the fish of your rivers will stick to your scales.

verses.latin: Et projiciam te in solitudinem, te et omnem piscem fluminum tuorum: in faciem agri cades, non colligeris, neque congregeris. Bestiis terrae et avibus caeli dedi te ad devorandum te.
verses.english: And I will cast you into the wilderness, you and all the fish of your rivers: you shall fall upon the face of the field, and you shall not be gathered, nor taken up. To the beasts of the earth and to the birds of the sky, I have given you to be devoured.

verses.latin: Et scient omnes habitatores Aegypti, quia ego Dominus: eo quod factus sis baculus instar harundinis domui Israël.
verses.english: And all the inhabitants of Egypt shall know that I am the Lord: because you have been a staff of reed to the house of Israel.

verses.latin: Quando apprehenderunt te manu, confractus es, et lacerasti omnem humerum eorum: et quando innitebantur super te, contritus es, et solvens omne renium eorum.
verses.english: When they took hold of you with the hand, you broke, and you tore all their shoulder: and when they leaned on you, you broke, and shattered all their loins.

verses.latin: Idcirco hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Ecce ego adducam super te gladium, et auferam de te homines et jumenta.
verses.english: Therefore, thus says the Lord God: Behold, I will bring a sword upon you, and I will cut off from you man and beast.

verses.latin: Et erit terra Aegypti in solitudinem, et in desertum: et scient quia ego Dominus, quando posuero ignem in Aegypto, et contriti fuerint omnes auxiliatores ejus.
verses.english: And the land of Egypt shall be desolate and waste: and they shall know that I am the Lord, when I have set a fire in Egypt, and all her helpers are destroyed.

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Ecce ego adducam gladium Nabuchodonosor regis Babylonis super Aegyptum.
verses.english: Thus says the Lord God: Behold, I will bring the sword of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon upon Egypt.

verses.latin: Et manus ejus et manus populi ejus cum eo, fortium populorum: ad disperdendum eam.
verses.english: And the hand of him and the hand of his people with him, of the strong peoples: to destroy it.

verses.latin: Et gladios fortium gladium, et conteram superbiam Aegypti: et disperdam omnem multitudinem ejus.
verses.english: And the swords of the mighty will I cause to fall, and I will crush the pride of Egypt: and I will destroy all its multitude.

verses.latin: Et perdam omnem jumentam ejus a multis aquis: et non eris ultra audax in pedibus hominis.
verses.english: And I will destroy all its beasts from the many waters: and it shall no longer be bold in the foot of man.

verses.latin: Et dabo terram Aegypti desolatam, et vastitatem, a turre Syenes, usque ad terminos Aethiopiae.
verses.english: And I will make the land of Egypt desolate and waste, from the tower of Syene, even to the borders of Ethiopia.

verses.latin: Et dabo ignem in Aegypto: contristabitur vehementer, et dispergentur, et corruent in gladio.
verses.english: And I will set fire in Egypt: it shall be greatly grieved, and dispersed, and shall fall by the sword.

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Et dissipabo Aegyptum per manum Nabuchodonosor regis Babylonis, et fortium populorum cum eo.
verses.english: Thus says the Lord God: And I will scatter Egypt by the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and of the mighty peoples with him.

verses.latin: Ipse et populi cum eo, potentiores gentium, ad perdendum terram: et evaginabunt gladios suos contra Aegyptum, et implebunt terram interfectorum.
verses.english: He and the people with him, the more powerful of the nations, to destroy the land: and they shall draw their swords against Egypt, and fill the land with the slain.

verses.latin: Et faciam flumina sicca, et tradam terram in manu malorum: et desolabo terram, et plenitudinem ejus in manu alienorum: ego Dominus locutus sum.
verses.english: And I will make the rivers dry, and will deliver the land into the hand of the wicked: and I will make the land desolate, and the fullness thereof by the hand of strangers: I the Lord have spoken it.

verses.latin: Quapropter hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Ego dabo Aegyptum in solitudines solitudinis a turre Syenes, et usque ad terminos Aethiopiae.
verses.english: Therefore, thus says the Lord God: I will give Egypt to be desolate, desolate from the tower of Syene and to the borders of Ethiopia.

verses.latin: Et dabo eam in manu eorum, qui vastant eam: et dispergam eam in gentibus, et dissipabo eam in terris.
verses.english: And I will give it into the hand of those who devastate it: and I will scatter it among the nations, and will disperse it throughout the countries.

verses.latin: Et confortabo manus regis Babylonis, et dabo gladium meum in manu ejus: et conteram manus Pharaonis, et gement coram eo gemitus interfecti.
verses.english: And I will strengthen the hands of the king of Babylon, and will put my sword in his hand: and I will break the arms of Pharaoh, and he shall groan before him with the groans of the slain.

verses.latin: Et confortabo brachia regis Babylonis, et defluentur brachia Pharaonis: et dabo gladium meum in manu regis Babylonis.
verses.english: And I will strengthen the arms of the king of Babylon, and the arms of Pharaoh shall fall down: and I will put my sword in the hand of the king of Babylon.

verses.latin: Et confortabo brachia regis Babylonis, et manus Pharaonis deficient: et scient quia ego Dominus, quando dedero gladium meum in manu regis Babylonis, et extenderit eum super terram Aegypti.
verses.english: And I will strengthen the arms of the king of Babylon, and the arms of Pharaoh shall fail: and they shall know that I am the Lord, when I shall give my sword into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he shall stretch it out upon the land of Egypt.

verses.latin: Et dispergam Aegyptios in gentibus, et dissipabo eos in terris: et scient quia ego Dominus.
verses.english: And I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations, and will disperse them throughout the countries: and they shall know that I am the Lord.

verses.latin: Factum est autem in anno duodecimo, in quinto, mensis duodecimi, factum est verbum Domini ad me, dicens:
verses.english: And it came to pass in the twelfth year, in the twelfth month, on the fifteenth day of the month, that the word of the Lord came to me, saying:

verses.latin: Fili hominis, pone faciem tuam contra Pharaonem regem Aegypti, et propheta adversus eum et contra omnem Aegyptum.
verses.english: “Son of man, set your face against Pharaoh king of Egypt, and prophesy against him and against all Egypt.

verses.latin: Loquere, et dices: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Ecce ego adducam te Pharao, regem Aegypti, draconem magnum, qui cubas in medio fluminum tuorum, et dicis: Flumen meum est, et ego feci me.
verses.english: Speak, and say: Thus says the Lord God: Behold, I bring you, Pharaoh, king of Egypt, the great dragon that lies in the midst of his rivers, that says: ‘The river is mine, and I made it for myself.’

verses.latin: Et dabo frenum in maxillis tuis, et alligabo pisces fluminum tuorum squamis tuis: et educam te de medio fluminum tuorum, et omnem pisces fluminum tuorum squamis tuis alligabo.
verses.english: And I will put a hook in your jaws, and I will cause the fish of your rivers to stick to your scales: and I will bring you out of the midst of your rivers, and all the fish of your rivers shall stick to your scales.

verses.latin: Et tradam te in manu eorum qui vastant te, et dispergent te, et conculcabunt te: et scient quia ego Dominus.
verses.english: And I will give you into the hand of them that devastate you, and they shall scatter you, and tread you down: and they shall know that I am the Lord.

verses.latin: Eo quod dixeris: Flumen meum est, et ego feci me, et ego feci me: idcirco ego dabo te in flumina tua, et projiciam te cum omni pisce fluminum tuorum: et deducam te in solitudinem, in terram desolationis, et non eris ultra aedificaberis: quia ego Dominus locutus sum.
verses.english: Because you have said: ‘The river is mine, and I made it, and I made myself:’ therefore, I will deliver you into your rivers, and I will cast you with all the fish of your rivers: and I will bring you into the wilderness, into a land of desolation, and you shall not be built up anymore: because I the Lord have spoken it.

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Cum congregabo Israël de populis, in quibus dispersi sunt, sanctificabor in eis coram gentibus: et inhabitabunt terram suam, quam dedi servo meo Jacob.
verses.english: Thus says the Lord God: When I shall have gathered Israel from the peoples among whom they are scattered, I will be sanctified in them in the sight of the nations: and they shall dwell in their own land, which I gave to my servant Jacob.

verses.latin: Et habitabunt in ea in securitate, et aedificabunt domos, et plantabunt vineas, et habitabunt confidenter, cum fecero judicium in omnibus, qui contristant eos per circuitum eorum: et scient quia ego Dominus Deus eorum.
verses.english: And they shall dwell in it with security, and they shall build houses, and plant vineyards, and shall dwell with confidence, when I shall have executed judgment in all who afflict them round about: and they shall know that I am the Lord their God.

verses.latin: Et factum est verbum Domini ad me, dicens:
verses.english: And the Word of God came to me, saying:

verses.latin: Filium hominis, pone faciem tuam contra Hierusalem, et stilla super sancta, et prophetabis contra terram Israël,
verses.english: “Son of man, direct your face against Jerusalem, and look down upon the holy places, and prophesy against the land of Israel,

verses.latin: et dices terræ Israël: Hæc dicit Dominus: Ecce ego ad te, et educam gladium meum de vagina sua, et interficiam in te justum et impium.
verses.english: and say to the land of Israel: ‘Thus says the Lord: Behold, I am against you, and I will draw my sword from its sheath, and will cut off from you both the just and the wicked.’

verses.latin: Et pro eo quod interficiam de te justum et impium, idcirco gladium meum educam de vagina sua contra omnem carnem, ab austro usque ad aquilonem.
verses.english: Because I will cut off from you the just and the wicked, therefore will I draw my sword from its sheath against all flesh, from the south to the north.

verses.latin: Et sciet omnis caro quod ego Dominus eduxerim gladium meum de vagina sua; non revertetur ultra.
verses.english: And all flesh shall know that I the Lord have drawn my sword from its sheath, and it shall not return again.

verses.latin: Tu ergo fili hominis, g[e]me in conturbatione lumborum tuorum, et in amaritudine g[e]me.
verses.english: You, therefore, son of man, groan in the breaking of your loins, and in bitterness groan.

verses.latin: Et cum dixerint ad te: Quare gemis? dices: Propter auditum, quia veniet: et contremescet omne cor, et dissolventur universæ manus, et omnis spiritus contabescet, et cuncta genua fluent quasi aquæ. Ecce venit, et faciet, dicit Dominus Deus.
verses.english: And when they say to you: ‘Why do you groan?’ say: ‘Because of what is to be heard: because it shall come; and every heart shall melt, and all hands shall be loosened, and every spirit shall be terrified, and all knees shall be weakened as water. Behold, it comes, and it shall be done, says the Lord God.’

verses.latin: Et factum est verbum Domini ad me, dicens:
verses.english: And the Word of God came to me, saying:

verses.latin: Fili hominis, propheta et dices: Hæc dicit Dominus: Dic: Gladius, gladius est acutus, et etiam limatus.
verses.english: “Son of man, prophesy and say: Thus says the Lord: Say: ‘A sword, a sword is sharpened and also polished.’

verses.latin: Ut interficiat victimam, et concinnaret ad trucidandum, fulguratum est: quasi ad mactandum dedit illud gladium.
verses.english: It is sharpened that it may kill the victims. It is polished that it may cut and flash like lightning. I have given it to the slaughter.

verses.latin: Et gladium dedi limatum, ut teneatur in manu: contra illum qui occidit. Ut cor ejus contristetur, et multiplicentur ruina.
verses.english: And I have polished the sword that it may be held in the hand: against him who kills. So that his heart may be sad, and that ruin may be multiplied.

verses.latin: Conflatus est ergo, ut trucidaret: posui illud in manu gladiatoris.
verses.english: It is made ready to be polished, that it may kill. I have set it in the hand of the slayer.

verses.latin: Clama et ulula, fili hominis: quia hic erit in populo meo, et iste erit in omnibus principibus Israël, traditi gladio cum populo meo: ideo contere femur tuum.
verses.english: Cry and howl, son of man: because it shall be in my people, and this shall be in all the princes of Israel, delivered to the sword with my people: therefore strike your thigh.

verses.latin: Quia probatio est. Et quid, si gladius contempserit? neque etiam virga, ait Dominus Deus.
verses.english: For there is a testing. And what if the sword despises? even the rod, says the Lord God.

verses.latin: Tu ergo fili hominis, propheta, et percute manum tuam, et dic: Gladius, gladius, ter, gladius interfectus, gladius occisionis magnæ: qui interficiet eos, et conteret eos.
verses.english: You, therefore, son of man, prophesy, and strike your hand, and say: ‘The sword, the sword is sharpened and brightened: it is sharpened to be butchered and polished for the great slaughter: that it may kill and crush them.’

verses.latin: Ut cor hominum formidet, et multiplicentur ruina: in omnibus portis eorum dedi gladium ad conturbationem: ah! facta ad fulgurandum, et aptata ad occisionem.
verses.english: So that the hearts of men may fear, and that ruin may be multiplied: I have set the sword in all their gates to bring confusion: alas! it is made to flash, and it is fitted for slaughter.

verses.latin: Ad utramque plagam acuti gladiorum, dedi plagam, ut interficerem: gemens ergo, percute manum tuam.
verses.english: I have given the sword sharpened on both sides, that it may kill. Therefore, groaning, strike your hand.

verses.latin: Et factum est verbum Domini ad me, dicens:
verses.english: And the Word of God came to me, saying:

verses.latin: Tu ergo fili hominis, pone tibi duas vias, ut veniat gladius regis Babylonis de terra: utraque de terra egredietur: et statuam manum, et ponam viam, in capite viæ civitatis.
