verses.english: “You, therefore, son of man, mark out two ways, that the sword of the king of Babylon may come from the land: both shall come out of the land: and I will set my hand, and I will set the way at the head of the way of the city.

verses.latin: Viam ponam gladium, et veniet gladius in Rabbath filiorum Ammon, et in Judam, et in Hierusalem.
verses.english: I will set a way for the sword, and the sword shall come to Rabbah of the sons of Ammon, and to Judah, and to Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Stetit enim rex Babylonis in bivio, in capite duarum viarum, divinando: miscuit sagittas, consideravit in idolatriis, consuluit in jecore.
verses.english: For the king of Babylon stood at the parting of the ways, at the head of the two ways, divining: he has mixed arrows, he has consulted idols, he has consulted the liver.

verses.latin: In dextera ejus erat divinatio super Hierusalem, ut daret arietem, ut aperiret os in cæde, ut elevaret in ululatibus vocem, ut daret arietem contra portas, ut faceret aggerem, et aedificaret munitionem.
verses.english: In his right hand was the divination for Jerusalem, to give a ram, to open the mouth in slaughter, to lift up the voice in shouting, to give a ram against the gates, to make a rampart, and to build a fortification.

verses.latin: Et erit quasi divinatio vana in oculis eorum, qui juraverunt ei: et ipse memorabit iniquitatem, ut caperetur.
verses.english: And it shall be as a vain divination in their eyes, who have sworn to him: and he will remember iniquity that he may be taken.

verses.latin: Propterea hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Quia facti estis memor iniquitatis vestræ, et revelata est prævaricatio vestra, et apparuerunt peccata vestra in cogitationibus vestris, quia facta estis memor, et capti estis in manu.
verses.english: Therefore, thus says the Lord God: ‘Because you have made mention of your iniquity, and your transgression is revealed, and your sins have appeared in your thoughts, because you have been made mindful, and you are taken with a hand.’

verses.latin: Tu autem impie et scelerate princeps Israël, cujus venit dies in tempore iniquitatis novissimo,
verses.english: “But you, impious and wicked prince of Israel, whose day has come in the last time of iniquity,

verses.latin: hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Aufer pileum, et tolle coronam: non hic est iste, exalte humilem, et humilia elatum.
verses.english: thus says the Lord God: ‘Remove the turban, and take off the crown: this is not the same; exalt the humble, and humble the exalted.’

verses.latin: Subvertam, subvertam, subvertam illud: et hoc erit, donec veniat ille cui est judicium, et dabo illud.
verses.english: I will overturn, I will overturn, I will overturn it: and this shall be, until he comes to whom the judgment belongs, and I will give it to him.

verses.latin: Et tu fili hominis, propheta, et dices: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus ad filios Ammon, et ad opprobrium eorum: Dic: Gladius, gladius, evaginatus ad trucidandum, limatus ad conterendum et ad fulgurandum:
verses.english: “And you, son of man, prophesy and say: ‘Thus says the Lord God to the sons of Ammon, and to their reproach: Say: A sword, a sword, is drawn to be butchered, sharpened to crush and to flash:

verses.latin: dum vident tibi vana, dum divinant tibi mendacia, ut ponas te super colla impiorum interfectorum, quorum venit dies in tempore iniquitatis novissimo.
verses.english: while they see you in vain, while they divine to you lies, that you may set yourself upon the necks of the impious who are slain, whose day has come in the last time of iniquity.’

verses.latin: Redde illud in vaginam suam. In loco ubi creatus es, in terra nativitatis tuæ judicabo te.
verses.english: Put it back into its sheath. In the place where you were created, in the land of your birth, I will judge you.

verses.latin: Et effundam super te indignationem meam: in igne zeli mei conflabo te: et dabo te in manu hominum crudelium, fabrorum sceleratorum, ad perditionem.
verses.english: And I will pour out my indignation upon you: in the fire of my zeal I will melt you: and I will give you into the hand of cruel men, the craftsmen of wickedness, to be destroyed.

verses.latin: Ignis eris ad devorandum: sanguis tuus erit in medio terræ: non erit memoria tui, quia ego Dominus locutus sum.
verses.english: You shall be a fire for devouring: your blood shall be in the midst of the land: you shall not be remembered, because I the Lord have spoken.”

verses.latin: Et factum est verbum Domini ad me, dicens:
verses.english: And the Word of the Lord came to me, saying:

verses.latin: Tu autem fili hominis, numquid judicas, numquid judicas civitatem sanguinum? et ostendes ei omnes abominationes ejus.
verses.english: “Son of man, will you judge? Will you judge the city of bloodshed? You will reveal all its abominations to her.

verses.latin: Et dices: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Civitas, quæ fundit sanguinem in medio sui, ut acceleretur tempus ejus, et faciat idola contra se ad contaminandum.
verses.english: And you will say: 'Thus says the Lord God: The city that pours out blood in her midst, so that her time may be accelerated, and makes idols against herself to defile her.

verses.latin: In sanguine tuo quem effudisti, reus factus es: et in idolis tuis quæ fecisti, contaminata es: et adpropinquasti diebus tuis, et adduxisti annos tuos: propter hoc dedi te opprobrium gentibus, et in derisum universis terris.
verses.english: In your blood that you have poured out, you have become guilty. And in your idols that you have made, you have become defiled. And you have come close to your days, and have brought your years. Therefore, I have given you as a reproach to the nations and as a mockery to all lands.'

verses.latin: Opprobrium vicinarum, et in derisum his quæ sunt in circuitu tuo: in quo nomen fueris, et plenus conturbatione.
verses.english: ‘You are the object of reproach of those nearby, and a mockery to those around you. You will be a thing of name, full of confusion.

verses.latin: Ecce principes Israël, singuli in brachio suo fuerunt in te ad effundendum sanguinem.
verses.english: Behold, the princes of Israel, each one in his own arm, were in you to shed blood.

verses.latin: Patrem et matrem contempserunt in te: in medio tui calumniam fecerunt, pupillum et viduam afflixerunt in te.
verses.english: Father and mother they have despised in you. In your midst they have done calumny; the orphan and the widow they have afflicted in you.

verses.latin: Sancta mea spreverunt, et sabbata mea polluerunt.
verses.english: My holy things they have despised, and my sabbaths they have polluted.

verses.latin: Viri detractionis fuerunt in te ad effundendum sanguinem: et super montes comederunt in te, scelera sua.
verses.english: Men of detraction were in you to shed blood, and on the mountains they ate in you their wickedness.

verses.latin: Turpitudines patris nudaverunt in te, immunditias menstruatæ humiliaverunt in te.
verses.english: The shame of the father they have uncovered in you, the uncleanness of the menstruating woman they have humiliated in you.

verses.latin: Et abominatio cujusque cum uxore proximi sui fecit in te, et in impudicitia conturbavit se vir cum uxore sua.
verses.english: And each one’s abomination with the wife of his neighbor they have done in you, and in impurity a man has confused himself with his wife.

verses.latin: Effuderunt sanguinem in te: usuras et augmentum acceperunt in te: et calumniam proximos tuos fecerunt in te: me autem obliti sunt, dicit Dominus Deus.
verses.english: They poured out blood in you; they took interest and increase in you, and they have done calumny against your neighbors in you, but they have forgotten me, says the Lord God.

verses.latin: Et ecce percussi manum meam super avaritiæ tuæ quam fecisti, et super sanguine qui effusus est in medio tui.
verses.english: Behold, I have struck my hand against your greed that you have made, and against the blood that has been poured out in your midst.

verses.latin: Numquid permanebit cor tuum quasi in diebus malorum? et adduxi gladium super te.
verses.english: Will your heart endure as in the days of evil? I have brought the sword upon you.

verses.latin: Et dispergam te in gentibus, et ventilabo te in terris: et auferam in te immunditias tuas.
verses.english: I will scatter you among the nations, and I will fan you in the lands, and I will take away from you your impurities.

verses.latin: Et contaminaberis in temetipso in conspectu gentium, et scies quia ego Dominus.
verses.english: And you will be defiled in yourself in the sight of the nations, and you will know that I am the Lord.

verses.latin: Et factum est verbum Domini ad me, dicens:
verses.english: And the word of the Lord came to me, saying:

verses.latin: Fili hominis, facta est mihi domus Israël quasi esca, universi: æris et stanni et ferri et plumbi in medio fornacis: argentum immundissimum factum est eis.
verses.english: “Son of man, the house of Israel has become for me like the food of all: brass, and tin, and iron, and lead in the midst of the furnace. Most impure silver has become for them.

verses.latin: Propterea hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Quia facti estis omnes quasi argentum immundissimum: idcirco ecce ego congregabo vos in medio Jerusalem:
verses.english: Therefore, thus says the Lord God: Because you have become all like most impure silver, therefore behold, I will gather you in the midst of Jerusalem:

verses.latin: Sicut congregari solet argentum et aes et ferrum et plumbum et stannum in medio fornacis, ut adflaret super ea ignis ad conflandum: sic congregabo vos in furore meo et in indignatione mea: et ponam vos in medio ejus.
verses.english: As silver, and brass, and iron, and lead, and tin are accustomed to be gathered in the midst of the furnace, so that the fire may blow upon them to melt them: so I will gather you in my fury and in my indignation, and I will put you in the midst of it.

verses.latin: Et congregabo vos, et adflabo super vos ignem furoris mei, et conflamini in medio ejus.
verses.english: And I will gather you, and I will blow upon you the fire of my wrath, and you will be melted in the midst of it.

verses.latin: Sicut conflatur argentum in medio fornacis, sic conflamini et vos in medio ejus: et scietis quia ego Dominus, quod effuderim indignationem meam super vos.
verses.english: As silver is melted in the midst of the furnace, so will you be melted in the midst of it, and you will know that I am the Lord, because I have poured out my indignation upon you.”

verses.latin: Et factum est verbum Domini ad me, dicens:
verses.english: And the word of the Lord came to me, saying:

verses.latin: Fili hominis, dic ei: Terra, tu es terra quæ non est irrigata, et pluvia non cecidit super te in die indignationis.
verses.english: “Son of man, say to her: ‘You are a land that is not watered, and rain has not fallen upon you in the day of indignation.

verses.latin: Conjurationem prophetarum ejus in medio ejus: quasi leo rugiens rapientem prædam: animas devoraverunt, pecuniam et gemmas tulerunt: viduas in ea multiplices fecerunt.
verses.english: ‘The conspiracy of her prophets in her midst is like a roaring lion seizing its prey: they have devoured souls; they have taken money and jewels. They have made widows in her numerous.

verses.latin: Sacerdotes ejus contempserunt legem meam, et polluerunt sancta mea: inter sanctum et profanum non separaverunt: et inter pollutum et mundum non judicaverunt, et a sabbatis meis averterunt oculos suos: et coinquinatus sum in eis.
verses.english: Her priests have despised my law, and have polluted my holy things. They have not separated between holy and profane, and they have not judged between what is polluted and what is clean, and from my sabbaths they have averted their eyes, and I have been profaned among them.

verses.latin: Principes ejus in medio ejus quasi lupi rapientes prædam ad effundendum sanguinem, et ad perdendas animas, ut avaritiam lucrarentur.
verses.english: Her princes in her midst are like wolves seizing prey to shed blood and to destroy souls, so that they may make a profit from greed.

verses.latin: Et prophetæ ejus id operiebant eis, linientes pro eis absque calce: et dicentes: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus, videntes falsa, et divinantes mendacium.
verses.english: And her prophets covered for them, smearing for them without mortar, and saying: ‘Thus says the Lord God,’ seeing false visions and divining lies.

verses.latin: Populus terræ fecit calumniam, et rapuit prædam: pauperem et mendicum afflixit, et peregrinum oppresserunt contra judicium.
verses.english: The people of the land have done calumny and have seized prey; they have afflicted the poor and the beggar, and they have oppressed the stranger against judgment.

verses.latin: Et quærebam ex eis virum qui reficeret murum, et staret in confractione contra me pro terra, ne dissiparem eam: et non inveni.
verses.english: And I sought among them a man who would repair the wall and stand in the breach against me for the land, so that I would not destroy it, but I did not find one.

verses.latin: Et effudi super eos indignationem meam: in igne furoris mei consumpsi eos: operam eorum super caput eorum dedi, dicit Dominus Deus.
verses.english: And I poured out my indignation upon them; in the fire of my wrath I consumed them. I have given their work upon their head, says the Lord God.”

verses.latin: Factum est verbum Domini ad me, dicens:
verses.english: The word of the Lord came to me, saying:

verses.latin: Fili hominis, duae mulieres filiae unius matris erant,
verses.english: Son of man, there were two women, daughters of the same mother.

verses.latin: et fornicaverunt in AEgypto: fornicatae sunt in juventute sua: ibi oppressae sunt ubera earum, et ibi contriti sunt mammae virginitatis eorum.
verses.english: And they committed fornication in Egypt. They committed fornication in their youth. There, their breasts were pressed, and there, the nipples of their virginity were broken.

verses.latin: Et erant nomina earum, Ahola major, et Ahola minor: et factae sunt mihi, et genuerunt filios et filias: et haec nomina earum: Samaria, Ahola, et Jerusalem, Ahola.
verses.english: And their names were Oholah the elder, and Oholibah the younger. And they became mine, and they bore sons and daughters. And these are their names: Samaria, Oholah, and Jerusalem, Oholibah.

verses.latin: Et fornicata est Ahola, cum esset mea: et concupivit amantes suos, Assyrios, prope ad se habitantes,
verses.english: And Oholah committed fornication, though she was mine, and lusted after her lovers, the Assyrians, who lived nearby,

verses.latin: vestitos hyacintho, duces et praepositos, juvenes cupidos, universos electos, equites, et viri bellatores.
verses.english: dressed in hyacinth, captains and rulers, young men eager for war, all chosen, horsemen, and men of war.

verses.latin: Et dedit fornicationes suas eis, universos electos filios Assyriorum, omnes in quibus desiderium illius erat: et contaminata est in idolis eorum.
verses.english: And she gave her acts of fornication to them, all the chosen sons of the Assyrians, all those in whom was her desire. And she was defiled with their idols.

verses.latin: Et non dereliquit fornicationes suas ab AEgypto: quoniam cum dormiret cum eo, concubuit cum eo: et contaminavit fornicationes suas.
verses.english: And she did not forsake her acts of fornication from Egypt. For when she slept with him, she lay with him, and she defiled her acts of fornication.

verses.latin: Et tradidi eam in manu amantium ejus, in manu filiorum Assyriorum, in quos concupierat.
verses.english: And I delivered her into the hand of her lovers, into the hand of the sons of the Assyrians, for whom she lusted.

verses.latin: Hi aperuerunt turpitudinem ejus, et tulerunt filios ejus et filias ejus: et Ahola occiderunt gladio, et facta est in exemplum mulieribus: cum facta esset judicium in ea.
verses.english: These exposed her nakedness, and took away her sons and her daughters. And they killed Oholah with the sword, and she became a warning to women, when judgment was passed on her.

verses.latin: Et vidit hoc Ahola soror ejus: et concupiscens se superavit fornicationes suas, et magis quam illa, et fornicationes ejus super fornicationes sororis suae.
verses.english: And her sister Oholibah saw this. And lusting, she surpassed her acts of fornication, and more than the other. And her acts of fornication surpassed the acts of her sister.

verses.latin: Concupiscens Assyrios duces et praepositos, prope ad se habitantes, vestitos cultu, equites, et viri bellatores, universos electos juvenes.
verses.english: Lusting after the Assyrians, captains and rulers who lived nearby, dressed in finery, horsemen and men of war, all chosen young men.

verses.latin: Et vidi quod contaminata esset: erant enim ambae via una.
verses.english: And I saw that she was defiled, for both of them were on the same path.

verses.latin: Et multiplicavit fornicationes suas: cum videret viros pictos in pariete, imagines Chaldaeorum pictas in colore,
verses.english: And she multiplied her acts of fornication. For when she saw men painted on the wall, images of the Chaldeans painted in color,

verses.latin: accinctos lumbos, et capita eorum cum tiaris, aspectus ducum et praepositorum, similitudines filiorum Babylonis terrae nativitatis eorum,
verses.english: with their loins girded and their heads with tiaras, the appearance of captains and rulers, the likenesses of the sons of Babylon, the land of their birth,

verses.latin: concubuit in eos visu oculorum suorum: et misit ad eos nuntios in Chaldaeos.
verses.english: she lusted after them with her eyes, and she sent messengers to the Chaldeans.

verses.latin: Et venerunt ad eam filii Babylonis in cubili amoris: et contaminarunt eam in fornicatione sua: et contaminata est in eis: et aversa est anima ejus ab eis.
verses.english: And the sons of Babylon came to her in the bed of love, and defiled her in her fornication, and she was defiled in them, and her soul was turned away from them.

verses.latin: Et revelavit fornicationes suas, et nudavit turpitudinem suam. Et aversa est anima mea ab ea, sicut aversa est anima mea ab sorore ejus.
verses.english: And she revealed her acts of fornication, and uncovered her nakedness. And my soul was turned away from her, as my soul was turned away from her sister.

verses.latin: Et multiplicavit fornicationes suas, memorans dies juventutis suae, in quibus fornicata est in terra AEgypti.
verses.english: And she multiplied her acts of fornication, remembering the days of her youth, in which she committed fornication in the land of Egypt.

verses.latin: Et concupivit concubitus eorum, quorum caro quasi caro asinorum, et sementis eorum quasi sementis equorum.
verses.english: And she lusted after their concubitus, whose flesh was like the flesh of donkeys, and whose seed was like the seed of horses.

verses.latin: Et reduxisti turpitudinem juventutis tuae, et contritis mammarum tuarum, per manum AEgyptiorum, propter ubera adulescentiae tuae.
verses.english: And you brought back the shame of your youth, and the breaking of your nipples, by the hand of the Egyptians, because of the breasts of your youth.

verses.latin: Propterea, Ahola, ecce ego congregabo omnes amantes tuos, ad quos habuisti animum tuum, et omnes quos dilexisti cum universis in quibus concupiscisti: et congregabo eos contra te undique, et revelabo eis turpitudinem tuam, et ostendes eis omnem fornicationem tuam.
verses.english: Therefore, Oholah, behold, I will gather all your lovers, for whom you had a mind, and all whom you have loved with all those in whom you lusted: and I will gather them against you from all sides, and I will reveal your nakedness to them, and I will show them all your fornication.

verses.latin: Et judicabo te judiciis adulterarum, et effluentium sanguinem: et dabo te sanguini furoris, et zelo.
verses.english: And I will judge you with the judgments of adulteresses and those who shed blood, and I will give you to the blood of wrath and zeal.

verses.latin: Et tradam te in manu eorum: et diripient te, et subvertent aedificia tua, et vestimenta tua tollent, et accipient vasa gloriae tuae: et inducam te in illos, et dabo te in manu eorum.
verses.english: And I will deliver you into their hand, and they will plunder you, and they will tear down your buildings, and take away your garments, and take your vessels of glory. And I will bring you to them, and give you into their hand.

verses.latin: Et adferent super te furorem meum: et facient te in furorem zeli: et tolent nasum tuum, et aures tuas: et reliqui tui gladio cadent: ipsi filios tuos et filias tuas tollent: et reliqui tui igne conburentur.
verses.english: And they will bring upon you my fury, and they will make you into the fury of zeal, and take away your nose and your ears. And those who remain will fall by the sword. They will take away your sons and your daughters, and those who remain will be burned with fire.

verses.latin: Et vestimenta tua tollent, et accipient vasa gloriae tuae.
verses.english: And they will take away your garments, and take your vessels of glory.

verses.latin: Et ponam oblivionem tuam a te, et fornicationem tuam de terra AEgypti, et non levabis oculos tuos ad eos: et non recordaberis AEgypti amplius.
verses.english: And I will put your memory away from you, and your fornication from the land of Egypt, and you will not lift your eyes towards them, and you will not remember Egypt any more.

verses.latin: Quia haec dicit Dominus Deus: Ecce ego tradam te in manu eorum quos odio habes, in manu eorum a quibus aversa est anima tua.
verses.english: For thus says the Lord God: Behold, I will deliver you into the hand of those whom you hate, into the hand of those from whom your soul has turned away.

verses.latin: Et facient te odio, et tollent universa quae laborasti: et derelinquent te nudam et desertam, et revelabitur turpitudo fornicationum tuarum, et scelerum tuorum.
verses.english: And they will make you hated, and take away everything you have worked for. And they will leave you naked and deserted, and the shame of your fornications and your sins will be revealed.

verses.latin: Haec facient tibi, quia fornicata es post gentes, et contaminata es in idolis earum.
verses.english: These things will they do to you, because you have committed fornication after the gentiles, and you have been defiled with their idols.

verses.latin: Viam sororis tuae ambulasti: et dabo calicem ejus in manu tua.
verses.english: You have walked in the way of your sister, and I will give her cup into your hand.

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus Deus: Calicem sororis tuae biberes: ergo dabis illum in manu tua, et bibes eum: et irridebis, et contemnes, et cessabis plangere.
verses.english: Thus says the Lord God: You will drink your sister's cup, therefore you will give it in your hand, and drink it. And you will mock, and despise, and cease to mourn.

verses.latin: Quia implesisti calicem sororis tuae: et dabis illum in manu tua, et bibes eum: et exhauries illum usque ad faeces: et confringes frusta ossa tua.
verses.english: For you have filled your sister's cup, and you will give it in your hand, and drink it, and you will drain it to the dregs, and break your bones in pieces.

verses.latin: Ideo haec dicit Dominus Deus: Quia oblita es mei, projecisti me post tergum tuum: tu ergo portabis scelus tuum, et fornicationes tuas.
verses.english: Therefore, thus says the Lord God: Because you have forgotten me, you have cast me behind your back, therefore you will bear your iniquity and your fornications.

verses.latin: Et dixit Dominus ad me: Fili hominis, numquid judicabis Ahola et Ahola? et ostendes eis scelera eorum.
verses.english: And the Lord said to me: Son of man, will you judge Oholah and Oholibah? And show them their crimes?

verses.latin: Et dedisti judicium Aholae et Aholae, et ostendes eis omnem scelestiam eorum.
verses.english: And you have given judgment to Oholah and Oholibah, and shown them all their wickedness.

verses.latin: Quia fornicatae sunt, et in manibus eorum scelera, et cum idolis suis fornicatae sunt: et filios suos, quos genuerant mihi, dederunt eis in escam.
verses.english: Because they have committed fornication, and in their hands are crimes, and they have committed fornication with their idols, and they have given their sons, whom they bore to me, to them for food.

verses.latin: Sed et hoc fecerunt mihi: polluerunt sanctum meum in die illa: et sabbata mea violabant.
verses.english: But even this they did to me: they defiled my sanctuary on that day, and they violated my Sabbaths.

verses.latin: Et cum immolassent filios suos idolis suis, venerunt in sanctum meum eadem die, ut polluerent illud: et ecce sic fecerunt in medio domus meae.
verses.english: And when they had sacrificed their sons to their idols, they came into my sanctuary on the same day to defile it. And behold, thus they did in the midst of my house.

verses.latin: Quia miserunt enim viros venustos venientes de longinquo: quibus missi sunt nuntii: et ecce venerunt: pro quibus lavisti te, et tinxisti oculos tuos, et ornata es monilibus, et posuisti te super lectulum.
verses.english: For they sent for handsome men coming from afar, to whom messengers were sent. And behold, they came. For whom you washed yourself, and painted your eyes, and adorned yourself with ornaments, and placed yourself on a bed.

verses.latin: Et sedisti super lectum incensi: et mensa mea posita est coram te: super quam posuisti incensum meum, et oleum meum.
verses.english: And you sat on a bed of incense, and my table was set before you, upon which you placed my incense and my oil.

verses.latin: Et vox turbae, erat in ea, et cum hominibus vulgi adductis de deserto: et posuerunt armillas in manibus earum, et coronam decoris in capitibus earum.
verses.english: And there was the voice of a multitude in her, and with men of the common people brought from the desert. And they put bracelets on their hands, and a crown of glory on their heads.

verses.latin: Et dixi: Numquid in senecta sua fornicabuntur? et nunc fornicatio earum.
verses.english: And I said: Will they commit fornication in their old age? And now is their fornication.

verses.latin: Et ingressi sunt ad eam quasi ad mulierem fornicariam: sic ingressi sunt ad Ahola et Ahola, mulieres iniquae: et ipsi scelesti.
verses.english: And they entered to her as to a woman of prostitution. Thus they entered to Oholah and Oholibah, wicked women, and themselves wicked.

verses.latin: Et viri justi ipsi judicabunt eas judicio adulterarum, et judicio effundentium sanguinem: quia adulterae sunt, et sanguis in manibus earum.
verses.english: And just men will judge them with the judgment of adulteresses and the judgment of those who shed blood, because they are adulteresses, and blood is in their hands.

verses.latin: Quia haec dicit Dominus Deus: Adducam super eas multitudinem: et dabo eas in commotionem, et in praedam.
verses.english: For thus says the Lord God: I will bring against them a multitude, and I will give them to be shaken and plundered.

verses.latin: Et lapidabit eas multitudo lapidibus, et confodiet eas gladiis: et interficient filios earum et filias earum: et domos earum incendio succendent.
verses.english: And the multitude will stone them with stones, and pierce them with swords, and they will kill their sons and their daughters, and burn their houses with fire.

verses.latin: Et auferam malitiam de terra: et emendabitur omnis mulier, et non facient secundum malitiam vestram.
verses.english: And I will remove wickedness from the land, and every woman will be corrected, and they will not act according to your wickedness.

verses.latin: Et dabo malitiam vestram super vos, et portabitis peccata idolorum vestrorum: et scietis quia ego Dominus Deus.
verses.english: And I will bring your wickedness upon you, and you will bear the sins of your idols, and you will know that I am the Lord God.

verses.latin: Factum est verbum Domini ad me in anno nono, in mense decimo, decima die mensis, dicens:
verses.english: In the ninth year of the exile, in the tenth month, on the tenth day of the month, the word of the Lord came to me, saying:

verses.latin: Fili hominis, scribe tibi nomen diei, diei istius: obruit se rex Babylonis in Hierusalem in ipsa die.
verses.english: “Son of man, write down the name of this very day: The king of Babylon has launched his attack against Jerusalem this very day.”

verses.latin: Et propone parabolam ad domum irritantem, et dices ad eos: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Pone ollam, pone, et mitte in ea aquam.
verses.english: “Then speak a parable to this rebellious house. Say to them, ‘This is what the Lord God says: ‘Put the pot on the fire. Put it on the fire, and then pour water into it.’”

verses.latin: Congrega in ea frusta, omnia frusta boni, femur et umerum, et imple ossibus electis.
verses.english: “‘Put into it every piece of meat: the best pieces, the thigh, and the shoulder. Fill it with choice bones.”

verses.latin: De grege electo sume, et congrega usque ad ossa, et cocta fac in ea.
verses.english: “‘Take the best of the flock, and heap the wood together to make it boil. Cook the meat in it.”

verses.latin: Quam ob rem hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Væ civitati sanguinum, ollæ cujus rubigo in ea est, et cujus rubigo non exivit ex ea.
verses.english: “Therefore, this is what the Lord God says: ‘Woe to this city of bloodshed! Woe to this pot, whose rust is in it! The rust has not left it.”

verses.latin: In eam sanguinem effudit, super petram nudam posuit illum, non effudit eum super terram, ut operiret illum pulvere.
verses.english: “‘She poured blood into it, and put it on a bare rock. She did not pour it out on the ground to cover it with dirt.”

verses.latin: Ut excitaret indignationem, et faceret vindictam, dedi sanguinem ejus super petram nudam, ut non operiretur.
verses.english: “‘I have given her blood to be poured on the bare rock. This was to cause wrath, and to take vengeance.”

verses.latin: Propterea hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Væ civitati sanguinum! Ego quoque multiplicabo pyram, faciamque ignem magnum.
verses.english: “‘Therefore, this is what the Lord God says: ‘Woe to this city of bloodshed! I will make the pyre of wood great, and I will cause the fire to burn hot.”

verses.latin: Augent ligna, incendant ignem, excoquant carnem, et condiant, et ossa exurant.
verses.english: “‘Add more wood. Let the fire burn hotter. Let the meat be cooked, seasoned, and the bones be burned.”

verses.latin: Et statuent super prunas ollam vacuam, ut ebulliat, et consumatur æs ejus, et corrumpatur in ea rubigo ejus.
verses.english: “‘Then let the empty pot be set on the hot coals, so that it becomes hot, and so that its bronze is burned away, and its rust is corrupted.”

verses.latin: In laboribus defecerunt, et rubigo ejus non exivit: in igne rubigo ejus.
verses.english: “‘It has become worn out with labor, but its great rust has not left it. In the fire, its rust will be destroyed.”

verses.latin: Quia in inmunditia tua, quæ est, scelus: quoniam mundavi te, et non es mundata, nec ultra mundaberis a sordibus tuis, donec quiescat indignationem meam in te.
verses.english: “‘Because of the sins which you have, you are unclean. I have tried to cleanse you, but you were not cleansed. You will not be cleansed from your filth, until my wrath against you is at rest.”

verses.latin: Ego Dominus locutus sum: veniet et faciam, non reliquam, nec parcet oculus meus, nec miserebor, juxta vias tuas, et juxta studia tua judicabunt te, dicit Dominus Deus.
verses.english: “‘I, the Lord, have spoken. It will come to pass and I will act. I will not relent, and my eye will not pity you. I will judge you according to your ways and your deeds,’ says the Lord God.”

verses.latin: Et factum est verbum Domini ad me, dicens:
verses.english: The word of the Lord came to me, saying:

verses.latin: Fili hominis, ecce ego tollo a te desiderium oculorum tuorum in plaga: et non plangas, nec plores, nec veniant lacrymæ tuæ.
verses.english: “Son of man, behold, I am about to take away the delight of your eyes by a blow. You will not weep, nor lament, and your tears will not come.”

verses.latin: Ingemisce tacens: mortuorum luctum non facies, mitra tua ligabis in te, et calceamenta tua calceabis in pedibus tuis: et non operies os tuum, nec cibos hominum comedes.
verses.english: “Groan silently. Do not mourn for the dead. Bind on your turban, and put your shoes on your feet. Do not cover your mouth, nor eat the food of other men.”

verses.latin: Locutus sum ergo ad populum mane, et mortua est uxor mea vespere: et feci mane sicut præceperat mihi.
verses.english: So, I spoke to the people in the morning, and in the evening my wife died. In the morning, I did as I was commanded.

verses.latin: Et dixit ad me populus: Numquid non indicabis nobis quid ista significent quæ tu facis?
verses.english: Then the people said to me, “Will you not tell us what these things mean which you are doing?”

verses.latin: Et dixi ad eos: Verbum Domini factum est ad me, dicens:
verses.english: And I said to them, “The word of the Lord came to me, saying:

verses.latin: Loquere domui Israël: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Ecce ego pollulo sanctuarium meum, superbiam fortitudinis vestræ, et desiderium oculorum vestrorum, et cura animarum vestrarum: filios vestros et filias quas reliquistis, gladio cadent.
verses.english: “‘Speak to the house of Israel: ‘This is what the Lord God says: ‘Behold, I will pollute my sanctuary, the pride of your strength, the delight of your eyes, and the desire of your soul. And your sons and your daughters whom you left behind will fall by the sword.”

verses.latin: Et eritis sicut feceram: non operietis ora, nec cibos hominum comedetis.
verses.english: “‘You will do as I have done: You will not cover your mouths, nor eat the food of other men.”

verses.latin: Et erunt mitræ vestræ in capitibus vestris, et calceamenta vestra in pedibus vestris: non plangetis, nec plorabitis, sed in iniquitatibus vestris tabescetis, et in gemitibus vestris unus ad alterum confringetis.
verses.english: “‘Your turbans will remain on your heads, and your shoes will remain on your feet. You will not mourn, nor weep. But you will waste away in your iniquities, and you will groan to one another.”

verses.latin: Et erit Ezechiel vobis in signum: juxta omnia quæ fecit, facietis: cum venerit hoc, scietis quia ego Dominus Deus.
verses.english: “‘Thus, Ezekiel will be a sign to you. You will do according to all that he has done. When this comes, you will know that I am the Lord God.”

verses.latin: Et tu, fili hominis, nonne in die quo tollam ab eis fortitudinem eorum, gaudium gloriae eorum, desiderium oculorum eorum, et super quo animæ eorum flagrant, filios eorum et filias eorum?
verses.english: “‘And you, son of man, will not you, on the day that I take from them their strength, the joy of their glory, the delight of their eyes, and that upon which their souls long, their sons and their daughters?

verses.latin: In die illo veniet ad te fugiens, ut nuntiet in aure tua.
verses.english: “‘On that day, someone will come to you, fleeing to tell you the news.”

verses.latin: In die illo aperietur os tuum cum eo qui fugerit: et loqueris, et non siles amplius: et eris eis in signum, et scient quia ego Dominus.
verses.english: “‘On that day your mouth will be opened with him who has fled, and you will speak and will no longer be silent. You will be a sign to them, and they will know that I am the Lord.”

verses.latin: Factum est verbum Domini ad me, dicens:
verses.english: The Lord spoke a message to me, saying:

verses.latin: Fili hominis, pone faciem tuam contra filios Ammon, et prophetabis de eis.
verses.english: Son of man, set your face against the Ammonites, and prophesy about them.

verses.latin: Et dices filiis Ammon: Audite verbum Domini Dei. Hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Quia dixisti: Aha, contra sanctuarium meum, quia contaminatum est, et contra terram Israël, quia desolata est, et contra domum Juda, quia ducta est in captivitatem:
verses.english: And say to the Ammonites: Hear the word of the Lord God. The Lord God says this: Because you said “Aha!” in response to the destruction of my holy place, because it was profaned, and in response to the land of Israel, because it was desolate, and in response to the house of Judah, because they were led away captive,

verses.latin: ideo ego tradam te filiis orientis in possessionem, et ponent in te castra sua, et pones in te tabernacula sua: ipsi comedent fructus tuos, et ipsi bibent lac tuum.
verses.english: therefore I will give you over to the sons of the East, to take possession, and they will set up their camps in you, and they will set up their tents in you: they will eat your fruits, and they will drink your milk.

verses.latin: Et dabo Rabba in stabulam camelorum, et filios Ammon in cubilia gregum: et scietis quia ego Dominus.
verses.english: And I will turn Rabbah into a stable for camels, and the Ammonites into a resting place for flocks: and you will know that I am the Lord.

verses.latin: Quia hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Quia plaudisti manu, et percussisti pede, et gavisa es in omni exprobatione contra terram Israël,
verses.english: For the Lord God says this: Because you clapped your hands, and stamped your foot, and rejoiced with all the disdain against the land of Israel,

verses.latin: ideo ego extendam manum meam super te, et dabo te in prædam gentium: et auferam te de populis, et perdam te de terris, et disperdam te: et scies quia ego Dominus.
verses.english: therefore I will stretch out my hand over you, and I will give you as plunder to the nations: and I will cut you off from the peoples, and I will destroy you from the lands, and I will scatter you: and you will know that I am the Lord.

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Quia dixerunt Moab et Seir: Ecce sicut omnes gentes domus Juda.
verses.english: The Lord God says this: Because Moab and Seir said: Behold, like all the nations, the house of Judah.

verses.latin: Propterea ego aperiam latus Moab a lateribus ejus, a civitatibus ejus, a finibus ejus, et gloria ejus, et fortissimis ejus: et a filiis Ammon.
verses.english: Therefore I will open the side of Moab from its borders, from its cities, from its borders, and its glory, and its strongest ones: and from the sons of Ammon.

verses.latin: Dabo eam cum filiis Ammon in possessionem, ut non meminerit gentium in medio gentium: et scietis quia ego Dominus.
verses.english: I will give it with the sons of Ammon as a possession, so that they will not be remembered among the nations: and you will know that I am the Lord.

verses.latin: Quia hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Quia fecit Edom ultionem contra domum Juda, et deliquit in se, et ultus est.
verses.english: For the Lord God says this: Because Edom took revenge against the house of Judah, and offended it, and took revenge.

verses.latin: Propterea hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Extendam manum meam super Edom, et auferam de ea hominem et jumentum, et dabo eam in solitudinem, a Theman usque ad Dedan: gladio cadent.
verses.english: Therefore the Lord God says this: I will stretch out my hand over Edom, and I will cut off from it man and beast, and I will make it a desolation, from Teman even to Dedan: by the sword they will fall.

verses.latin: Et dabo ultionem meam in Edom per manum populi mei Israël: et facient in Edom juxta iram meam, et furorem meum: et scient vindictam meam, dicit Dominus Deus.
verses.english: And I will take my vengeance on Edom by the hand of my people Israel: and they will act in Edom according to my wrath, and my fury: and they will know my vengeance, says the Lord God.

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Quia fecerunt Philisthim ultionem, et vindictam cum animo contemptus, in exterminationem, propter odium sempiternum:
verses.english: The Lord God says this: Because the Philistines have taken revenge, and vengeance with a spirit of contempt, to extermination, because of eternal hatred:

verses.latin: propterea hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Ecce ego extendam manum meam super Philisthim, et disperdam incensionem Cretæorum, et reliquias maris.
verses.english: therefore the Lord God says this: Behold, I will stretch out my hand over the Philistines, and I will destroy the remnant of the Cretans, and the rest of the sea.

verses.latin: Et faciam in eis vindictam magnam per increpationes furoris: et scient quia ego Dominus, cum dedero vindictam meam in eis.
verses.english: And I will take great vengeance on them by means of reproaches of fury: and they will know that I am the Lord, when I shall have taken my vengeance on them.

verses.latin: Factum est autem in undecimo anno, in mense primo, in die prima mensis, factum est verbum Domini ad me, dicens:
verses.english: In the eleventh year, in the first month, on the first day of the month, the Word of the Lord came to me, saying:

verses.latin: Fili hominis, pro eo quod dixit Tyrus de Jerusalem: Heu! fractae sunt mihi portae gentium; conversa est in me, replebor, cum desolata est:
verses.english: Son of man, because Tyre said of Jerusalem: “Aha! The gates of the nations are broken; she is turned over to me; I will be filled, now that she is laid waste:”

verses.latin: Idcirco haec dicit Dominus Deus: Ecce ego super te, Tyre, et ascendere faciam ad te gentes multas, sicut ascendit mare frendens fluctibus suis.
verses.english: Therefore, thus says the Lord God: “Behold, I am against you, Tyre, and I will bring up many nations against you, as the sea brings up its waves.

verses.latin: Et dissipabunt muros Tyri, et destruent turres ejus: et emundabo eam de pulvere suo, et dabo eam quasi scopulum nudum.
verses.english: They will destroy the walls of Tyre and break down her towers; and I will scrape her soil from her and make her like a bare rock.

verses.latin: Siccitas retiariorum, et mercatorum, et gentium multiplicabitur in ea: quia locuta est contra me, dicit Dominus Deus.
verses.english: She will become a place for spreading nets in the sea, and for the merchants of the nations; for I have spoken,” says the Lord God.

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Pro eo quod dixisti: Ecce ego, et decor meus, et gloria mea, et cor meum: propterea ecce ego adducam super te alienos.
verses.english: Thus says the Lord God: “Because you have said: ‘I am perfect in beauty,’ therefore, behold, I will bring strangers against you.

verses.latin: Et gladium solvent in pulchritudinem sapientiæ tuæ, et contaminabunt decorem tuum.
verses.english: They will unsheathe their swords against the beauty of your wisdom, and they will defile your splendor.

verses.latin: Deducent te ad foveam, et morieris morte interfecti in medio mari.
verses.english: They will bring you down to the pit, and you will die a violent death in the heart of the seas.

verses.latin: Numquid dicens dicis: Deus sum, coram interfectoribus tuis? Tu autem homo es, et non Deus, in manu interfectorum tuorum.
verses.english: Will you then say, ‘I am God,’ in the presence of your killers? You are a man, and not God, in the hands of those who slay you.

verses.latin: Morte incircumcisorum morieris manu alienorum, quia ego locutus sum, dicit Dominus Deus.
verses.english: You will die the death of the uncircumcised, by the hand of strangers, for I have spoken,” says the Lord God.

verses.latin: Et factum est verbum Domini ad me, dicens:
verses.english: And the word of the Lord came to me, saying:

verses.latin: Fili hominis, leva lamentum super regem Tyri.
verses.english: Son of man, take up a lamentation for the king of Tyre.

verses.latin: Et dices ei: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Tu signaculum similitudinis, plenus sapientia, perfectus decore.
verses.english: And say to him: “Thus says the Lord God: ‘You were the seal of perfection, full of wisdom, and perfect in beauty.

verses.latin: In Eden, in paradiso Dei fuisti; omnis lapis pretiosus operimentum tuum: sardius, topazius, et adamas, chrysolitus, onyx, et berillus, sapphirus, et carbunculus, et smaragdus: aurum, opus decoris tui, et gemmas tuas praeparasti in die qua creaberis.
verses.english: You were in Eden, the garden of God; every precious stone was your covering: sardius, topaz, and diamond, chrysolite, onyx, and beryl, sapphire, carbuncle, and emerald; and gold was the work of your settings and your sockets. On the day that you were created they were prepared.

verses.latin: Tu cherub, extentus et protegens, et posui te in monte sancto Dei: fuisti in medio lapidum igneorum.
verses.english: You were an anointed cherub who covers, and I placed you on the holy mountain of God; you were in the midst of the stones of fire.

verses.latin: Perfectus in viis tuis a die creationis tuæ, donec inventa est iniquitas in te.
verses.english: You were perfect in your ways from the day you were created, until iniquity was found in you.

verses.latin: In multitudine negotiationis tuæ, repleti sunt interiora tua iniquitate, et peccasti: et ejeci te de monte Dei, et perdidi te, o cherub protegens, de medio lapidum igneorum.
verses.english: In the abundance of your trade, your heart was filled with violence, and you sinned; therefore, I cast you out of the mountain of God, and I destroyed you, O covering cherub, from the midst of the stones of fire.

verses.latin: Et elevatum est cor tuum in pulchritudine tua; perdidisti sapientiam tuam in decore tuo: in terram projeci te; ante faciem regum dedi te, ut videant te.
verses.english: Your heart was lifted up because of your beauty; you corrupted your wisdom for the sake of your splendor. I cast you to the ground; I laid you before kings, that they might gaze at you.

verses.latin: Per multitudinem iniquitatum tuarum, et per nequitiam negotiationis tuæ, contaminasti sancta tua: et eduxi ignem de medio tui, qui comedit te, et dedi te cinerem super terram in conspectu omnium videntium te.
verses.english: By the multitude of your iniquities, in the iniquity of your trade you have profaned your sanctuaries; therefore I have brought fire out from your midst; it has devoured you, and I have turned you to ashes on the earth in the sight of all who see you.

verses.latin: Omnes qui viderant te in gentibus, obstupuerunt super te: factus es in timorem, et non eris ultra in saecula.
verses.english: All who knew you among the peoples are appalled at you; you have become a terror, and shall be no more forever.”

verses.latin: Et factum est verbum Domini ad me, dicens:
verses.english: And the word of the Lord came to me, saying:

verses.latin: Fili hominis, pone faciem tuam contra Sidonem, et prophetabis de ea.
verses.english: Son of man, set your face toward Sidon, and prophesy against her.

verses.latin: Et dices: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Ecce ego adversum te Sidon, et glorificabor in medio tui: et scient quia ego Dominus, cum fecero in ea judicia, et sanctificatus fuero in ea.
verses.english: And say, “Thus says the Lord God: ‘Behold, I am against you, Sidon, and I will be glorified in your midst; and they shall know that I am the Lord, when I execute judgments in her, and I am sanctified in her.

verses.latin: Et immittam in eam pestilentiam, et sanguinem in plateis ejus, et corruent interfecti in medio ejus gladio, qui undique contra eam: et scient quia ego Dominus.
verses.english: For I will send a plague upon her, and blood in her streets; and the slain shall fall in her midst by the sword against her on every side. Then they shall know that I am the Lord.

verses.latin: Et non erit ultra domui Israël stimulus amaritudinis, et spina doloris, in omnibus qui sunt ex ea in circuitu ejus: et scient quia ego Dominus Deus.
verses.english: And there shall no longer be a pricking brier or a painful thorn for the house of Israel from any who are around them and who have treated them with contempt. Then they shall know that I am the Lord God.”

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Cum congregabo domum Israël de populis, et congregatus fuero, sanctificabor in eis in oculis gentium, et habitabunt in terra sua quam dedi servo meo Jacob.
verses.english: Thus says the Lord God: ‘When I have gathered the house of Israel from the peoples among whom they are scattered, and I am sanctified in them in the sight of the nations, then they shall dwell in their own land which I gave to My servant Jacob.

verses.latin: Et habitabunt in ea securi, et aedificabunt domos, et plantabunt vineas, et habitabunt confidenter, cum fecerim judicium in omnibus qui contristaverunt eos in circuitu eorum: et scient quia ego Dominus Deus eorum.
verses.english: And they will dwell securely in it, and they will build houses and plant vineyards, and they will dwell securely, when I execute judgments on all those around them who despise them. Then they shall know that I am the Lord their God.’

verses.latin: Factum est verbum Domini ad me, dicens:
verses.english: The Word of the Lord came to me, saying:

verses.latin: Tu fili hominis, sume lamentationem super Tyrum,
verses.english: “Son of man, sing a lamentation over Tyre,

verses.latin: et dices Tyro, habitanti in introitu maris, negotiatrici populorum in insulis, Dominus Deus haec dicit: O Tyre, tu dixisti: Perfecta pulchritudine ego sum.
verses.english: and say to Tyre, who dwells at the entrance to the sea, who trades with the peoples on the islands, ‘The Lord God says this: “O Tyre, you said: ‘I am perfect in beauty.’”

verses.latin: In corde maris termini tui, qui te aedificaverunt, perfecerunt pulchritudinem tuam.
verses.english: “In the heart of the seas are your boundaries. Those who built you perfected your beauty.

verses.latin: Ex abietibus Saron fecerunt omnes lateres tuos, cedros de Libano tulerunt, ut facerent malum in te.
verses.english: “They made all your planks from the fir trees of Sharon. They took cedars from Lebanon to make the mast for you.

verses.latin: Ex robore Basan fecerunt remos tuos, et in eburno domum tuam, quam de insulis Chitti adduxerunt.
verses.english: “They made your oars from the oak of Bashan, and your house from ivory, which they brought from the islands of the Kittim.

verses.latin: Byssus de AEgypto texta, erat velum tuum, ut esset tibi in vexillo: hyacinthus et purpura de insulis Elisae, fuerunt operimentum tuum.
verses.english: “Fine linen from Egypt was your sail, that it might be as a banner to you. Hyacinth and purple from the islands of Elisha were your covering.

verses.latin: Habitantes Sidon et Arad remiges tui, sapientes tui, O Tyre, erant in te, gubernatores tui.
verses.english: “The inhabitants of Sidon and Arvad were your rowers. Your wise men, O Tyre, were in you, your pilots.

verses.latin: Senes Gebal et sapientes ejus, in te reparabant rimam tuam: omnes naves maris, et nautae ejus, erant in te, in negotiatione tua.
verses.english: “The elders of Gebal and its wise men repaired your gaps. All the ships of the sea and its sailors were in you, in your trading.

verses.latin: Persae et Lydii, et Libyes, erant in militia tua: viri tui in praelio, scutum et galea in te suspenderunt gloriam tuam.
verses.english: “Persians and Lydians, and Libyans were in your army. Your men in battle hung up their shield and helmet. They displayed your glory.

verses.latin: Filii Arad, et omnis militia tua, erant in muris tuis per circuitum: et turres tuae erant cum armis suis: scuta tua pendebant in muris tuis per circuitum, perfecerunt decorem tuum.
verses.english: “The sons of Arvad and all your army were on your walls all around, and your towers were with their arms. Your shields hung on your walls all around. They perfected your beauty.

verses.latin: Tharsis mercatrix tua in multitudine omnium divitiarum, in argento, ferro, stanno, plumbo, negotiabantur in nundinis tuis.
verses.english: “Tarshish was your merchant in the multitude of all riches, in silver, iron, tin, lead, they traded in your markets.

verses.latin: Javan, Tubal, et Mosoch, ipsi mercatores tui, animas hominum et vasa aerea negotiabantur in nundinis tuis.
verses.english: “Javan, Tubal, and Meshech, they were your merchants. They traded the souls of men and bronze vessels in your markets.

verses.latin: De domo Thogorma equos et equites, et mulos, in nundinis tuis.
verses.english: “From the house of Togarmah they brought horses and horsemen and mules in your markets.

verses.latin: Filii Dadan mercatores tui: insulae multae negotiatrices tuae, dentes eburni et hebenos retribuebant tibi.
verses.english: “The sons of Dedan were your merchants. Many islands were your merchants. They paid you ivory tusks and ebony.

verses.latin: Siria mercatrix tua in multitudine operum tuorum, in gemmis, et purpura, et in variis coloribus, et in bysso, et in serico, et in chrysolitho in nundinis tuis.
verses.english: “Syria was your merchant in the multitude of your works, in gems, and purple, and in various colors, and in fine linen, and in silk, and in chrysolite in your markets.

verses.latin: Judas et terra Israël, ipsi mercatores tui, in tritico prima, et in melle, et in oleo, et balsamo, in nundinis tuis praestabant merces tuas.
verses.english: “Judah and the land of Israel were your merchants. They offered your merchandise of the first wheat, and in honey, and in oil, and balsam in your markets.

verses.latin: Damascus mercatrix tua in multitudine operum tuorum, in multitudine divitiarum, in vino Damasci, et in lana alba.
verses.english: “Damascus was your merchant in the multitude of your works, in the multitude of riches, in the wine of Damascus, and in white wool.

verses.latin: Dan, et Graecani, et Usal, in nundinis tuis: ferrum fabrefactum, et casia, et calamus, in nundinis tuis.
verses.english: “Dan, and Greece, and Uzal, were in your markets. Wrought iron, and cassia, and calamus, were in your markets.

verses.latin: Dadan mercatrix tua in tapetibus equestribus pro curribus.
verses.english: “Dedan was your merchant in horse cloths for chariots.

verses.latin: Arabia, et omnes principes Cedar, ipsi negotiatores tui, in agnis, et arietibus, et in hircis, ipsi mercatores tui.
verses.english: “Arabia, and all the princes of Kedar, they were your merchants, in lambs, and rams, and in goats, they were your merchants.

verses.latin: Mercatores Saba et Regma ipsi mercatores tui, in omnibus optimis aromatibus, et in omnibus lapidibus pretiosis, et in auro, in nundinis tuis praestabant.
verses.english: “The merchants of Sheba and Raamah were your merchants. In all the best spices, and in all precious stones, and in gold, they offered them in your markets.

verses.latin: Haran, et Chene, et Eden, mercatores Saba, Assur, et Chelmad, mercatores tui.
verses.english: “Haran, and Kenah, and Eden, the merchants of Sheba, Asshur, and Chilmad, were your merchants.

verses.latin: Ipsi mercatores tui in diversis vestibus, in hyacintho et in serico, et in chrysolitho, et in purpura, et in tapetibus, et in arca, et in optimis vasis, contra te commerciabantur.
verses.english: “These were your merchants in diverse clothes, in hyacinth and in silk, and in chrysolite, and in purple, and in tapestries, and in a chest, and in the best vessels, they traded against you.

verses.latin: Naves maris in meditatione tua: et in partibus tuis repleta es, et glorificata es nimis in corde maris.
verses.english: “The ships of the sea traded with you in your meditation. And you are filled in your parts, and you are greatly glorified in the heart of the sea.

verses.latin: In aquis multis adduxerunt te remiges tui: ventus auster contrivit te in corde maris.
verses.english: “Your rowers brought you into the many waters. The south wind broke you in the heart of the sea.

verses.latin: Divitiae tuae et thesauri tui, et nundinae tuae, nautae tui et gubernatores tui, refectores rimas tuas, et qui commerciabantur in negotiatione tua: omnes viri bellatores qui in te sunt, cum universo coetu tuo, corruent in medio maris in die ruinae tuae.
verses.english: “Your riches and your treasures, and your markets, your sailors and your pilots, those who repair your gaps, and those who traded in your trading: all the men of war who are in you, with your entire assembly, will fall into the middle of the sea on the day of your ruin.

verses.latin: A voce clamoris remigum tuorum contremuerunt pastores.
verses.english: “At the sound of the cry of your rowers, the shepherds trembled.

verses.latin: Et descendent de navibus omnes qui tenebant remos: nautae et universi gubernatores maris super te stabunt.
verses.english: “And all those who held the oars will come down from the ships. The sailors and all the pilots of the sea will stand over you.

verses.latin: Et plangent super te voce magna, et ululabunt, et spargent pulverem super capita sua, et cinere conspergentur.
verses.english: “And they will weep over you with a great voice, and they will wail, and they will throw dust on their heads, and will be sprinkled with ashes.

verses.latin: Et decalvabuntur propter te, et accingentur cilicio, et plangent te in amaritudine animae, planctum amarum.
verses.english: “And they will make themselves bald because of you, and they will gird themselves with sackcloth, and they will weep for you in the bitterness of their soul, a bitter lamentation.

verses.latin: Et assumant super te lamentationem, et plangent te: Quis sicut Tyrum, quae tacuit in medio maris?
verses.english: “And they will take up a lamentation over you, and weep for you, saying: ‘Who is like Tyre, which was silent in the middle of the sea?

verses.latin: Cum exirent commercia tua de mari, saturasti populos multos: in multitudine divitiarum tuarum, et negotiationis tuae, ditasti omnes reges terrae.
verses.english: “When your merchandise went out from the sea, you satisfied many peoples. In the multitude of your riches and your trading, you enriched all the kings of the earth.

verses.latin: Nunc contrita es a mari in profundis aquarum: merces tua et omnis multitudo tua, cecidit in medio tui.
verses.english: “Now you are broken by the sea in the depths of the waters. Your merchandise and all your multitude have fallen in your midst.

verses.latin: Omnes habitatores insularum obstupuerunt super te: et reges earum conturbati sunt, et contristati sunt nimis in vultu.
verses.english: “All the inhabitants of the islands were astonished over you, and their kings were troubled and were greatly saddened in their faces.

verses.latin: Negotiatores populorum sibilabunt super te: et eris in terrorem, et non eris amplius in saeculum.
verses.english: “The merchants of the peoples will hiss over you, and you will be a terror, and you will no longer be forever.”

verses.latin: Factum est verbum Domini ad me, dicens:
verses.english: The Word of the Lord came to me, saying:

verses.latin: Fili hominis, dic principi Tyri: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Quia elevatum est cor tuum, et dixisti: Deus ego sum, et in cathedra Dei sedi, in corde maris; cum sis homo et non Deus, et dederis cor tuum quasi cor Dei.
verses.english: “Son of man, speak to the prince of Tyre: ‘These are the words of the Lord God: “Because your heart has become proud, and you have said: “I am a god; I sit in the seat of God, in the heart of the sea,” although you are a man and not God, and you have given your heart as if it were the heart of God.”’

verses.latin: Ecce, sapiens tu es, et nihil est quod te possit latere.
verses.english: “Behold, you are wise, and nothing can be hidden from you.

verses.latin: In sapientia tua et prudentia tua fecisti tibi fortitudinem, et acquisisti aurum et argentum in thesauris tuis.
verses.english: “By your wisdom and your prudence you have made strength for yourself, and have gathered gold and silver in your treasures.

verses.latin: In multitudine sapientiæ tuæ, et in negotiatione tua multiplicasti fortitudinem tuam: et elevatum est cor tuum in fortitudine tua.
verses.english: “By the abundance of your wisdom, and in your commerce, you have multiplied your strength: and your heart has been lifted up in your strength.

verses.latin: Propterea hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Quia elevatum est cor tuum quasi cor Dei,
verses.english: “Therefore, these are the words of the Lord God: ‘Because your heart has been lifted up as the heart of God,

verses.latin: ideo ecce ego adducam super te alienos, robustissimos gentium: et nudabunt gladium contra speciem sapientiæ tuæ, et contaminabunt gloriam tuam.
verses.english: “therefore, behold, I will bring against you strangers, the most powerful of the nations: and they will draw their swords against the beauty of your wisdom, and will defile your glory.

verses.latin: Inclinabunt te ad foveam, et morieris in interitu vulneratorum in corde maris.
verses.english: “They will bring you down to the pit, and you will die in the death of the wounded in the heart of the sea.

verses.latin: Numquid dicens dices: Deus ego sum, coram interfectoribus tuis, cum sis homo et non Deus, in manu occidentium te?
verses.english: “Will you say, ‘I am a god,’ before your killers, when you are a man and not God, in the hand of those who kill you?

verses.latin: Morte incircumcisi morieris in manu alienorum, quia ego locutus sum, dicit Dominus Deus.
verses.english: “You will die the death of the uncircumcised in the hand of strangers, because I have spoken, says the Lord God.”

verses.latin: Et factum est verbum Domini ad me, dicens:
verses.english: The Word of the Lord came to me, saying:

verses.latin: Fili hominis, assume lamentum super regem Tyri, et dices ei: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Tu signaculum similitudinis, plenus sapientiæ et perfectus decoris.
verses.english: “Son of man, take up a lament for the king of Tyre, and say to him: ‘These are the words of the Lord God: “You were the seal of perfection, full of wisdom, and perfect in beauty.

verses.latin: In deliciis paradisi Dei fuisti: omnis lapis pretiosus operimentum tuum, sardius, topazius, et jaspis, chrysolitus, et onyx, et berillus, sapphirus, et carbunculus, et smaragdus: aurum, opus decoris tui, et foramina tua, in die qua creabaris præparata sunt.
verses.english: “You were in the delights of the paradise of God: every precious stone was your covering, sardius, topaz, and jasper, chrysolite, and onyx, and beryl, sapphire, and carbuncle, and emerald: gold, the work of your beauty, and your openings, were prepared in the day that you were created.

verses.latin: Tu cherub, cum extento et protegens, et posui te in monte sancto Dei: fuisti in medio lapidum ignitorum.
verses.english: “You were a cherub with extended wings, protecting, and I placed you on the holy mountain of God: you were in the midst of the stones of fire.

verses.latin: Perfectus in viis tuis a die creationis tuæ, donec inventa est iniquitas in te.
verses.english: “You were perfect in your ways from the day of your creation, until iniquity was found in you.

verses.latin: In multitudine negotiationis tuæ, repleti sunt interiora tua iniquitate, et peccasti: et eiciam te de monte Dei, et perdam te, cherub, protegens, de medio lapidum ignitorum.
verses.english: “By the abundance of your commerce, your insides were filled with iniquity, and you sinned: and I will cast you out from the mountain of God, and will destroy you, cherub, protecting, from the midst of the stones of fire.

verses.latin: Et elevatum est cor tuum in decore tuo, perdidisti sapientiam tuam in splendore tuo: in terram projeci te, ante faciem regum dedi te, ut videant te.
verses.english: “And your heart was lifted up in your beauty, you have destroyed your wisdom in your splendor: I cast you to the earth, I placed you before the face of kings, that they may see you.

verses.latin: Iniquitatem tuam in multitudine iniquitatis tuæ, et negotiationis tuæ, contaminasti sancta tua: et educam ignem de medio tui, qui comedat te, et dabo te in cinerem super terram in conspectu omnium videntium te.
verses.english: “By the multitude of your iniquity, and in your commerce, you have defiled your holy places: and I will bring fire from the midst of you, which will consume you, and I will give you to ashes on the earth in the sight of all those who see you.

verses.latin: Omnes qui viderint te, inter gentes stupescunt super te: factus es in terrorem, et non eris amplius.
verses.english: “All those who see you among the nations are astonished at you: you have become a terror, and you will be no more.”

verses.latin: Et factum est verbum Domini ad me, dicens:
verses.english: The Word of the Lord came to me, saying:

verses.latin: Fili hominis, pone faciem tuam contra Sidonem, et prophetabis adversus eam,
verses.english: “Son of man, set your face against Sidon, and prophesy against it,

verses.latin: et dices: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Ecce ego adversus te Sidon, et glorificabor in medio tui: et scient quia ego Dominus, cum fecero in ea judicia, et sanctificatus fuero in ea.
verses.english: “and say: ‘These are the words of the Lord God: “Behold, I am against you, Sidon, and I will be glorified in your midst: and they will know that I am the Lord, when I have executed judgments in it, and have been sanctified in it.

verses.latin: Et immittam in eam pestilentiam, et sanguinem in plateis ejus: et corruent interfecti in medio ejus gladio, qui in gyro ejus: et scient quia ego Dominus.
verses.english: “And I will send a pestilence upon it, and blood in its streets: and the slain will fall in the midst of it by the sword that is against it: and they will know that I am the Lord.

verses.latin: Et non erit amplius domui Israël stimulus contrarius, et spina dolens, ex omnibus qui sunt in circuitu ejus, qui despexerunt eam: et scient quia ego Dominus Deus.
verses.english: “And the house of Israel will no longer have a piercing thorn, nor a painful thorn, from all those who are around it, who have despised it: and they will know that I am the Lord God.”

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Cum congregabo domum Israël de populis in quibus dispersi sunt, sanctificabor in eis coram gentibus: et habitabunt in terra sua quam dedi servo meo Jacob.
verses.english: “These are the words of the Lord God: ‘When I gather the house of Israel from the peoples among whom they have been scattered, I will be sanctified in them in the sight of the nations: and they will live in their land that I gave to my servant Jacob.

verses.latin: Et habitabunt in ea securi, et ædificabunt domos, et plantabunt vineas: et habitabunt confidenter, cum fecero judicium in omnibus qui calumniantur eos in circuitu eorum: et scient quia ego Dominus Deus eorum.
verses.english: “And they will live there securely, and they will build houses, and plant vineyards: and they will live confidently, when I have executed judgment on all those who oppress them around them: and they will know that I am the Lord their God.”

verses.latin: Anno decimo, decimo mense, duodecimo die mensis, factum est verbum Domini ad me, dicens:
verses.english: In the tenth year, in the tenth month, on the twelfth day of the month, the Son spoke to me, saying:

verses.latin: Fili hominis, pone faciem tuam contra Pharaonem regem Aegypti, et propheta adversus eum et contra universam Aegyptum.
verses.english: Son of man, turn your face against Pharaoh, king of Egypt, and prophesy against him, and against all of Egypt.

verses.latin: Loquere, et dices: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Ecce ego ad te, Pharao rex Aegypti, draco magnus, qui cubas in medio fluminum tuorum, qui dicis: Meus est fluvius, et ego feci me.
verses.english: Speak and say: “Thus says the Lord God: ‘Behold, I am against you, Pharaoh, king of Egypt, the great dragon who lies in the middle of your streams, who says: “The Nile is mine, and I made myself.”'

verses.latin: Et ponam frenum in maxillis tuis, et alligabo pisces fluminum tuorum ad squamas tuas, et educam te de medio fluminum tuorum, et omnem pisces fluminum tuorum alligabo squamis tuis.
verses.english: And I will put a bit in your jaws, and I will bind the fish of your streams to your scales, and I will bring you out of the middle of your streams, and all the fish of your streams I will bind to your scales.

verses.latin: Et proiciam te in desertum, et omnem pisces fluminum tuorum: in faciem agri cades, non colligeris, neque congregaberis: bestiis terrae et avibus caeli dedi te esca.
verses.english: And I will cast you into the desert, and all the fish of your streams: you will fall on the face of the field, you will not be gathered, nor will you be collected: I have given you as food to the beasts of the earth and the birds of the sky.

verses.latin: Et scient omnes habitatores Aegypti, quia ego Dominus, eo quod fuisti baculus fistulinus domui Israël.
verses.english: And all the inhabitants of Egypt will know that I am the Lord, because you were a broken reed to the house of Israel.

verses.latin: Quando apprehenderunt te manu, confractus es, et dissolvisti omnem lumbum eorum: et quando innitebantur super te, fractus es, et solutum fecisti omne dorsum eorum.
verses.english: When they took hold of you with the hand, you were broken, and you loosened all their loins: and when they leaned on you, you were broken, and you loosened all their backs.

verses.latin: Idcirco hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Ecce ego adducam super te gladium, et interficiam de te hominem et jumentum.
verses.english: Therefore, thus says the Lord God: “Behold, I will bring a sword upon you, and I will kill man and beast from you.

verses.latin: Et erit terra Aegypti in solitudinem, et in desertum: et scient quia ego Dominus, eo quod dixisti: Meus est fluvius, et ego feci me.
verses.english: And the land of Egypt will be a desert, and a wasteland: and they will know that I am the Lord, because you said: “The Nile is mine, and I made myself.”

verses.latin: Ideo ecce ego ad te, et ad flumina tua: et ponam terram Aegypti in solitudines, in desertum, a turre Syenes usque ad terminos Aethiopiae.
verses.english: Therefore, behold, I am against you, and against your rivers: and I will make the land of Egypt deserts, a wasteland, from the tower of Syene to the borders of Ethiopia.

verses.latin: Non vestiatur pede hominis, et pede jumenti non calcabitur, neque habitabitur quadraginta annis.
verses.english: The foot of man will not pass through it, and the foot of the beast will not tread it, nor will it be inhabited for forty years.

verses.latin: Et dabo terram Aegypti desolatam in medio terrarum desolatarum, et civitates ejus desolatas in medio civitatum desolatarum, quadraginta annis: et dispergam Aegyptios in gentibus, et dissipabo eos in terris.
verses.english: And I will make the land of Egypt desolate in the midst of the desolate lands, and her cities desolate in the midst of the desolate cities, for forty years: and I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations, and I will disperse them through the countries.

verses.latin: Quia hæc dicit Dominus Deus: In fine quadraginta annorum congregabo Aegyptios de populis in quibus dispersi fuerant.
verses.english: For thus says the Lord God: “At the end of forty years I will gather the Egyptians from the peoples among whom they were scattered.

verses.latin: Et reducam Aegyptios: et convertam eos in terram Phathros, in terram originis eorum: et erunt ibi parvum regnum.
verses.english: And I will bring back the Egyptians, and I will bring them back to the land of Pathros, to the land of their origin: and there they will be a small kingdom.

verses.latin: Et erit parvum inter regna, nec exaltabitur ultra super gentes: et non adjiciam ut dominentur in gentibus.
verses.english: And it will be small among the kingdoms, and it will not be exalted any more above the nations: and I will not add that they should rule over the nations.

verses.latin: Et non erit ultra spes domui Israël, memorantes iniquitatem eorum, quando conversi fuerint post eos: et sciant quia ego Dominus Deus.
verses.english: And there will no longer be hope for the house of Israel, remembering their iniquity, when they have turned after them: and they will know that I am the Lord God.”

verses.latin: In anno vicesimo septimo, mense primo, in prima mensis, factum est verbum Domini ad me, dicens:
verses.english: In the twenty-seventh year, in the first month, on the first day of the month, the Son spoke to me, saying:

verses.latin: Fili hominis, Chaldæi fecerunt captivos de Tyro, et de Sidone: propter hoc quod tradiderunt Aegyptum, in potestatem gentium: et dedi illam in manu eorum.
verses.english: Son of man, the Chaldeans have taken captives from Tyre and Sidon: because they handed Egypt over to the power of the nations: and I have given it into their hand.

verses.latin: Propterea hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Ecce ego dabo terram Aegypti Nabuchodonosor regi Babylonis: et auferet multitudinem ejus, et diripiet praedam ejus, et rapient spolia ejus: et erit merces exercitus ejus.
verses.english: Therefore, thus says the Lord God: “Behold, I will give the land of Egypt to Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon: and he will take away its multitude, and will plunder its spoils, and will take its plunder: and it will be the reward of his army.

verses.latin: Mercedem quam operatus est, dedi ei in terra Aegypti: eo quod laboraverant in me, dicit Dominus Deus.
verses.english: I have given him a reward for the work he has done in the land of Egypt: because they labored for me, says the Lord God.”

verses.latin: In die illa germinabo cornu domui Israël, et dabo tibi os in medio eorum, et scient quia ego Dominus.
verses.english: “On that day I will make the horn of the house of Israel sprout, and I will give you a mouth among them, and they will know that I am the Lord.”

verses.latin: Verbum Domini factum est ad me, dicens:
verses.english: The word of the Lord came to me, saying:

verses.latin: Fili hominis, vaticinare, et dic: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Ululate: Va, dies! Va, dies!
verses.english: Son of man, prophesy and say: "These are the words of the Lord God: Howl, 'Woe, the day!' Woe, the day!"

verses.latin: Quia juxta est dies, juxta est dies Domini, dies tenebrarum, et nubis, et caliginis: et super eam erit dies, et tuba canetur in terra.
verses.english: Because the day is near. The day of the Lord is near: a day of darkness, of clouds, and of thick gloom. The day will be on the land, and the trumpet will be sounded there.

verses.latin: Et conturbabo Ægyptum, et erit dolor in Æthiopia, et irruent in Ægyptum, et dissipabuntur fundamenta ejus.
verses.english: I will bring about chaos in Egypt, and there will be pain in Ethiopia, and those who are strong will enter Egypt. Its foundations will be destroyed.

verses.latin: Æthiopes, et Libyes, et Lydi, et omnis turba mixta, et Chub, et filii terræ fœderis, cum eis gladio corruent.
verses.english: The Ethiopians, and the Libyans, and the Lydians, and every mixed crowd, and Chub, and the sons of the land that is in league, they will fall with the sword.

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus: Corruent qui sustinent Ægyptum, et humiliabitur superbia roboris ejus: a turre Syenes gladius corruet in ea, ait Dominus Deus.
verses.english: These are the words of the Lord: "Those who support Egypt will fall, and the pride of its strength will be humbled. The sword will fall on them, from the tower of Syene," says the Lord God.

verses.latin: Et desolabo terram Ægypti, et solitudinem dabo in ea, a turre Syenes usque ad terminos Æthiopiæ.
verses.english: I will make the land of Egypt desolate, and I will bring about solitude there, from the tower of Syene to the borders of Ethiopia.

verses.latin: Et cognoscent Ægyptii quod ego Dominus, quando dedero ignem in Ægyptum, et contriti fuerint omnes auxiliatores ejus.
verses.english: The Egyptians will know that I am the Lord, when I have put fire in Egypt, and all its helpers have been destroyed.

verses.latin: In die illa, erunt nuntii a facie mea in trieribus, ut conterant Æthiopiam confidentem, et erit tremor in eis, sicut in die Ægypti: quia ecce venit.
verses.english: In that day, messengers will go out from my presence in ships, to destroy confident Ethiopia, and there will be terror among them, as in the day of Egypt, because, behold, it comes.

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Dissipabo multitudinem Ægypti, in manu Nabuchodonosor regis Babylonis.
verses.english: These are the words of the Lord God: "I will destroy the multitude of Egypt, by the hand of Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon.

verses.latin: Ipse et populus ejus cum eo fortiores gentium, ad perdendam terram: et evaginabunt gladios suos super Ægyptum, et implebunt terram interfectorum.
verses.english: He and his people with him, who are the strongest of the nations, will be for the destruction of the land: they will draw their swords against Egypt, and they will fill the land with the slain.

verses.latin: Et flumina siccabo, et tradam terram in manu impiorum, et desolabo terram et plenitudinem ejus in manu alienorum: ego Dominus locutus sum.
verses.english: I will dry up the rivers, and I will hand the land over to the hand of the wicked, and I will desolate the land and its fullness, by the hand of foreigners: I, the Lord, have spoken.

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Dissipabo idola, et conteram simulacra de Memphis: et non erit princeps de terra Ægypti, et dabo timorem in terra Ægypti.
verses.english: These are the words of the Lord God: "I will destroy the idols, and I will break the images of Memphis: there will be no prince from the land of Egypt, and I will put fear in the land of Egypt.

verses.latin: Et vastabo Phathros, et dabo ignem in Taphnis, et faciam judicia in Ægypto.
verses.english: I will desolate Pathros, and I will put fire in Taphnis, and I will bring about judgments in Egypt.

verses.latin: Et effundam indignationem meam super Sin, fortitudinem Ægypti, et disperdam multitudinem Alexandriae.
verses.english: I will pour out my indignation on Sin, the strength of Egypt, and I will destroy the multitude of Alexandria.

verses.latin: Et dabo ignem in Ægypto: conturbabitur Sin conturbabitur Alexandria, et Memphis angustiabitur in die.
verses.english: I will put fire in Egypt: Sin will be troubled, Alexandria will be troubled, and Memphis will be brought into distress during the day.

verses.latin: Adolescentes Aven et Phibeseth gladio corruent, et ipsæ in captivitatem ducentur.
verses.english: The young men of Aven and Phibeseth will fall by the sword, and they will be led into captivity.

verses.latin: In Taphnis quoque obtenebrabitur dies, quando confringam ibi sceptra Ægypti, et cessabit in ea superbia roboris ejus: nubis operiet eam, et filiæ ejus in captivitatem ducentur.
verses.english: In Taphnis, the day will also be darkened, when I break the scepters of Egypt there, and the pride of its strength will cease in it. A cloud will cover it, and its daughters will be led into captivity.

verses.latin: Et faciam judicia in Ægypto, et scient quia ego Dominus.
verses.english: I will bring about judgments in Egypt, and they will know that I am the Lord.

verses.latin: Factum est autem in undecimo anno, in mense primo, in prima mensis, factum est verbum Domini ad me, dicens:
verses.english: In the eleventh year, in the first month, on the first day of the month, the word of the Lord came to me, saying:

verses.latin: Fili hominis, brachium Pharaonis regis Ægypti confregi: et ecce non est colligatum, ut ponatur pannis ad curandum, et ligetur, ut habeat robur ad portandum gladium.
verses.english: Son of man, I have broken the arm of Pharaoh king of Egypt: and behold, it is not bound up so that it may be put in cloths to heal it, nor tied, that it might have strength to carry the sword.

verses.latin: Propterea hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Ecce ego contra Pharaonem regem Ægypti, et confringam brachia ejus, quae valida sunt, et quae confracta: et proiciam gladium de manu ejus.
