verses.english: Therefore, these are the words of the Lord God: "Behold, I am against Pharaoh king of Egypt, and I will break his arms, both the strong ones and the broken ones: and I will cast the sword from his hand.

verses.latin: Et dispergam Ægyptios in gentibus, et ventilabo eos in terris.
verses.english: I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations, and I will scatter them throughout the lands.

verses.latin: Et confortabo brachia regis Babylonis, et dabo gladium meum in manu ejus, et confringam brachia Pharaonis, et gemitus mortui gement in conspectu ejus.
verses.english: I will strengthen the arms of the king of Babylon, and I will put my sword in his hand, and I will break the arms of Pharaoh, and the groans of the slain will groan before him.

verses.latin: Et confortabo brachia regis Babylonis, et brachia Pharaonis cadent, et scient quia ego Dominus, quando dedero gladium meum in manu regis Babylonis, et extendar eum super terram Ægypti.
verses.english: I will strengthen the arms of the king of Babylon, and the arms of Pharaoh will fall, and they will know that I am the Lord, when I put my sword in the hand of the king of Babylon, and he stretches it out over the land of Egypt.

verses.latin: Et dispergam Ægyptios in gentibus, et ventilabo eos in terris, et scient quia ego Dominus.
verses.english: And I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations, and I will scatter them throughout the lands, and they will know that I am the Lord.

verses.latin: Factum est ergo in anno undecimo, in tertio, in mensis, factum est verbum Domini ad me, dicens:
verses.english: In the eleventh year, in the third month, the word of the Lord came to me saying:

verses.latin: Fili hominis, loquere Pharaoni regi Aegypti, et populo ejus: Cui gloriæ similis factus es in magnitudine tua?
verses.english: Son of man, speak to Pharaoh, king of Egypt, and to his people: “To whom are you like, in your glory and greatness?”

verses.latin: Ecce Assyrius, quasi cedrus in Libano, pulcher ramis, et umbrosa fronde, staturaque sublimis, et cacumen illius erat in nubibus.
verses.english: Behold, the Assyrian was like a cedar in Lebanon, beautiful in its branches, its foliage gave shade, it was tall, and its top was in the clouds.

verses.latin: Aquae nutrierunt eum, abyssus exaltavit illum: flumina ejus ibant in circuitu plantarum ejus, et miserat gurgites suos ad universos fructus ejus.
verses.english: Water nourished it, the deep lifted it up; its rivers flowed around its planting, and it sent out its streams to all the trees.

verses.latin: Idcirco exaltatum est cacumen ejus super omnes arbores regionis, et multiplicata sunt rami ejus, et elongata sunt brachia ejus in aquis multis, cum emitteret illud in sublimitate sua.
verses.english: Therefore its top was raised above all the trees of the region, and its branches multiplied, and its arms extended into the many waters, when it sent out its height.

verses.latin: In ramis ejus nidificaverunt omnes volucres caeli, et sub ramis ejus fecerunt nidos cuncta animalia terrae, et sub umbra ejus habitabant nationes multae.
verses.english: In its branches nested all the birds of the sky, and under its branches made their nests all the beasts of the earth, and under its shadow dwelt many nations.

verses.latin: Et factus est speciosus in magnitudine sua, et in longitudine ramorum suorum, quia radix ejus erat juxta aquas multas.
verses.english: And it became beautiful in its greatness and in the length of its branches, because its root was near many waters.

verses.latin: Cedri non erant altiores eo in paradiso Dei: abiegnus non adaequavit ramos ejus, et platani non fuerunt similes frondibus ejus: omnis arbor in paradiso Dei non est comparata ei in pulchritudine sua.
verses.english: The cedars were not higher than it in the paradise of God; the fir trees did not equal its branches, and the plane trees were not like its leaves; no tree in the paradise of God was like it in its beauty.

verses.latin: Ego decoravi eum in multitudine ramorum ejus: et inviderunt ei universae arbores voluptatis, quae erant in paradiso Dei.
verses.english: I made it beautiful in the multitude of its branches, and all the trees of pleasure that were in the paradise of God envied it.

verses.latin: Propterea haec dicit Dominus Deus: Eo quod exaltatum est in altitudine, et dedit cacumen suum in nebulas, et elevatum est cor ejus in sublimitate sua,
verses.english: Therefore thus says the Lord God: Because it was exalted in height, and its top gave itself to the clouds, and its heart was lifted up in its height,

verses.latin: tradidi illud in manu fortissimi gentium: faciet ei; secundum impietatem ejus feci ei.
verses.english: I delivered it into the hand of the most powerful of the nations: he will deal with it; I have done to it according to its wickedness.

verses.latin: Et projecerunt illud alieni de gentibus, et in montibus projeci illud, et in vallibus corruerunt rami ejus, et contrita sunt brachia ejus a cunctis ripis terrae, et dimiserunt de umbra ejus omnes populi, et dereliquerunt illud.
verses.english: And strangers from the nations threw it down, and I cast it on the mountains, and its branches fell in the valleys, and its arms were broken by all the rivers of the earth, and all the peoples left its shadow and abandoned it.

verses.latin: Super ruinam ejus habitabunt omnes volucres caeli, et in ramis ejus erunt cunctae bestiae terrae:
verses.english: On its ruin will dwell all the birds of the sky, and in its branches will be all the beasts of the earth:

verses.latin: ut non se efferat in altitudine sua omnis arbor aquarum, nec ponant cacumen suum in nebulis, quando universae arboribus aquarum in morte tradentur in inferius terram, in medio filiorum hominum, qui descendunt in lacum.
verses.english: so that no tree of the waters will exalt itself in its height, nor set its top in the clouds, when all the trees of the waters are delivered to death in the lower earth, in the midst of the children of men who go down to the pit.

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus Deus: In die qua descendit ad inferos, luctum egi, operui eum abysso, et prohibui flumina ejus, et cohibui aquas multas: et conteri feci Libanum in eo, et contrita sunt super eum universa ligna agri.
verses.english: Thus says the Lord God: On the day that it went down to hell, I mourned; I covered it with the abyss and restrained its rivers and held back the many waters: and I caused Lebanon to mourn for it, and all the trees of the field were broken over it.

verses.latin: Sonitum plagae ejus audivi, cum projicerem eum ad inferos: et contremuerunt propter eum universae arbores voluptatis, quae erant in Libano, et omnes qui enutriti sunt in terra.
verses.english: I heard the sound of its fall, when I cast it down to hell; and because of it trembled all the trees of pleasure that were in Lebanon, and all who were nourished on the earth.

verses.latin: Et ipsi quoque descenderunt cum eo ad inferos, ad eos qui interfecti fuerant gladio, et brachium ejus, qui habitabat sub umbra ejus in medio gentium.
verses.english: They also went down with it to hell, to those who had been killed by the sword, and its arm, which dwelt under its shadow in the midst of the nations.

verses.latin: Cui similis es in gloria et magnitudine inter ligna voluptatis? Nunc vero cum lignis voluptatis deduceris in inferiorem terram: in medio incircumcisorum dormies cum interfectis gladio. Hoc Pharao, et omnis multitudo ejus, dicit Dominus Deus.
verses.english: To whom are you like in glory and greatness among the trees of pleasure? Now you will be led down with the trees of pleasure to the lower earth: in the midst of the uncircumcised, you will sleep with those killed by the sword. This is Pharaoh, and all his multitude, says the Lord God.

verses.latin: Factum est verbum Domini ad me, dicens:
verses.english: The Word of the Lord came to me, saying:

verses.latin: Fili hominis, assume lamentationem super Pharaonem regem Ægypti, et dices ei: Leo gentium contritus est.
verses.english: Son of man, make a lament for Pharaoh, king of Egypt, and say to him: The lion of the nations is destroyed.

verses.latin: Quasi draco in aquis, tu contriveras gentes: et egredieris cum fluminibus tuis, et conturbabis aquas pedibus tuis, et conculcabis fluenta eorum.
verses.english: Like a dragon in the waters, you were crushing nations: you went out with your rivers, and you stirred up the waters with your feet, and you trampled their streams.

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Expandam super te rete meum in multitudine populorum, et adducam te in laqueos meos.
verses.english: Thus says the Lord God: I will spread out my net over you with a multitude of peoples, and I will bring you into my snares.

verses.latin: Et projiciam te in terram, et jaciam te super faciem agri: et habitare faciam super te omnes volucres cæli, et implebo de te bestias universæ terræ.
verses.english: And I will cast you upon the land, and I will cast you upon the face of the field: and I will make all the birds of the sky dwell upon you, and I will fill the beasts of all the earth with you.

verses.latin: Et dabo carnes tuas super montes, et implebo valles de altitudine tua.
verses.english: And I will give your flesh upon the mountains, and I will fill the valleys with your height.

verses.latin: Et exarescam terram, cum exstinctus fueris, et operiam cælos, et obscurabo stellas ejus: solem nubibus velabo, et luna non dabit lumen suum.
verses.english: And I will dry up the land, when you are extinguished, and I will cover the skies, and I will darken its stars: I will veil the sun with clouds, and the moon will not give its light.

verses.latin: Omnia luminaria splendoris cæli caligabo super te, et dabo tenebras super terram tuam, ait Dominus Deus.
verses.english: I will make dark all the lights of the sky's splendor over you, and I will bring darkness upon your land, says the Lord God.

verses.latin: Et conturbabo cor multorum populorum, cum introduxero contritum tuum in gentibus, in terras quas nescisti.
verses.english: And I will trouble the hearts of many peoples, when I bring your destruction among the nations, into the lands which you have not known.

verses.latin: Et desolabo super te gentes, et reges eorum horrebunt super te, cum gladium meum vibrabo in facie eorum: et trepidabunt a momento, unusquisque pro anima sua, in die ruinæ tuæ.
verses.english: And I will make the nations desolate over you, and their kings will shudder over you, when I brandish my sword before their faces: and they will tremble in an instant, each one for his own soul, on the day of your ruin.

verses.latin: Quia hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Gladius regis Babylonis veniet super te.
verses.english: For thus says the Lord God: The sword of the king of Babylon will come upon you.

verses.latin: In manibus fortium deprimam te, et terrorem gentium: et ponam te super montes excelsos, et interibunt corda tua, et occides in medio mari.
verses.english: I will cast you down by the hands of the mighty, the terror of the nations: and I will set you upon the high mountains, and your hearts will perish, and you will die in the midst of the sea.

verses.latin: Et cessare faciam omnes bestias ejus, et disperdam omnem pecudem ejus super aquas multas: non conturbabit ultra pes hominis eas, nec ungula pecudum conculcabit eas.
verses.english: And I will make all its beasts cease, and I will destroy all its cattle upon the many waters: the foot of man will no longer disturb them, nor will the hoof of cattle trample them.

verses.latin: Tunc clarificabo aquas eorum, et flumina eorum curre, quasi oleum, dicit Dominus Deus.
verses.english: Then I will make their waters clear, and I will cause their rivers to flow like oil, says the Lord God.

verses.latin: Cum dedero terram Ægypti desolatam, et destituerem terram ab abundantia sua, cum percussero omnes qui habitant in ea: et scietis quod ego sum Dominus.
verses.english: When I have made the land of Egypt desolate, and have left the land from its fullness, when I strike all those who dwell in it: then you will know that I am the Lord.

verses.latin: Hæc lamentatio erit, et plangent eam filiæ gentium: super Ægyptum, et super omnem multitudinem ejus: super filias gentium.
verses.english: This is the lamentation, and the daughters of the nations will weep for it: for Egypt and for all its multitude: for the daughters of the nations.

verses.latin: Factum est autem in duodecimo anno, in duodecimo mense, in prima mensis, factum est verbum Domini ad me, dicens:
verses.english: Now it happened in the twelfth year, in the twelfth month, on the first of the month, that the Word of the Lord came to me, saying:

verses.latin: Fili hominis, plange super multitudinem Ægypti, et detrude eam, tu et filiæ insignium gentium, in profundiora terræ, cum descendentibus in lacum.
verses.english: Son of man, lament over the multitude of Egypt, and cast it down, you and the daughters of the famous nations, into the deepest parts of the earth, with those who go down into the pit.

verses.latin: Quem superas in pulchritudine? Cum descenderis, dormies cum incircumcisis.
verses.english: Whom do you surpass in beauty? When you go down, you will sleep with the uncircumcised.

verses.latin: In medio interfectorum gladio cadent: gladius datus est, depopulati sunt, cum universa multitudine ejus.
verses.english: They will fall in the midst of those slain by the sword: the sword has been given, they are laid waste, with all its multitude.

verses.latin: Loquentur ei fortes de fortibus, de medio inferni: descenderunt, dormierunt incircumcisi, qui occisi sunt gladio.
verses.english: The mighty will speak to him from among the mighty, from the midst of the underworld: they have gone down, they have slept uncircumcised, who were slain by the sword.

verses.latin: Assyrius ibi, et omnis coetus ejus: circum ejus sepulcrum omnes interfecti, et qui ceciderunt gladio.
verses.english: Assyria is there, and all its company: around his tomb all those slain, and those who have fallen by the sword.

verses.latin: Cujus posuerunt sepulcrum in profundis laci, et coetus ejus in circuitu sepulcri ejus: omnes occisi, et qui ceciderunt gladio, qui dati sunt timor in terra viventium.
verses.english: Whose tomb they have placed in the depths of the pit, and his company around his tomb: all the slain, and those who have fallen by the sword, who have given terror in the land of the living.

verses.latin: Ibi Elam, et omnis multitudo ejus in circuitu sepulcri ejus: omnes occisi, et qui ceciderunt gladio: qui descenderunt incircumcisi in profundum terræ, qui dederunt timorem in terra viventium, et portaverunt confusionem suam cum his qui descenderunt in lacum.
verses.english: There is Elam, and all its multitude around his tomb: all those slain, and those who have fallen by the sword: who have gone down uncircumcised into the depths of the earth, who have given terror in the land of the living, and have borne their shame with those who have gone down into the pit.

verses.latin: Interfectis dederunt lectum cum universa multitudine ejus: circum ejus sepulcrum, omnes incircumcisi: quia dati sunt timor in terra viventium, et portaverunt confusionem suam cum his qui descenderunt in lacum: in medio interfectorum.
verses.english: They have given a bed among those slain with all its multitude: around his tomb, all the uncircumcised: because they have given terror in the land of the living, and have borne their shame with those who have gone down into the pit: in the midst of the slain.

verses.latin: Ibi Mosoch, Thubal, et omnis multitudo ejus: circum eum sepulcrum ejus, omnes incircumcisi, qui interfecti sunt gladio: putaverunt enim se iniquos in terra viventium.
verses.english: There is Meshech, Tubal, and all its multitude: around him is his tomb, all the uncircumcised, who were slain by the sword: for they thought themselves wicked in the land of the living.

verses.latin: Et non dormiebant cum fortibus, qui ceciderunt de gentibus, qui descenderunt in infernum cum armis suis, et posuerunt gladios suos sub capitibus eorum: et erant iniquitates eorum in ossibus eorum, quia facti sunt terror fortium in terra viventium.
verses.english: And they did not sleep with the mighty, who have fallen from the nations, who have gone down into hell with their weapons, and have placed their swords under their heads: and their iniquities were upon their bones, because they were the terror of the mighty in the land of the living.

verses.latin: Tu autem in medio incircumcisorum confringes, et dormies cum interfectis gladio.
verses.english: But you, in the midst of the uncircumcised, will be broken, and you will sleep with those slain by the sword.

verses.latin: Ibi sunt duces, et omnis multitudo ejus: circum eorum sepulcrum, omnes incircumcisi, qui ceciderunt gladio, cum iis qui dederunt timorem in terra viventium.
verses.english: There are the leaders, and all their multitude: around their tomb, all the uncircumcised, who have fallen by the sword, with those who have given terror in the land of the living.

verses.latin: Ibi principes aquilonis universi, et omnes Sidonii, qui descenderunt cum interfectis, territi, et confusi in fortitudine sua: et posuerunt ignominiam suam cum his qui descenderant in lacum.
verses.english: There are the princes of the north, everyone, and all the Sidonians, who have gone down with the slain, terrified, and confused in their strength: and they have placed their shame with those who have gone down into the pit.

verses.latin: Pharao videbit eos, et consolabitur super omnem multitudinem suam: Pharao, et omnis exercitus ejus, interfecti gladio, dicit Dominus Deus.
verses.english: Pharaoh will see them, and will be comforted over all his multitude: Pharaoh, and all his army, slain by the sword, says the Lord God.

verses.latin: Quia dedi timorem meum in terra viventium, et in medio incircumcisorum dormiet: cum interfectis gladio Pharao, et omnis multitudo ejus, dicit Dominus Deus.
verses.english: For I have given my terror in the land of the living, and he will sleep in the midst of the uncircumcised: with those slain by the sword, Pharaoh and all his multitude, says the Lord God.

verses.latin: Factum est verbum Domini ad me, dicens:
verses.english: The Lord's Word came to me, saying:

verses.latin: Fili hominis, loquere ad filios populi tui, et dices ad eos: Cum induxero gladium super terram, et tulerit populus de terra virum unum, et constituerint eum sibi speculatorem,
verses.english: “Son of man, speak to the people and say to them: 'If I bring a sword to the land, and the people of the land take a man, and make him their watchman',

verses.latin: et ille viderit gladium venientem super terram, et clangat buccina, et annuntiaverit populo,
verses.english: “If the watchman sees the sword coming to the land, and blows the trumpet, and warns the people,”

verses.latin: et ille qui audierit sonitum buccinae, et non se praecaverit, et venerit gladius, et tulerit eum: sanguis ejus erit super caput ejus.
verses.english: “If the one who hears the sound of the trumpet, does not take warning, and the sword comes and takes him away: his blood will be on his own head.”

verses.latin: Sonitum buccinae audivit, et non se praecavit: sanguis ejus in eo erit: quod autem se praecavisset, animam suam liberasset.
verses.english: “He heard the sound of the trumpet, but he didn’t take warning: his blood will be on him. If he takes warning, he will save his life.”

verses.latin: Quod si speculator viderit gladium venientem, et non clanguerit buccina: et populus non se praecaverit, et venerit gladius, et tulerit de medio eorum animam: iste quidem in iniquitate sua captus est, sanguinem autem ejus de manu speculatoris requiram.
verses.english: “But if the watchman sees the sword coming, and does not blow the trumpet, and the people do not take warning, and the sword comes and takes away any of them, the watchman is the cause of his own death, and I will hold the watchman accountable for his blood.”

verses.latin: Tu ergo, fili hominis, constitui te speculatorem domui Israël: et audies de ore meo verbum, et annuntiabis eis ex me.
verses.english: “So you, son of man, I have made you a watchman to the house of Israel. You will hear the word from my mouth, and you shall warn them from me.”

verses.latin: Si, cum dixero impio: Impie, morte morieris: non locutus fueris, ut se custodiat impius a via sua: ipse impius in iniquitate sua morietur, ego autem sanguinem ejus de manu tua requiram.
verses.english: “If I say to the wicked, 'O wicked man, you shall surely die', and you do not speak to warn the wicked man to turn from his way, that wicked man shall die in his iniquity, but I will require his blood from your hand.”

verses.latin: Quod si annuntiaveris impio ut a via sua convertatur, et non fuerit conversus a via sua: ipse quidem in iniquitate sua morietur, tu autem animam tuam liberasti.
verses.english: “If you warn the wicked to turn from his way, and he does not turn from his way, that wicked man shall die in his iniquity, but you will have saved your life.”

verses.latin: Tu ergo, fili hominis, dic domui Israël: Sic locuti estis, dicentes: Iniquitates nostræ, et peccata nostra super nos sunt, et in ipsis tabescimus: quomodo ergo vivere poterimus?
verses.english: “Therefore, son of man, tell the house of Israel, 'You are saying, “Our sins and our iniquities are upon us, and we waste away because of them. How then can we live?”'

verses.latin: Dic ad eos: Vivo ego, dicit Dominus Deus, nolo mortem impii, sed ut impius convertatur a via sua, et vivat. Convertimini, convertimini a viis vestris malis: et quare moriemini, domus Israël?
verses.english: “Tell them, as I live, says the Lord God, I don't want the wicked to die, but that the wicked would turn from his way and live. Turn, turn from your evil ways, and why will you die, O house of Israel?”

verses.latin: Tu ergo, fili hominis, dic filiis populi tui: Justitia justi non liberabit eum in quacumque die peccaverit: et impietas impii non nocebit ei, in quacumque die conversus fuerit ab impietate sua: et justus in justitia sua non poterit vivere in quacumque die peccaverit.
verses.english: “You, son of man, tell the children of your people, 'The justice of the just will not deliver him in the day that he sins; and the wickedness of the wicked will not hurt him on the day that he turns from his wickedness. And the just man will not be able to live in his justice on the day that he sins.”

verses.latin: Quia, cum dixero justo quod vita vivat: et ille confisus in justitia sua peccaverit, omnes justitiæ ejus obliviscentur, et in iniquitate sua quam operatus est, ipse morietur.
verses.english: “'When I tell the just man that he will surely live, and he trusts in his justice and sins, all his acts of justice will be forgotten, and in the iniquity he committed, he will die.”

verses.latin: Et cum dixero impio: Morte morieris: et egerit pœnitentiam a peccato suo, et fecerit judicium et justitiam,
verses.english: “And when I say to the wicked, 'You shall surely die', and he does penance for his sin, and does what is lawful and right,”

verses.latin: et impius reddiderit pignus, et quae rapuit, restituerit, et in mandatis vitæ ambulaverit, non faciens iniquitatem: vita vivet, et non morietur.
verses.english: “'if the wicked restores the pledge, and gives back what he had stolen, and walks in the commandments of life, not doing any injustice: he shall live, and not die.”

verses.latin: Omnium peccatorum ejus, quæ operatus est, non memorabor: justitiam operatus est, vita vivet.
verses.english: “None of his sins which he committed will be remembered. He did what is lawful and right, he shall live.”

verses.latin: Et dixerunt filii populi tui: Non est directa via Domini: cum ipsi via sua sit perversa.
verses.english: “And the children of your people say, 'The way of the Lord is not just', when it is their own way that is perverted.”

verses.latin: Cum enim a justo recesserit justus, et fecerit iniquitatem, morietur in ea.
verses.english: “When the just man turns from his justice, and does iniquity, he shall die in his iniquity.”

verses.latin: Et cum recesserit impius ab impietate sua, et fecerit judicium et justitiam, ipse vivet in eis.
verses.english: “And when the wicked turns from his wickedness, and does what is lawful and right, he will live in them.”

verses.latin: Et dixistis: Non est directa via Domini: unumquodque secundum vias suas judicabo vos, domus Israël.
verses.english: “And you say, 'The way of the Lord is not just', but I will judge each of you according to your ways, O house of Israel.”

verses.latin: Factum est autem in duodecimo anno captivitatis nostræ, in mense decimo, quinta die mensis, venit ad me qui fugerat ab Jerusalem, dicens: Captum est civitas.
verses.english: “And in the twelfth year of our captivity, in the tenth month, on the fifth day of the month, there came to me a man who had escaped from Jerusalem, saying: The city is taken!”

verses.latin: Et facta est super me manus Domini in vespere, antequam veniret ille qui fugerat, et aperuit os meum, donec veniret ad me mane, et apertum est os meum, et non sum amplius conticatus.
verses.english: “And the hand of the Lord was upon me in the evening, before the one who had escaped came to me, and He opened my mouth until he came to me in the morning, and my mouth was opened, and I was no longer silent.”

verses.latin: Et factum est verbum Domini ad me, dicens:
verses.english: “And the word of the Lord came to me, saying:”

verses.latin: Fili hominis, habitatores solitudinis istius loquuntur, dicentes: Abraham solus erat, et possedit terram: nos autem multi sumus, ideo data est nobis terra in possessionem.
verses.english: “Son of man, the inhabitants of these deserts speak among themselves, saying: 'Abraham was one, and he possessed the land, but we are many; therefore the land has been given to us to possess.”

verses.latin: Propter hoc dic eis: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Cum sanguine comederitis, et idolis oculos vestros levaveritis, et sanguinem effuderitis, terram possidebitis?
verses.english: “So tell them, thus says the Lord God: 'Will you possess the land when you eat with blood, and lift your eyes to your idols, and have shed blood?'

verses.latin: Stetistis in gladio vestro, fecistis abominationem, et maculastis singuli uxorem proximi vestri, et terram possidebitis?
verses.english: “'You have stood by your sword, you have committed abomination, and you have defiled the wife of your neighbor, and will you possess the land?'

verses.latin: Dic eis: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Vivo ego, quod reliqui qui in solitudinibus sunt, gladio cadent: et quicumque fuerit in agro, bestiis dabo eum ad comedendum: qui autem in munitionibus et in cavernis, peste morientur.
verses.english: “Tell them, thus says the Lord God: 'As I live, those who are in the deserts shall fall by the sword. And whoever is in the open country, I will give them to be eaten by beasts; and those who are in the fortresses and in the caves, shall die of the plague.”

verses.latin: Et dabo terram in solitudinem, et in stuporem: et confusa erit superbia fortitudinis ejus, et desolabuntur montes Israël, ita ut nullus sit qui transeat.
verses.english: “I will make the land a desert, and a horror; and the pride of its power shall be confounded, and the mountains of Israel will be desolate, and no one shall pass through them.”

verses.latin: Et scient quia ego Dominus, cum dedero terram in solitudinem, propter universas abominationes eorum quas operati sunt.
verses.english: “And they will know that I am the Lord, when I have made the land a desert because of all their abominations that they have done.”

verses.latin: Tu ergo, fili hominis, filii populi tui loquuntur de te juxta muros, et in ostiis domorum, et loquuntur vir ad fratrem suum, dicentes: Venite, et audite quæ verbum est quod egreditur a Domino.
verses.english: “And you, son of man, your people are talking about you by the walls, and in the doors of the houses, and they are speaking to each other, saying: 'Come and hear what is the word that is coming from the Lord.”

verses.latin: Et veniunt ad te quasi populus, et sedent coram te populus meus, et audiunt verba tua, et non faciunt ea: quia quasi canticum amoris faciunt illud: in ore quidem eorum, sed in corde ipsorum, post avaritiam eunt.
verses.english: “And they come to you as the people come, and sit before you as my people, and they hear your words, but they do not do them, for they make it like a song of love with their mouths, but their hearts are set on greed.”

verses.latin: Et eris eis quasi canticum amoris in voce dulcis et bene canentis: et audient verba tua, et non facient ea.
verses.english: “And you will be like a song of love to them with a sweet voice and skill in singing, and they will hear your words, but they will not do them.”

verses.latin: Cum autem venerit hoc, ecce veniet: et scient quia propheta fuit in medio eorum.
verses.english: “When this comes to pass, then it will come to pass, and they will know that a prophet was among them.”

verses.latin: Et factum est verbum Domini ad me, dicens:
verses.english: The Lord's word came to me, saying:

verses.latin: Fili hominis, vaticinare ad pastores Israël: vaticinare, et dices pastoribus: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Væ pastoribus Israël, qui pascebant semetipsos! numquid non oves pascuntur a pastoribus?
verses.english: “Son of man, prophesy to the shepherds of Israel. Prophesy, and tell the shepherds, ‘Thus says the Lord God: Woe to the shepherds of Israel, who feed themselves! Do not the shepherds feed the sheep?

verses.latin: Lactem comeditis, et lanam induimini, et quod crassum est, occiditis, gregem autem meum non pascebatis:
verses.english: “You eat the milk, you clothe yourselves with the wool, you slaughter the fat ones, but you do not feed my flock.

verses.latin: quod infirmum fuit, non consolidastis, et quod ægrotum, non sanastis, et quod confractum est, non alligastis, et quod ejectum est, non reduxistis, et quod perierat, non quæsistis, sed cum imperio durissimo dominabamini eis.
verses.english: “You have not strengthened the weak, nor healed the sick, nor bound up the broken, nor brought back the strayed, nor sought the lost; but you have ruled them with force and cruelty.

verses.latin: Et dispersæ sunt oves meæ, eo quod non esset pastor, et factæ sunt in rapinam omni bestiæ agri, et dispersæ sunt.
verses.english: “My sheep were scattered, because they had no shepherd; and they became food for all the wild beasts of the field, and were scattered.

verses.latin: Erraverunt oves meæ in universis montibus, et in omni colle excelso, et super universam terram dispersæ sunt oves meæ, et non erat qui requireret, neque qui quæreret eas.
verses.english: “My sheep wandered through all the mountains and on every high hill. Yes, my sheep were scattered across the whole earth, and there was no one to seek them or look for them.

verses.latin: Propterea, pastores, audite verbum Domini:
verses.english: “Therefore, you shepherds, hear the word of the Lord:

verses.latin: Vivit ego, dicit Dominus Deus, pro eo quod oves meæ datæ sunt in rapinam, et oves meæ factæ sunt in escam omni bestiæ agri, eo quod non esset pastor, et pastores mei non quæsierunt oves meas, sed pascebant seipsos, et oves meas non pascebant:
verses.english: “As I live, says the Lord God, because my sheep have become a prey, and my sheep have become food for all the wild beasts, because there was no shepherd, and because my shepherds did not seek my sheep, but the shepherds fed themselves, and did not feed my sheep:

verses.latin: Propterea, pastores, audite verbum Domini:
verses.english: “Therefore, you shepherds, hear the word of the Lord:

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Ecce ego ipse super pastores: et requiram oves meas de manu eorum, et cessare eos faciam, ut ultra non pascant oves: et non pascent ultra pastores semetipsos, et eripiam oves meas de ore eorum, et non erunt ultra eis in escam.
verses.english: “Thus says the Lord God: Behold, I am against the shepherds, and I will require my flock at their hand, and will make them cease from feeding the flock; and the shepherds will no longer feed themselves. I will deliver my flock from their mouths, and they shall no longer be food for them.

verses.latin: Quia hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Ecce ego ipse requiram oves meas, et visitabo eas.
verses.english: “For thus says the Lord God: Behold, I, even I, will seek my sheep and will visit them.

verses.latin: Sicut visitat pastor gregem suum in die, quando fuerit in medio ovium suarum dispersarum, sic visitabo oves meas, et liberabo eas de cunctis locis, in quibus dispersæ fuerant in die nubis et caliginis.
verses.english: “As a shepherd seeks out his flock on the day when he is among his sheep that have been scattered, so I will seek out my sheep and will rescue them from all places where they have been scattered on a day of clouds and thick darkness.

verses.latin: Et educam eas de populis, et congregabo eas de terris, et inducam eas in terram suam, et pascam eas in montibus Israël, in rivis, et in cunctis habitaculis terræ.
verses.english: “I will bring them out from the peoples and gather them from the countries, and will bring them into their own land; and I will feed them on the mountains of Israel, by the streams, and in all the inhabited places of the country.

verses.latin: In pascuis uberrimis pascam eas, et in montibus excelsis Israël erunt pascua eorum; ibi cubabunt in herbis virentibus, et in pascuis pinguibus pascentur super montes Israël.
verses.english: “I will feed them in a good pasture, and on the high mountains of Israel shall their pasture be; there they shall lie down in a good grazing ground, and on fat pasture they shall feed on the mountains of Israel.

verses.latin: Ego pascam oves meas, et ego eas accubare faciam, dicit Dominus Deus.
verses.english: “I myself will be the shepherd of my sheep, and I will make them lie down, says the Lord God.

verses.latin: Quod perierat, requiram: et quod abjectum fuerat, reducam: et quod confractum fuerat, alligabo: et quod infirmum fuerat, confortabo: et quod crassum et forte, custodiam: et pascam illas in judicio.
verses.english: “I will seek the lost, and I will bring back the strayed, and I will bind up the injured, and I will strengthen the weak, and the fat and the strong I will destroy. I will feed them in justice.

verses.latin: Et vos, oves meæ, ecce ego judicabo inter oves et oves, inter arietem et hircum.
verses.english: “As for you, my flock, thus says the Lord God: I will judge between sheep and sheep, between rams and male goats.

verses.latin: Numquid parum vobis est, quod pascua bona comeditis, et reliquias pascuarum vestrarum calcibus conculcatis? et cum aquam claram biberetis, reliquum pedibus vestris turbabatis?
verses.english: “Is it too small a thing for you to feed in the good pasture, that you must tread down with your feet the rest of your pasture? And to drink clear water, that you must foul the rest with your feet?

verses.latin: Et oves meas, reliquum pedibus vestris conculcatur, et quæ calcibus vestris conculcata sunt, pascuntur?
verses.english: “And must my sheep eat what your feet have trodden down, and drink what your feet have fouled?

verses.latin: Propterea hæc dicit Dominus Deus ad eas: Ecce ego judicabo inter pecus pingue et pecus macrum.
verses.english: “Therefore, thus says the Lord God to them: Behold, I will judge between the fat sheep and the lean sheep.

verses.latin: Pro eo quod lateri et humero impulistis, et cornu vestro ventilastis omnes ægrotas, donec ejiceretis eas foras:
verses.english: “Because you push with side and shoulder, and you thrust with your horns all the weak ones, until you have scattered them abroad,

verses.latin: salvabo gregem meum, et non erunt ultra in rapinam, et judicabo inter pecus et pecus.
verses.english: “I will save my flock, and they shall no longer be a prey; and I will judge between sheep and sheep.

verses.latin: Et suscitabo super eas pastorem unum, et pascet eas, servum meum David: ipse pascet eas, et ipse erit eis in pastorem.
verses.english: “And I will set up over them one shepherd, my servant David, and he will feed them. He will feed them and he will be their shepherd.

verses.latin: Ego autem Dominus ero eis in Deum, et servus meus David princeps in medio eorum: ego Dominus locutus sum.
verses.english: “And I, the Lord, will be their God, and my servant David will be prince among them. I the Lord have spoken.

verses.latin: Et percutiam cum eis pactum pacis, et cessare faciam bestias malas de terra: et habitabunt in solitudine securi, et dormient in saltibus.
verses.english: “I will make with them a covenant of peace, and will rid the land of evil beasts, so that they may dwell securely in the wilderness and sleep in the woods.

verses.latin: Et dabo illis benedictionem, et in circuitu collium meorum pluviam in tempore suo, et pluvia benedictionis erit.
verses.english: “And I will make them and the places around my hill a blessing. And I will send down the shower in its season, and there shall be showers of blessing.

verses.latin: Et portabit lignum agri, et dabit fructum suum, et terra dabit germen suum, et erunt in terra sua securi: et scient quia ego Dominus, cum contrivero funiculos jugi eorum, et eripuero eos de manu eorum qui serviebant eis.
verses.english: “And the tree of the field shall yield its fruit, and the land shall yield its increase, and they shall be secure in their land. Then they shall know that I am the Lord, when I break the bars of their yoke and rescue them from the hand of those who enslaved them.

verses.latin: Et non erunt ultra in rapinam gentibus, et bestiæ terræ non comedent eas: sed habitabunt in solitudine securi, et dormient in saltibus.
verses.english: “They shall no more be a prey to the nations, nor shall the beasts of the land devour them. They shall dwell securely, and none shall make them afraid.

verses.latin: Et suscitabo eis virgam nominis, et non erunt ultra consumpti in fame, nec portabunt ultra opprobrium gentium.
verses.english: “I will provide for them a planting of renown, and they shall no more be consumed with hunger in the land, and they shall no longer bear the disgrace of the nations.

verses.latin: Et scient quia ego Dominus Deus eorum cum eis, et ipsi populus meus, domus Israël, dicit Dominus Deus.
verses.english: “And they shall know that I the Lord their God am with them, and that they, the house of Israel, are my people, says the Lord God.

verses.latin: Vos autem oves meæ, oves pascuæ meæ, homines estis: et ego Dominus Deus vester, dicit Dominus Deus.
verses.english: “You are my sheep, the sheep of my pasture, and I am your God, says the Lord God.

verses.latin: Factum est verbum Domini ad me, dicens:
verses.english: The Lord spoke to me, saying:

verses.latin: Fili hominis, pone faciem tuam contra montem Seir, et prophetabis adversus eum,
verses.english: “Son of man, turn your face toward Mount Seir, and prophesy against it,

verses.latin: et dices ei: Haec dicit Dominus Deus: Ecce ego ad te, mons Seir, et extendam manum meam super te, et dabo te desertum, et solitudinem.
verses.english: and tell it: ‘Thus says the Lord God: Behold, I am against you, Mount Seir! I will extend my hand against you, and I will give you to be a desolation and a solitude.

verses.latin: Civitates tuas ponam solitudinem, et tu eris desertus: et scies quia ego sum Dominus.
verses.english: I will make your cities a desolation, and you will be desolate, and you will know that I am the Lord.’

verses.latin: Quia fuisti inimicus sempiternus, et conclusisti filios Israel in manus gladii in tempore calamitatis, in tempore iniquitatis extremo.
verses.english: “Because you have been an enemy forever and have handed over the children of Israel to the sword in the time of their calamity, in the time of their final iniquity,

verses.latin: ideo, vivo ego, dicit Dominus Deus, tradam te in sanguinem, et sanguis te persequetur: et quoniam odisti sanguinem, sanguis te persequetur.
verses.english: therefore, as I live, says the Lord God, I will hand you over to bloodshed, and bloodshed will pursue you, because you have hated bloodshed, bloodshed will pursue you.

verses.latin: Et dabo montem Seir in solitudinem, et desertum: et auferam de eo euntes et redeuntes.
verses.english: I will make Mount Seir a desolation and a desert, and I will take away from it those who come and go.

verses.latin: Et implebo montes ejus interfectis ejus: in collibus tuis et in vallibus tuis et in torrentibus tuis cadent vulnerati gladio.
verses.english: I will fill its mountains with the slain, those wounded by the sword; on your hills, in your valleys, and in your ravines they will fall.

verses.latin: In solitudinem sempiternam dabo te, et civitates tuae non habitabuntur: et scietis quia ego sum Dominus.
verses.english: I will make you a perpetual desolation, and your cities will not be inhabited, and you will know that I am the Lord.

verses.latin: Pro eo quod dixisti: Duae gentes istae, et duae terrae istae, meae sunt, et possidebimus eam, cum esset ibi Dominus:
verses.english: “Because you have said: ‘These two nations, and these two lands, are mine, and we will possess them,’ even though the Lord was there,

verses.latin: ideo, vivo ego, dicit Dominus Deus, faciam secundum iram tuam, et secundum zelum tuum, quem fecisti de odio tuo contra eos: et notus ero in eis, cum judicavero te.
verses.english: therefore, as I live, says the Lord God, I will deal with you according to your anger and according to your envy which you have shown from your hatred against them, and I will make myself known among them when I judge you.

verses.latin: Et scies quia ego Dominus audivi omnes contumelias tuas quas locutus es contra montes Israel, dicens: Desolatae sunt, datae sunt nobis ad devorandum.
verses.english: Then you will know that I, the Lord, have heard all your insults which you have spoken against the mountains of Israel, saying, ‘They are desolate, they have been given to us to devour.’

verses.latin: Et magnificati estis contra me in ore vestro, et multiplicastis sermones vestros contra me: ego audivi.
verses.english: You have magnified yourselves against me in your mouth, and you have multiplied your words against me; I have heard.

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus Deus: Cum laetata fuerit omnis terra, solitudinem ponam te.
verses.english: Thus says the Lord God: When all the earth rejoices, I will make you desolate.

verses.latin: Sicut laetatus es super hereditatem domus Israel, eo quod desolata est, sic faciam tibi: desolata eris, mons Seir, et omnis Idumaea, et scietis quia ego sum Dominus.
verses.english: As you rejoiced over the inheritance of the house of Israel, because it was desolate, so will I do to you; you will be desolate, Mount Seir, and all Idumea, and you will know that I am the Lord.”

verses.latin: Et factum est verbum Domini ad me, dicens:
verses.english: The word of the Lord came to me, saying:

verses.latin: Fili hominis, propheta super montes Israël, et dices: Montes Israël, audite verbum Domini.
verses.english: Son of man, prophesy against the mountains of Israel, and say: O mountains of Israel, hear the word of the Lord.

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Quia dixerunt inimici de vobis: Euge, euge! fractæ sunt arbores sempiternæ; hereditas gentium data est nobis.
verses.english: Thus says the Lord God: Because the enemy has said against you, “Aha, aha! The ancient high places are ours! The inheritance of the nations is given to us.”

verses.latin: Propterea propheta super terram Israël, et dices montibus, et collibus, et torrentibus, et vallibus: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Ecce ego loquor in zelo meo et in furore meo, eo quod opprobrium gentium portaveritis.
verses.english: Therefore prophesy over the land of Israel, and say to the mountains, and to the hills, to the streams, and to the valleys: Thus says the Lord God: Behold, I speak in my zeal and in my fury, because you have borne the reproach of the nations.

verses.latin: Idcirco hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Ego levavi manum meam, quia gentes quæ in circuitu vestro sunt, ipsæ portabunt opprobrium vestrum.
verses.english: Therefore, thus says the Lord God: I have lifted up my hand, because the nations that are around you will bear your reproach.

verses.latin: Vos autem, montes Israël, ramos vestros emittetis, et fructum vestrum afferetis populo meo Israël: prope est enim ut veniat.
verses.english: But you, mountains of Israel, you will shoot forth your branches, and yield your fruit to my people Israel; for they will soon be back.

verses.latin: Quia ecce ego vobiscum, et convertar ad vos: et coleris, et seminabimini in terra Israël.
verses.english: For behold, I am with you, and I will turn to you: and you will be cultivated and sown in the land of Israel.

verses.latin: Et multiplicabo in vobis homines, et omnem domum Israël, et civitates habitabuntur, et ruinæ ædificabuntur.
verses.english: And I will multiply men upon you, all the house of Israel, and the cities will be inhabited, and the ruins will be rebuilt.

verses.latin: Et multiplicabo in vobis homines et jumenta: et multiplicabuntur, et crescent: et habitare vos faciam sicut in diebus antiquis, et melius quam in principio: et scietis quia ego Dominus.
verses.english: And I will multiply men upon you and beasts: and they will increase and grow: and I will cause you to dwell as in the days of old, and better than at the beginning: and you will know that I am the Lord.

verses.latin: Et adducam super vos homines, populum Israël: et possidebunt te, et eris eis in hæreditatem: et non addes ultra ut eos steriles facias.
verses.english: And I will bring upon you men, my people Israel: and they will possess you, and you will be an inheritance for them: and you will not again make them barren.

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Quia dicunt de vobis: Devoratrix hominum tu es, et gentem gentium perdidisti.
verses.english: Thus says the Lord God: Because they say of you, 'You are a devourer of men, and have been the cause of the loss of your nation.'

verses.latin: Propterea non addes ut homines devores, et gentem gentium amittas, dicit Dominus Deus.
verses.english: Therefore you will no longer devour men, nor will you cause your nation to perish, says the Lord God.

verses.latin: Et non audies ultra opprobrium gentium, et non portabis contumelias populorum tuorum amplius: et gentem gentium non amittes ultra, dicit Dominus Deus.
verses.english: And you will no longer hear the reproach of the nations, nor will you bear the insults of your people any longer: and you will not cause the nations to lose their people any longer, says the Lord God.

verses.latin: Verbum Domini factum est ad me, dicens:
verses.english: The word of the Lord came to me, saying:

verses.latin: Fili hominis, domus Israël habitabat in terra sua, et contaminavit eam in via sua et in studiis suis: juxta immunditiam menstruatæ facta est via eorum coram me.
verses.english: Son of man, the house of Israel dwelt in their own land, and defiled it in their way and in their studies: according to the impurity of the menstruating woman their way was before me.

verses.latin: Et effudi indignationem meam super eos, propter sanguinem quem effuderant super terram, et quibus contaminantes eam in idolis suis.
verses.english: And I poured out my indignation upon them, because of the blood they had shed upon the land, and because they had defiled it with their idols.

verses.latin: Et dispersi eos in gentibus, et ventilati sunt in regionibus: juxta viam eorum et studiorum eorum judicavi eos.
verses.english: And I scattered them among the nations, and they were scattered over the regions: according to their way and their studies I judged them.

verses.latin: Et ingressi sunt ad gentes, ad quas venerant, et profanaverunt nomen sanctum meum, cum dicerent de eis: Populus Domini est iste, et de terra ejus egressi sunt.
verses.english: And they went to the nations to which they had come, and profaned my holy name, when they said of them: 'This is the people of the Lord, and they have come out of his land.'

verses.latin: Et peperci nomini sancto meo, quod profanaverunt domus Israël in gentibus ad quas ingressi sunt.
verses.english: And I spared my holy name, which the house of Israel had profaned among the nations to which they had come.

verses.latin: Propterea dic ad domum Israël: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Non propter vos facio, domus Israël, sed propter nomen sanctum meum, quod profanastis in gentibus, ad quas ingressi estis.
verses.english: Therefore say to the house of Israel: Thus says the Lord God: I do not do this for your sake, O house of Israel, but for my holy name, which you have profaned among the nations to which you have come.

verses.latin: Et sanctificabo nomen magnum meum, quod profanatum est in gentibus, quod profanastis in medio eorum: ut sciant gentes quia ego Dominus, dicit Dominus Deus, cum sanctificatus fuero in vobis coram oculis eorum.
verses.english: And I will sanctify my great name, which has been profaned among the nations, which you have profaned in the midst of them: that the nations may know that I am the Lord, says the Lord God, when I am sanctified in you before their eyes.

verses.latin: Et auferam vos de gentibus, et congregabo vos de universis terris, et adducam vos in terram vestram.
verses.english: And I will take you from among the nations, and I will gather you from all the lands, and I will bring you into your own land.

verses.latin: Et effundam super vos aquam mundam, et mundabimini ab universis inquinamentis vestris, et ab universis idolis vestris emundabo vos.
verses.english: And I will pour clean water upon you, and you will be cleansed from all your impurities, and I will cleanse you from all your idols.

verses.latin: Et dabo vobis cor novum, et spiritum novum ponam in medio vestri: et auferam cor lapideum de carne vestra, et dabo vobis cor carneum.
verses.english: And I will give you a new heart, and I will put a new spirit in your midst: and I will take away the stony heart from your flesh, and I will give you a heart of flesh.

verses.latin: Et ponam spiritum meum in medio vestri: et faciam quod in præceptis meis ambuletis, et judicia mea custodiatis, et operemini.
verses.english: And I will put my spirit in your midst: and I will cause you to walk in my precepts, and to keep my judgments, and to perform them.

verses.latin: Et habitabitis in terra quam dedi patribus vestris: et eritis mihi in populum, et ego vobis ero in Deum.
verses.english: And you will dwell in the land that I gave to your fathers: and you will be my people, and I will be your God.

verses.latin: Et salvabo vos de universis inquinamentis vestris: et vocabo frumentum, et multiplicabo illud, et non adducam super vos famem.
verses.english: And I will save you from all your impurities: and I will call for the grain, and I will multiply it, and I will not bring famine upon you.

verses.latin: Et multiplicabo fructum ligni, et incrementum agri, et non portabitis ultra opprobrium gentium propter famem.
verses.english: And I will multiply the fruit of the tree, and the increase of the field, and you will no longer bear the reproach of the nations because of famine.

verses.latin: Et recordabimini viarum vestrarum malarum, et studiorum non bonorum: et displicebunt vobis iniquitates vestræ, et scelera vestra.
verses.english: And you will remember your evil ways, and your studies that were not good: and your iniquities and your crimes will displease you.

verses.latin: Non propter vos facio, dicit Dominus Deus, notum sit vobis: confundamini et erubescite super viis vestris, domus Israël.
verses.english: I do not do this for your sake, says the Lord God, let it be known to you: be ashamed and blush for your ways, O house of Israel.

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus: In die qua emundabo vos ex omnibus iniquitatibus vestris, et habitare fecero civitates, et ædificavero diruta:
verses.english: Thus says the Lord God: In the day that I cleanse you from all your iniquities, and make the cities to be inhabited, and rebuild the ruins,

verses.latin: et terra desolata colitur, quæ erat desolata ante oculos omnis transeuntis:
verses.english: and the desolate land will be cultivated, that was desolate before the eyes of everyone who passed by:

verses.latin: et dicent: Terra illa desolata facta est sicut hortus voluptatis, et civitates desertæ, et destitutæ, et dirutæ, munita sunt.
verses.english: and they will say: That land that was desolate has become like the garden of paradise, and the cities that were deserted, and desolate, and destroyed, are fortified.

verses.latin: Et scient gentes quæ reliquæ fuerint in circuitu vestro, quia ego Dominus ædificavi diruta, et plantavi ea quæ desolata fuerant: ego Dominus locutus sum et feci.
verses.english: And the nations that are left around you will know that I the Lord have built the ruins, and I have planted what was desolate: I the Lord have spoken and done it.

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Adhuc in hoc requiram me a domo Israël, ut faciam eis: multiplicabo eos sicut gregem hominum.
verses.english: Thus says the Lord God: I will still be inquired of by the house of Israel, that I may do this for them: I will multiply them like a flock of men.

verses.latin: Sicut oves sanctas, sicut oves Hierusalem in solemnitatibus ejus, ita erunt urbes desolatæ pleræque, et habitabuntur: et scient quia ego Dominus.
verses.english: As the holy sheep, as the sheep of Jerusalem in her solemn feasts, so will the desolate cities be, and they will be inhabited: and they will know that I am the Lord.

verses.latin: Facta est super me manus Domini, et eduxit me in spiritu Domini, et dimisit me in medio campi, qui erat plenus ossibus.
verses.english: The hand of the Lord came over me, and He took me in the Spirit of the Lord and set me in the middle of a plain, which was full of bones.

verses.latin: Et circumduxit me per ea in gyro: erant autem multa nimis super faciem campi, et sicca valde.
verses.english: And He led me all around among them. The bones were scattered everywhere on the surface of the plain, and they were very dry.

verses.latin: Et dixit ad me: Fili hominis, putasne vivent ossa ista?
verses.english: And He said to me, “Son of man, do you think these bones can live again?”

verses.latin: Et dixi: Domine Deus, tu scis.
verses.english: I said: “Lord God, only You know.”

verses.latin: Et dixit ad me: Prophetiza super ossa ista, et dices ad ea: Ossa arida, audite verbum Domini.
verses.english: And He said to me: “Prophesy to these bones, and tell them: ‘Dry bones, hear the word of the Lord.’

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus ossibus istis: Ecce ego introducam in vos spiritum, et vivetis.
verses.english: “‘This is what the Lord God says to these bones: “Behold, I will send the breath of life into you, and you will live again.

verses.latin: Et dabo super vos nervos, et succrescere faciam super vos carnes, et superextendam in vobis cutem, et dabo vobis spiritum, et vivetis: et scietis quod ego Dominus.
verses.english: “‘I will put sinews on you, and cause flesh to grow over you, and I will put skin on you, and I will give you My Spirit, and you will live again, and you will know that I am the Lord.”'

verses.latin: Prophetavi igitur, sicut præceperat mihi: et factus est sonitus, et ecce commotio: et congregata sunt ossa ad ossa.
verses.english: I prophesied as He commanded me, and suddenly, there was a noise and a shaking, and the bones came together, bone to bone.

verses.latin: Et vidi, et ecce venerunt super ea nervi, et succreverunt carnes, et distensa est cutis super eis de sursum: sed spiritus non erat in eis.
verses.english: I saw that the sinews and flesh came upon them, and skin covered them, but there was no life in them.

verses.latin: Et dixit ad me: Prophetiza ad spiritum, prophetiza, fili hominis, et dic ad spiritum: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Veniat spiritus de quatuor ventis, et insuffla super interfectos istos, et vivent.
verses.english: Then He said to me: “Prophesy to the Spirit, prophesy, son of man, and say to the Spirit: ‘This is what the Lord God says: ‘Come from the four winds, O breath, and breathe upon these slain, that they may live.’

verses.latin: Et prophetavi sicut præceperat mihi: et ingressus est in eos spiritus, et vixerunt: steteruntque super pedes suos, exercitus grandis nimis.
verses.english: So I prophesied as He commanded me, and the breath of life came into them, and they lived and stood on their feet—a very, very great army.

verses.latin: Et dixit ad me: Fili hominis, ossa hæc universa domus Israël est. Ecce ipsi dicunt: Aruerunt ossa nostra, et periit spes nostra, et excisi sumus.
verses.english: And He said to me: “Son of man, these bones are the whole house of Israel. Behold, they say: ‘Our bones are dry, and our hope is lost, and we are cut off.’

verses.latin: Propterea vaticinare, et dices ad eos: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Ecce ego aperiam sepulcra vestra, et educam vos de sepulcris vestris, populus meus, et inducam vos in terram Israël.
verses.english: Therefore prophesy, and say to them: ‘This is what the Lord God says: ‘Behold, I will open your graves, and I will bring you up out of your graves, O My people; and I will bring you into the land of Israel.’

verses.latin: Et scietis quia ego Dominus, cum aperuero sepulcra vestra, et eduxero vos de tumulis vestris, populus meus.
verses.english: “‘Then you will know that I am the Lord, when I open your graves and bring you up out of your graves, O My people.

verses.latin: Et dabo spiritum meum in vobis, et vivetis: et ponam vos super terram vestram: et scietis quia ego Dominus locutus sum et feci, dicit Dominus Deus.
verses.english: “‘I will put My Spirit in you, and you will live, and I will place you in your own land; and you will know that I, the Lord, have spoken and have done it,’ says the Lord God.”

verses.latin: Et factum est verbum Domini ad me, dicens:
verses.english: The word of the Lord came to me, saying:

verses.latin: Tu autem, fili hominis, sume tibi lignum unum, et scribe super illud: Judæ et filiis Israël sociis ejus. Et sume lignum alterum, et scribe super illud: Joseph, lignum Ephraim, et universæ domui Israël sociorum ejus.
verses.english: “Son of man, take one piece of wood and write on it, ‘For Judah and for the children of Israel associated with him.’ Then take another piece of wood and write on it, ‘For Joseph, the wood of Ephraim, and for all the house of Israel associated with him.’

verses.latin: Et conjunge ea sibi in unum lignum, ut fiant in manu tua unum.
verses.english: Then join them together into one piece of wood, so that they become one in your hand.

verses.latin: Cum autem dixerint ad te filii populi tui, dicentes: Numquid non indicabis nobis quid significare velint ista?
verses.english: “And when the children of your people speak to you, saying, ‘Will you not tell us what these things mean?’”

verses.latin: Loquere ad eos: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Ecce ego sumam lignum Joseph, quod est in manu Ephraim, et tribus Israël, et dabo ea cum eo ligno Judæ, et faciam ea in lignum unum, et erunt in manu ejus.
verses.english: say to them, ‘This is what the Lord God says: “Behold, I will take the wood of Joseph, which is in the hand of Ephraim, and the tribes of Israel associated with him, and I will give them to the wood of Judah, and I will make them one wood, and they will be one in My hand.”

verses.latin: Et erunt in manu ejus coram oculis eorum ligna, super quibus scripseris.
verses.english: “‘The woods on which you have written will be in their hand before their eyes.

verses.latin: Et dic ad eos: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Ecce ego assumam filios Israël de medio nationum ad quas abierunt, et congregabo eos undique, et adducam eos in terram suam.
verses.english: “‘And say to them, ‘This is what the Lord God says: “Behold, I will take the children of Israel from among the nations where they have gone, and I will gather them from every side, and bring them into their own land.

verses.latin: Et faciam eos gentem unam in terra, in montibus Israël: et rex unus erit omnibus imperans: et non erunt ultra duæ gentes, nec dividentur ultra in duo regna.
verses.english: “‘I will make them one nation in the land, on the mountains of Israel; and one king will be ruler over all of them; and they will no longer be two nations, nor will they ever again be divided into two kingdoms.

verses.latin: Nec contaminabuntur ultra in idolis suis, et in abominationibus suis, et in cunctis iniquitatibus suis: et salvabo eos de universis habitaculis peccatorum, in quibus peccaverunt, et mundabo eos: et erunt mihi in populum, et ego ero eis in Deum.
verses.english: “‘They will no longer defile themselves with their idols, or with their abominations, or with any of their transgressions; but I will save them from all their dwelling places in which they have sinned, and will cleanse them. And they will be My people, and I will be their God.

verses.latin: Et servus meus David rex super eos: et pastor unus erit omnibus: et in judiciis meis ambulabunt, et præcepta mea custodient et facient ea.
verses.english: “‘My servant David will be king over them, and they will all have one shepherd; and they will walk in My judgments and keep My commandments and do them.

verses.latin: Et habitabunt in terra quam dedi servo meo Jacob, in qua habitaverunt patres vestri: et habitabunt in ea ipsi et filii eorum, et filii filiorum eorum usque in sempiternum: et David servus meus princeps eorum in æternum.
verses.english: “‘They will live in the land that I gave to My servant Jacob, in which your fathers lived; and they will live in it, they and their sons and their grandsons, forever; and My servant David will be their prince forever.

verses.latin: Et faciam cum eis pactum pacis, pactum sempiternum erit eis: et plantabo eos, et multiplicabo eos, et dabo sanctuarium meum in medio eorum in sempiternum.
verses.english: “‘I will make a covenant of peace with them; it will be an everlasting covenant with them; and I will plant them and multiply them, and I will set My sanctuary in their midst forever.

verses.latin: Et erit tabernaculum meum in eis: et ero eis in Deum, et ipsi erunt mihi in populum.
verses.english: “‘My dwelling place also will be with them; and I will be their God, and they will be My people.

verses.latin: Et scient gentes quia ego Dominus, qui sanctifico Israël, cum fuerit sanctum meum in medio eorum in sempiternum.
verses.english: “‘And the nations will know that I am the Lord who sanctifies Israel, when My sanctuary is in their midst forever.’”

verses.latin: Et factum est verbum Domini ad me, dicens:
verses.english: The Lord spoke to me, saying:

verses.latin: Fili hominis, pone faciem tuam contra Gog in terra Magog, principem capitis Mosoch et Thubal, et vaticinare de eo,
verses.english: “Son of man, turn your face toward Gog in the land of Magog, the leader of the tribes of Meshech and Tubal, and prophesy against him,

verses.latin: et dices: Haec dicit Dominus Deus: Ecce ego ad te, Gog, principem capitis Mosoch et Thubal.
verses.english: and say: ‘Thus says the Lord God: Behold, I am against you, Gog, leader of the tribes of Meshech and Tubal.

verses.latin: Et convertam te, et ponam circulos in maxillis tuis: et educam te, et omnem exercitum tuum, equos et equites, omnes vestitos perfecte, coetum magnum scutorum et clipeorum, gladium portantium.
verses.english: I will turn you around and put hooks in your jaws, and I will bring you out with all your army, horses and horsemen, all of them fully armed, a great company with shields and bucklers, all of them bearing swords.

verses.latin: Persas, AEthiopes, et Libyes cum eis, omnes scutum et galeam habentes.
verses.english: Persia, Cush, and Put with them, all of them with shields and helmets.

verses.latin: Gomer, et omnes turmas ejus, domum Thogorma, latera aquilonis, et omnem fortitudinem ejus, populos multos tecum.
verses.english: Gomer and all his troops; Beth-Togarmah from the far north and all its troops—many peoples are with you.

verses.latin: Para, et instrue te, tu et omnis coetus tuus, qui congregati sunt ad te: et eris eis in custodiam.
verses.english: Be prepared and prepare yourself, you and all your hosts that are gathered about you, and be a guard for them.

verses.latin: Post multos dies visitaberis: in novissimo annorum venies ad terram, quae reducta est de gladio, congregata ex multis populis, in montibus Israel, quae fuerunt in solitudine semper: ista de populis educta est, et habitabunt in ea omnes.
verses.english: After many days, you shall be visited. In the latter years, you will come into the land that has been restored from the sword, gathered from many peoples, upon the mountains of Israel, which have been a perpetual waste. This people has been brought out of the peoples, and they will dwell in it all.

verses.latin: Et ascendes, et venies quasi tempestas, et quasi nubes, ut operias terram, tu et omnes turmae tuae, et populi multi tecum.
verses.english: And you shall ascend, and come like a storm, and like a cloud, to cover the land, you and all your troops, and many peoples with you.

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus Deus: Erit in die illa, ascendent cogitationes super cor tuum, et cogitabis malum consilium,
verses.english: Thus says the Lord God: On that day, thoughts will arise in your heart, and you will devise an evil plan.

verses.latin: et dices: Ascendam ad terram absque muro, ibo ad quiescentes, qui habitant confidenter, et in ea omnes habitant sine muro, et vectes et portae non sunt eis.
verses.english: And you will say: ‘I will go up to the land without walls; I will go to those who are at rest, who dwell securely, all of them dwelling without walls, and who have no bars or gates.

verses.latin: Ut diripias spolia, et vastes praedam, ut mittas manum tuam super eos, qui de vastitate congregati sunt, et de populis congregatis, qui possederunt pecora et substantias, et habitant in umbilico terrae.
verses.english: To take spoils and seize plunder, to lay your hand on those who have been gathered from the nations, who have acquired livestock and goods, who dwell at the center of the earth.’

verses.latin: Saba et Dedan, et negotiatores Tharsis, et omnes leones ejus, dicent tibi: Num ad diripiendum tu venisti? ad vastandam praedam congregasti coetum tuum? ut tollas argentum et aurum, et auferas pecora et substantias, et diripias praedam magnam?
verses.english: Sheba and Dedan and the merchants of Tarshish and all its young lions will say to you, ‘Have you come to seize spoils? Have you assembled your company to take plunder, to carry away silver and gold, to take away livestock and goods, and to seize great spoils?’

verses.latin: Propterea vaticinare, fili hominis, et dices ad Gog: Haec dicit Dominus Deus: Numquid in die illa, cum habitaverint populus meus Israel confidenter, scies?
verses.english: Therefore, prophesy, son of man, and say to Gog: ‘Thus says the Lord God: On that day when My people Israel dwells securely, will you not know it?

verses.latin: Et venies de loco tuo, de lateribus aquilonis, tu et populi multi tecum, equites omnes, coetus magnus, et exercitus vehemens.
verses.english: And you will come from your place out of the far north, you and many peoples with you, all of them mounted on horses, a great company and a mighty army.

verses.latin: Et ascendes super populum meum Israel, quasi nubes, ut operias terram: in novissimo dierum, eris, et adducam te super terram meam, quando sanctificatus fuero in te, o Gog, coram oculis gentium.
verses.english: You will come up against My people Israel, like a cloud to cover the land. In the last days, it will be, and I will bring you against My land, when I am hallowed in you, O Gog, before the eyes of the nations.

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus Deus: Tu es ille de quo locutus sum in diebus antiquis in manu servorum meorum prophetarum Israel, qui prophetaverunt in diebus illis, quod adducerem te super eos.
verses.english: Thus says the Lord God: Are you he of whom I spoke in the days of old by the hand of My servants the prophets of Israel, who prophesied in those days that I would bring you against them?

verses.latin: Et erit in die illa, in diebus Gog, cum venerit super terram Israel, ait Dominus Deus, ascendet indignatio mea in furore meo.
verses.english: And it will be on that day, in the days when Gog comes against the land of Israel, says the Lord God, My wrath will arise in My fury.

verses.latin: Et in zelo meo, et in igne furoris mei, locutus sum: Quia in die illa erit commotio magna super terram Israel.
verses.english: For in My jealousy and in the fire of My wrath, I have spoken: Surely in that day there will be a great shaking in the land of Israel.

verses.latin: Et commovebuntur a facie mea pisces maris, et volucres caeli, et bestiae agri, et omne reptile, quod movetur super humum, et universi homines, qui sunt super faciem terrae: et evertentur montes, et cadent rupes, et omnis murus in terram corruet.
verses.english: The fish of the sea, the birds of the heavens, the beasts of the field, all the creeping things that creep on the ground, and all the people who are on the face of the earth will tremble at My presence. The mountains will be thrown down, and the cliffs will fall, and every wall will fall to the ground.

verses.latin: Et vocabo adversum eum in cunctis montibus meis gladium, ait Dominus Deus: gladius uniuscujusque contra fratrem suum dirigetur.
verses.english: And I will call for a sword against him throughout all My mountains, says the Lord God. Every man’s sword will be against his brother.

verses.latin: Et iudicabo eum peste et sanguine, et imbre grandinis, et lapidum ignis, et sulphuris pluet super eum, et super turmas ejus, et super populos multos, qui sunt cum eo.
verses.english: And I will enter into judgment with him by pestilence and by blood; and I will rain on him and his troops and on the many peoples who are with him, a torrential rain, hailstones, fire, and brimstone.

verses.latin: Et magnificabor, et sanctificabor, et notus ero in oculis multarum gentium: et scient quia ego Dominus.
verses.english: I will magnify Myself and sanctify Myself, and I will make Myself known in the eyes of many nations. And they will know that I am the Lord.

verses.latin: Et tu, fili hominis, vaticinare contra Gog, et dices: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Ecce ego ad te, Gog, principem capitis Mosoch et Thobel.
verses.english: And you, son of man, prophesy against Gog, and you will say: “Thus says the Lord God: ‘Behold, I am coming against you, Gog, the prince of Rosh, Meshech, and Tubal.’

verses.latin: Et convertam te, et deducam te, et adducam te de lateribus aquilonis, et adducam te super montes Israël.
verses.english: And I will turn you around, and I will drive you, and I will bring you from the sides of the north, and I will bring you onto the mountains of Israel.

verses.latin: Et percutiam arcum tuum in manu sinistra tua, et contundam sagittas tuas in manu dextera tua.
verses.english: And I will strike your bow in your left hand, and I will break your arrows in your right hand.

verses.latin: Super montes Israël cades tu, et omnes catervæ tuæ, et populi qui tecum sunt: dabo te in aves rapaces omnis generis, et bestiis agri, ad devorandum.
verses.english: On the mountains of Israel you will fall, and all your hosts, and the peoples who are with you: I will give you to the birds of prey of every kind, and to the beasts of the field, to be devoured.

verses.latin: In facie agri cades: quia ego locutus sum, dicit Dominus Deus.
verses.english: You will fall on the face of the field: because I have spoken, says the Lord God.

verses.latin: Et mittam ignem in Magog, et in eos qui habitant in insulis, et scient quia ego Dominus.
verses.english: And I will send fire on Magog, and on those who dwell in the isles, and they will know that I am the Lord.

verses.latin: Et nomen sanctum meum notum faciam in medio populi mei Israël, et non polluam ultra nomen sanctum meum: et scient gentes quia ego Dominus, Sanctus in Israël.
verses.english: And I will make known my holy name in the midst of my people Israel, and I will not pollute my holy name any further: and the nations will know that I am the Lord, the Holy One in Israel.

verses.latin: Ecce venit, et factum est, dicit Dominus Deus: hæc est dies de qua locutus sum.
verses.english: Behold, it is coming, and it is done, says the Lord God: this is the day about which I have spoken.

verses.latin: Et egredientur habitatores de urbibus Israël, et comburent et succendent arma, et clypeos, et hastas, arcus et sagittas, et baculos, et omnem supellectilem: et succendent ea igni septem annis.
verses.english: And the inhabitants will go out from the cities of Israel, and they will burn and set on fire the weapons, and the shields, and the spears, the bows and arrows, and the clubs, and all the equipment: and they will burn them with fire for seven years.

verses.latin: Et non portabunt ligna de regione, neque succident de silvis: quia armis succendent ignem, et diripient virentes, qui diripuerunt eos, et spolient spoliantes ipsos, dicit Dominus Deus.
verses.english: And they will not carry wood from the region, nor will they cut from the forests: because with the weapons they will set fire, and they will plunder those who plundered them, and they will despoil those who despoiled them, says the Lord God.

verses.latin: Et erit in die illa, dabo Gog locum nominatum sepulcrum in Israël, vallem Viatorum ad orientem maris, et percutiet eam, et obstruet viam prætereuntium: et sepelient ibi Gog, et omnem multitudinem ejus, et vocabitur vallis multitudo Gog.
verses.english: And it will be in that day, I will give Gog a place named a sepulcher in Israel, the valley of those traveling east of the sea, and it will strike it, and it will obstruct the way of those passing through: and they will bury there Gog, and all his multitude, and it will be called the valley of the multitude of Gog.

verses.latin: Et sepelient eos domus Israël, ut purgent terram, septem mensibus.
verses.english: And the house of Israel will bury them, to cleanse the land, for seven months.

verses.latin: Et sepeliet omnis populus terræ, et erit eis nomen: die qua glorificatus fuero, dicit Dominus Deus.
verses.english: And all the people of the land will bury, and it will be to them a name: in the day when I will be glorified, says the Lord God.

verses.latin: Et separabunt viros qui non cessant pertransire terram, et sepelient eos qui remanserunt, ut purgent eam: post mensibus septem.
verses.english: And they will separate men who do not cease to pass through the land, and they will bury those who remain, to cleanse it: after seven months.

verses.latin: Et pertransibunt qui transeunt per terram, et cum viderint os hominis, ædificabunt juxta illud titulum, usque dum purificent terram.
verses.english: And those who pass through the land will pass through, and when they see a bone of a man, they will build a sign near it, until they cleanse the land.

verses.latin: Et tu, fili hominis, hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Dic avibus et universis volucribus, et cunctis bestiis agri: Congregamini, et venite, concurrite undique ad victimam meam, quam ego immolo vobis victimam magnam super montes Israël, ut comedatis carnes, et bibatis sanguinem.
verses.english: And you, son of man, thus says the Lord God: Say to the birds and all the birds, and all the beasts of the field: Gather together, and come, assemble from all sides to my sacrifice, which I am sacrificing for you a great sacrifice on the mountains of Israel, that you may eat the flesh, and drink the blood.

verses.latin: Carnes fortium comedetis, et sanguinem principum terræ bibetis: arietes, agnos, et hædos, et tauros, universos saginatos Basan.
verses.english: You will eat the flesh of the strong, and you will drink the blood of the princes of the earth: rams, lambs, and goats, and bulls, all the fat ones of Bashan.

verses.latin: Et comedetis adipem usque ad satietatem, et bibetis sanguinem usque ad ebrietatem de victima mea quam immolo vobis.
verses.english: And you will eat fatness until you are satisfied, and you will drink blood until you are drunk from my sacrifice which I sacrifice for you.

verses.latin: Et saturabimini mensa mea, equo et curru, et forti, et universis viris bellatoribus, dicit Dominus Deus.
verses.english: And you will be filled at my table, horse and chariot, and the strong, and all the men of war, says the Lord God.

verses.latin: Et dabo gloriam meam in gentibus, et videbunt omnes gentes judicium meum quod fecerim, et manum meam quam posuerim in eis.
verses.english: And I will give my glory among the nations, and all the nations will see my judgment which I have made, and my hand which I have put upon them.

verses.latin: Et scient domus Israël quia ego Dominus Deus eorum, ex die illa et deinceps.
verses.english: And the house of Israel will know that I am the Lord their God, from that day and onwards.

verses.latin: Et scient gentes quia in iniquitate sua ductus est domus Israël, eo quod dereliquerunt me, et absconderam faciem meam ab eis, et tradidi eos in manu hostium, et ceciderunt gladio omnes.
verses.english: And the nations will know that in their iniquity the house of Israel was led, because they forsook me, and I hid my face from them, and I delivered them into the hand of their enemies, and they all fell by the sword.

verses.latin: Juxta immunditias eorum, et iniquitates eorum feci eis, et abscondi faciem meam ab eis.
verses.english: According to their impurities, and their iniquities I have done to them, and I hid my face from them.

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Nunc reducam captivitatem Jacob, et miserebor omnis domus Israël, et zelabor pro nomine sancto meo.
verses.english: Thus says the Lord God: Now I will bring back the captivity of Jacob, and I will have mercy on all the house of Israel, and I will be zealous for my holy name.

verses.latin: Et portabunt confusionem suam, et omnem prævaricationem qua prævaricati sunt in me, quando habitaverint in terra sua secure, nullusque erit qui exterreat eos.
verses.english: And they will bear their shame, and all the transgression with which they transgressed against me, when they will dwell securely in their land, and there will be no one to frighten them.

verses.latin: Cum reduxero eos de populis, et congregavero eos de terris inimicorum eorum, et sanctificatus fuero in eis in oculis gentium.
verses.english: When I will bring them back from the peoples, and I will gather them from the lands of their enemies, and I will be sanctified in them in the sight of the nations.

verses.latin: Et scient quia ego Dominus Deus eorum, qui eduxero eos in captivitatem inter gentes: et non reliqui ex eis quemquam in terra sua.
verses.english: And they will know that I am the Lord their God, who led them into captivity among the nations: and I have not left anyone of them in their land.

verses.latin: Et non abscondam ultra faciem meam ab eis, quia effudi spiritum meum super domum Israël, dicit Dominus Deus.
verses.english: And I will no longer hide my face from them, because I have poured out my spirit on the house of Israel, says the Lord God.

verses.latin: Anno vicesimo quinto transmigrationis nostrae, in principio anni, decima mensis, quarto decimo anno, postquam percussa est civitas, in ipsa die illa, facta est mihi manus Domini, et adduxit me illuc.
