verses.english: In the twenty-fifth year of our exile, at the beginning of the year, on the tenth day of the month, in the fourteenth year after the city had been struck down, on that very day, the hand of the Lord came upon me and brought me there.

verses.latin: In visionibus Dei adduxit me in terram Israel, et posuit me super montem altissimum: super quo quasi structura civitatis ad meridiem.
verses.english: In visions of God, He brought me to the land of Israel, and set me on a very high mountain; on it was the structure of a city, to the south.

verses.latin: Et adduxit me illuc: et ecce vir, cujus aspectus quasi aspectus aeris, et in manu ejus linea linteae, et calamus mensorius: stabat autem in porta.
verses.english: He brought me there, and behold, a man whose appearance was like the appearance of bronze, with a linen cord and a measuring reed in his hand. He stood at the gate.

verses.latin: Et locutus est ad me vir: Fili hominis, vide oculis tuis, et auribus tuis audi, et pone cor tuum in omnia quae ego ostendo tibi: quia propter hoc adductus es huc, ut ostendam tibi omnia quae videris: annuncia domui Israel.
verses.english: And the man spoke to me: “Son of man, look with your eyes, and hear with your ears, and pay attention to all that I show you, for you have been brought here so that I may show you everything that you see. Announce it to the house of Israel.

verses.latin: Et ecce murus forinsecus in circuitu domus, et in manu viri mensura calami, sex cubitorum et palmi: et mensus est latitudinem structurae calamo uno, et altitudinem unum calamo.
verses.english: And behold, the outer wall was around the house, and in the man's hand was a measuring reed, six cubits long, by the cubit and a handbreadth. He measured the width of the structure, one reed, and the height, one reed.

verses.latin: Et venit ad portam quae respiciebat viam orientis, et ascendit per gradus ejus: et mensus est limen portae unius calami in latitudine, et limen alterius calami in latitudine.
verses.english: Then he came to the gate which faced east, and went up its steps. He measured the threshold of the gate, one reed wide, and the threshold of the other, one reed wide.

verses.latin: Et cameram unam calami in longitudine, et unam calami in latitudine: et inter cameram et cameram quinque cubitorum: et limen portae juxta frontem vestibuli portae intrinsecus.
verses.english: He measured one chamber, one reed long, and one reed wide. Between the chambers was a space of five cubits, and the threshold of the gate by the front of the vestibule of the gate inside.

verses.latin: Et mensus est vestibuli portae intrinsecus, unum calami.
verses.english: He measured the vestibule of the gate inside, one reed.

verses.latin: Et mensus est vestibulum portae, octo cubitorum, et frontes ejus duae cubitorum: et columnae ejus, duae cubitorum.
verses.english: He measured the vestibule of the gate, eight cubits; and its jambs were two cubits, and its pillars, two cubits.

verses.latin: Et in cameris portae orientalis, tres hinc, et tres inde: una mensura trium, et una mensura trium: et columnae unius mensurae hinc et inde.
verses.english: In the chambers of the east gate, there were three on one side and three on the other, the same measure for the three, and the same measure for the three. The pillars of one measure on this side and on that side.

verses.latin: Et mensus est latitudinem ostii portae, decem cubitorum: et longitudinem portae, tredecim cubitorum.
verses.english: He measured the width of the doorway of the gate, ten cubits; and the length of the gate, thirteen cubits.

verses.latin: Et cancellos ante cameram unam cubiti: et cameram unam cubiti: et limen unum cubiti juxta interiora: et mensus est cubitum unum, et cubitum unum.
verses.english: And there was a barrier before each chamber, one cubit; and a chamber, one cubit; and a threshold, one cubit, next to the interior. He measured one cubit, and one cubit.

verses.latin: Et mensus est portam a tecto camerarum, cubitorum viginti: et erant propter cameram tres, et propter cameram tres.
verses.english: He measured the gate from the roof of the chambers, twenty cubits; and there were three on each side of the chamber.

verses.latin: Et mensus est columnas, sexaginta cubitorum: et juxta columnas atrium, per circuitum portae.
verses.english: Then he measured the pillars, sixty cubits; and beside the pillars was the court, all around the gate.

verses.latin: Et a facie portae, introitus usque ad faciem vestibuli portae interioris, sexaginta cubitorum.
verses.english: From the front of the gate to the front of the vestibule of the inner gate was sixty cubits.

verses.latin: Et erant fenestrae in cameris ejus, et in columnis earum intrinsecus per circuitum, et similiter in vestibulis fenestrae per circuitum intrinsecus: et in columnis palmulae, et mensura, sex cubitorum.
verses.english: And there were windows in its chambers, and in its pillars inside all around, and similarly in the vestibules, windows all around inside; and on the pillars were palm trees, and the measure was six cubits.

verses.latin: Et adduxit me in atrium forinsecum: et ecce camerae, et pavimentum lapideum, stratum in atrio: triginta camerae per circuitum, in pavimento.
verses.english: Then he brought me to the outer court, and behold, there were chambers and a pavement of stone, laid in the court all around. There were thirty chambers on the pavement.

verses.latin: Et pavimentum erat juxta latera portarum, secundum longitudinem portarum: hoc est pavimentum.
verses.english: The pavement was alongside the sides of the gates, according to the length of the gates. This is the pavement.

verses.latin: Et mensus est latitudinem a fronte portae inferioris usque ad faciem atrii interioris centum cubitorum: et atrium interius in parte orientis.
verses.english: Then he measured the width from the front of the lower gate to the front of the inner court, one hundred cubits. And the inner court was on the east side.

verses.latin: Et mensus est portam atrii forinsecus, quae respiciebat septentrionem: et mensus est longitudinem ejus et latitudinem.
verses.english: Then he measured the gate of the outer court that faced north. He measured its length and its width.

verses.latin: Et camerae ejus tres hinc, et tres inde: et columnae ejus, et frontes ejus secundum mensuram portae primae: quinquaginta cubitorum longitudo, et latitudo viginti et quinque cubitorum.
verses.english: Its chambers were three on each side, and its pillars and its jambs were according to the measure of the first gate. Its length was fifty cubits, and the width twenty-five cubits.

verses.latin: Et fenestrae ejus, et vestibula, et palmulae, secundum mensuram portae quae respiciebat viam orientis: et ascendebant per septem gradus, et vestibulum erat ante eas.
verses.english: Its windows, its vestibules, and its palm trees were according to the measure of the gate that faced east. They went up to it by seven steps, and its vestibule was before them.

verses.latin: Et porta atrii interioris contra portam septentrionalem et contra orientem: et mensus est de porta usque ad portam centum cubitorum.
verses.english: And the gate of the inner court was opposite the north gate and the east gate. He measured from gate to gate, one hundred cubits.

verses.latin: Et adduxit me ad viam australem, et ecce porta australis: et mensus est frontes ejus, et columnas ejus, secundum mensuras praedictas.
verses.english: Then he brought me to the south way, and behold, the south gate. He measured its jambs and its pillars according to these same measurements.

verses.latin: Et erant in ea fenestrae per circuitum, per utrasque frontes: et longitudo quinquaginta cubitorum, et latitudo viginti et quinque cubitorum.
verses.english: And there were windows around it on both jambs, and the length was fifty cubits, and the width twenty-five cubits.

verses.latin: Et gradus septem, qui ascendebant ad eam: et frontes ejus ante eas, et palmulae in columnis hinc et inde.
verses.english: And there were seven steps by which they ascended to it, and its jambs were before them, and palm trees on its pillars on this side and on that side.

verses.latin: Et erat porta atrii interioris, per viam australem: et mensus est de porta usque ad portam australem, centum cubitorum.
verses.english: And there was a gate of the inner court on the south way. He measured from gate to gate, one hundred cubits.

verses.latin: Et adduxit me in atrium interius per viam australem: et mensus est portam viam australem, secundum mensuras praedictas.
verses.english: Then he brought me to the inner court by the south way. He measured the south gate according to the same measurements.

verses.latin: Et camerae ejus, et columnae ejus, et frontes ejus, secundum mensuras praedictas: et erant in ea fenestrae per circuitum, et in frontibus ejus, quinquaginta cubitorum longitudo, et latitudo viginti et quinque cubitorum.
verses.english: Its chambers, its pillars, and its jambs were according to these same measurements. There were windows around it and in its jambs, the length was fifty cubits, and the width twenty-five cubits.

verses.latin: Et erant frontes atrii interioris, viginti et quinque cubitorum: et ad portam atrii interioris, viginti et quinque cubitorum.
verses.english: And the jambs of the inner court were twenty-five cubits, and to the gate of the inner court, twenty-five cubits.

verses.latin: Et frontes atrii exterioris, contra orientem, viginti et quinque cubitorum: et mensus est columnas, et frontes secundum mensuras praedictas.
verses.english: And the jambs of the outer court faced east, twenty-five cubits, and he measured the pillars and the jambs according to these same measurements.

verses.latin: Et fenestrae erant per circuitum, et in frontibus ejus: quinquaginta cubitorum longitudo, et latitudo viginti et quinque cubitorum.
verses.english: And there were windows around it, and in its jambs; the length was fifty cubits, and the width twenty-five cubits.

verses.latin: Et frontes atrii interioris, per viam orientalem, viginti et quinque cubitorum: et mensus est columnas, et frontes secundum mensuras praedictas.
verses.english: The jambs of the inner court faced the east way, twenty-five cubits, and he measured the pillars and the jambs according to the same measurements.

verses.latin: Et erant fenestrae per circuitum, et in frontibus ejus, quinquaginta cubitorum longitudo, et latitudo viginti et quinque cubitorum.
verses.english: And there were windows around it, and in its jambs; the length was fifty cubits, and the width twenty-five cubits.

verses.latin: Et adduxit me per viam aquilonis, in portam: et mensus est secundum mensuras praedictas.
verses.english: Then he brought me by the north way to the gate. And he measured it according to these same measurements.

verses.latin: Camerae ejus, et columnae ejus, et frontes ejus, et fenestrae per circuitum: longitudo quinquaginta cubitorum, et latitudo viginti et quinque cubitorum.
verses.english: Its chambers, its pillars, and its jambs, and the windows around it; the length was fifty cubits, and the width twenty-five cubits.

verses.latin: Et columnae ejus erant ad atrium forinsecum: et palmulae ejus in columnis hinc et inde: et gradus ejus, octo.
verses.english: And its pillars were to the outer court, and palm trees on its pillars on this side and on that side, and its steps were eight.

verses.latin: Et camera, et introitus ejus, juxta columnas erant: ibi lavacrum ad lavandum holocausta.
verses.english: And the chamber and its entrance were by the pillars; there was a washing place for washing the burnt offerings.

verses.latin: Et in introitu portae, erant duae mensae hinc, et duae mensae inde, ut immolarentur super eas holocaustum, et pro peccato, et pro delicto.
verses.english: In the entrance of the gate were two tables on this side and two tables on that side, on which they were to slaughter the burnt offering, and the sin offering, and the trespass offering.

verses.latin: Et in latere forinsecus, qui ascendebat ad introitum portae septentrionalis, erant duae mensae: et in latere altero, contra vestibulum portae, duae mensae.
verses.english: On the outer side, as one went up to the entrance of the north gate, were two tables, and on the other side, opposite the vestibule of the gate, were two tables.

verses.latin: Mensa quatuor, hinc et inde, ad latitudinem mensae unius, et in latere mensae unius, quod immolabant.
verses.english: There were four tables on this side and on that side, at the width of one table, and on the side of one table, on which they slaughtered.

verses.latin: Et mensae quatuor lapideae, ad holocausta mensae unius, cubiti et dimidii longitudo, et cubiti et dimidii latitudo, et cubiti unus altitudo: in quibus ponebant vasa, quibus immolabant holocausta, et victimas.
verses.english: And there were four stone tables for the burnt offerings, a cubit and a half long, and a cubit and a half wide, and one cubit high, on which they placed the vessels with which they slaughtered the burnt offerings and sacrifices.

verses.latin: Et erant ganci palmae digiti, intrinsecus per circuitum: et in mensis caro immolationis.
verses.english: And there were hooks, a handbreadth long, inside all around, and on the tables was the flesh of the offerings.

verses.latin: Et adduxit me ad atrium interius: et ecce duae camerae in atrio interiori, una in latere portae septentrionalis, quae respiciebat viam meridiei: et una in latere portae meridionalis, quae respiciebat viam aquilonis.
verses.english: Then he brought me to the inner court, and behold, there were two chambers in the inner court, one at the side of the north gate, facing the south way, and one at the side of the south gate, facing the north way.

verses.latin: Et dixit ad me: Haec camera, quae respicit viam septentrionalem, est sacerdotum, qui custodiunt ministerium domus.
verses.english: And he said to me: “This chamber, which faces the north way, is for the priests who keep the service of the house.

verses.latin: Et camera quae respicit viam australem, est sacerdotum, qui custodiunt ministerium altaris: ipsi sunt filii Sadoc, qui accedunt de filiis Levi ad Dominum, ut ministrent ei.
verses.english: And the chamber which faces the south way is for the priests who keep the service of the altar. These are the sons of Zadok, who from the sons of Levi come near to the Lord to minister to him.”

verses.latin: Et mensus est atrium: centum cubitorum longitudo, et centum cubitorum latitudo quadrata: et altare ante faciem templi.
verses.english: Then he measured the court: one hundred cubits long and one hundred cubits wide, square. And the altar was before the face of the temple.

verses.latin: Et adduxit me in vestibulum templi: et mensus est frontes vestibuli, quinque cubitorum hinc, et quinque cubitorum inde: et latitudo portae, cubitorum novem, et profunditas frontium, cubitorum trium.
verses.english: Then he brought me to the vestibule of the temple, and he measured the jambs of the vestibule, five cubits on this side, and five cubits on that side, and the width of the gate, nine cubits, and the depth of the jambs, three cubits.

verses.latin: Et longitudo vestibuli, viginti cubitorum, et latitudo, duodecim cubitorum: et ascendebant per gradus decem. Et columnae juxta frontes, una hinc, et una inde.
verses.english: The length of the vestibule was twenty cubits, and the width twelve cubits. They went up to it by ten steps, and the pillars were by the jambs, one on this side and one on that side.

verses.latin: Postea duxit me in templum, et mensus est postes sex cubitorum latitudinis ex una parte, et sex cubitorum latitudinis ex altera parte, latitudinis tabernaculi.
verses.english: Afterwards, the angel brought me into the temple, and measured the entrance halls. The width of the entrance was six cubits on one side, and six cubits on the other side, which was the width of the tabernacle.

verses.latin: Latitudo autem ostii decem cubitorum, et latera ostii quinque cubitorum ex una parte, et quinque cubitorum ex altera parte: et mensus est longitudinem ædificii quadraginta cubitorum, et latitudinem viginti.
verses.english: The entrance door was ten cubits wide, and the sides of the door were five cubits on one side and five cubits on the other. He measured the length of the building, which was forty cubits, and the width, which was twenty.

verses.latin: Ingressusque est intrinsecus, et mensus est postes ostii duos cubitos: et ostium sex cubitorum, et latitudinem ostii septem cubitorum.
verses.english: He went inside, and measured the entrance doors, which were two cubits. The door was six cubits wide, and the width of the doors was seven cubits.

verses.latin: Et mensus est longitudinem viginti cubitorum, et latitudinem viginti cubitorum, ante faciem templi: et dixit mihi: Hoc est Sanctum sanctorum.
verses.english: He measured the length, which was twenty cubits, and the width, which was twenty cubits, in front of the temple. He said to me, “This is the Holy of Holies.”

verses.latin: Postea mensus est parietem domus, sex cubitorum: et latitudinem lateris, quatuor cubitorum, per circuitum domus in gyro.
verses.english: Afterwards, he measured the wall of the house, which was six cubits. The width of the side chambers around the house was four cubits.

verses.latin: Et erant latera laterum, triplici ordine, et triginta in angulis, et intrabant in pariete domus, per circuitum, ad latera, ut continerent: et non contingebant pariete domus.
verses.english: The side chambers were in three rows, and thirty in the corners. The chambers entered into the wall of the house on the sides, to hold them in place, but they did not touch the wall of the house.

verses.latin: Et erat latitudo per circuitum, et ascendebant per gyrum: quia per circuitum domus ascendebant, propter hoc latitudo erat domus in gyro: et propter hoc ascendebant a superiore ad inferius ad medium.
verses.english: The side chambers went around the house, and ascended by a spiral staircase. They went around the house, and were wide because of the chambers that went around. Thus, the ascent was from the lower level to the upper level through the middle.

verses.latin: Vidi etiam in domo altitudinem per circuitum: fundamenta laterum, mensura calami sex cubitorum.
verses.english: I saw also that the house had a height all around. The foundation of the side chambers, was a reed of six cubits.

verses.latin: Latitudo parietis, qui erat pro extra, ad latera, quinque cubitorum: et quæ reliqua erant latera, inter latera, erant cubitorum novem.
verses.english: The width of the wall outside the side chambers was five cubits, and what remained of the side chambers between them was nine cubits.

verses.latin: Et mensus est longitudinem domus quadraginta cubitorum, et latitudinem viginti cubitorum: et dixit mihi: Hoc est Sanctum sanctorum.
verses.english: He measured the length of the house, which was forty cubits, and the width, which was twenty cubits. He said to me, “This is the Holy of Holies.”

verses.latin: Et mensus est latera domus cubitorum centum, et retro quadraginta cubitorum, et parietes per circuitum.
verses.english: He measured the side chambers of the house which were one hundred cubits long, and forty cubits wide in the back, and the walls all around.

verses.latin: Subtusque cameris latitudo decem cubitorum, et introitus cubitorum, et ostia laterum ad orientem intrantes in eis.
verses.english: The width of the side chambers was ten cubits underneath. The entrances to the side chambers were cubits wide, and their doors faced east, which you entered through them.

verses.latin: Et dixit mihi: Filie hominis, hæc sunt latera, et hæc mensura laterum, quæ exibunt.
verses.english: He said to me, “Son of man, these are the side chambers, and this is the measurement of the side chambers, which will be used.

verses.latin: Et mensuravit latitudinem ostii cubitorum viginti, et ante ostium latera: et ostium per circuitum.
verses.english: He measured the width of the doors, which was twenty cubits. Before the doors there were side chambers, and the entrance went all around.

verses.latin: Et a facie introitus usque ad faciem interioris templi, et usque ad parietem domus, cubitorum quinquaginta.
verses.english: From the front of the entrance to the front of the inner temple, and to the wall of the house, was fifty cubits.

verses.latin: Et erant fenestræ obliquæ in latera, et in latera in gyro per gyrum: et in fenestris circuitus, et in parietibus sculpserant palmas.
verses.english: There were windows in the side chambers, and also in the side chambers all around, and the windows had frames, and on the walls were engraved palm trees.

verses.latin: Et duxit me in atrium exterius: et ecce exedræ, et pavimentum strata lapidibus in gyro, per circuitum atrii: triginta exedrarum.
verses.english: He led me into the outer courtyard. There were chambers and a pavement made of stone all around the courtyard; there were thirty chambers.

verses.latin: Et exedra contra latus portarum, et contra viam laterum: ibi exedræ erant in gyro, et pavimentum stratum.
verses.english: The chambers were opposite the side of the gates and opposite the way of the side chambers; there were chambers all around, and a paved area.

verses.latin: Et mensus est latitudinem a facie interioris portæ usque ad faciem atrii exterioris, cubitorum centum ad orientem et ad aquilonem.
verses.english: He measured the width, from the front of the inner gate to the front of the outer courtyard, which was one hundred cubits, on the east and on the north.

verses.latin: Et mensus est longitudinem, et latitudinem, in portis aquilonis, quæ tendebant ad atrium exterius.
verses.english: He measured the length and width of the gates of the north, which led to the outer courtyard.

verses.latin: Et fenestræ ejus, et exedræ, et palmarum ornamentum, juxta mensuram portæ, quæ respiciebat ad orientem: ascendebant per septem gradus, et ante eas.
verses.english: Its windows, chambers, and palm tree decorations were according to the measure of the gate that faced east. There were seven steps, and there was an area in front of them.

verses.latin: Et ingressus est in atrium interius: et mensus est juxta portam mensuram istam.
verses.english: Then he entered into the inner courtyard and measured the same gate.

verses.latin: Et porta atrii interioris contra portam aquilonis, et contra orientem: et mensus est a porta usque ad portam, centum cubitos.
verses.english: There was a gate to the inner courtyard opposite the north gate, and also facing the east. He measured the distance from gate to gate, which was one hundred cubits.

verses.latin: Et duxit me ad viam ad austrum: et ecce porta ad austrum, et mensus est postes ejus, et latera ejus, juxta mensuras priores.
verses.english: He brought me to the way to the south, and behold, the gate to the south, and he measured its entrance halls, and its side chambers, according to the same measurements as before.

verses.latin: Et erant fenestræ in ea, et in latera per gyrum, sicut fenestræ priores: longitudo cubitorum quinquaginta, et latitudo cubitorum viginti.
verses.english: There were windows in it, and the side chambers all around, just like the former windows. The length was fifty cubits, and the width was twenty cubits.

verses.latin: Et gradus ascendebant per eam, et scala erat in via ejus: et fenestræ ejus per gyrum: longitudo cubitorum quinquaginta, et latitudo cubitorum viginti.
verses.english: The steps went up through it, and there was a staircase in the way. The windows were all around: the length was fifty cubits, and the width was twenty cubits.

verses.latin: Et porta atrii interioris ad viam ad austrum: et mensus est a porta usque ad portam ad austrum, centum cubitos.
verses.english: The gate of the inner courtyard faced the way to the south, and he measured from the gate to the gate to the south, which was one hundred cubits.

verses.latin: Et duxit me in atrium interius per viam ad austrum: et mensus est secundum mensuras istas.
verses.english: He brought me into the inner courtyard by the way to the south, and measured according to these measurements.

verses.latin: Et exedras ejus, et postes ejus, et latera ejus, secundum mensuras istas.
verses.english: The side chambers, the entrance halls, and the side chambers were according to these same measurements.

verses.latin: Post haec duxit me ad portam quae respiciebat ad viam orientalem.
verses.english: After these things, the angel brought me to the gate facing east.

verses.latin: Et ecce, gloria Dei Israel veniebat per viam orientalem, et vox ejus quasi vox aquarum multarum, et terra splendescebat a gloria ejus.
verses.english: And look—the glory of the God of Israel arrived from the east. His voice sounded like the noise of many waters, and the whole earth shone with His glory.

verses.latin: Et aspectus quem vidi, similis fuit ejus quam videram cum venissem ad conterendum civitatem, et aspectus similis ei quem videram juxta flumen Chobar, et cecidi in faciem meam.
verses.english: The vision I saw resembled the one I had seen when I came to destroy the city. It also looked like the vision I had seen near the river Chebar, and I fell on my face.

verses.latin: Et gloria Domini ingressa est templum per viam quae respiciebat ad portam orientalem.
verses.english: Then the glory of the Lord entered the temple through the gate facing east.

verses.latin: Et assumpsit me spiritus et introduxit me in atria interiora, et ecce gloria Domini replevit templum.
verses.english: Then the Spirit lifted me up and brought me into the inner courts. And look—the glory of the Lord filled the temple.

verses.latin: Et vidi eum stantem juxta templum, et virum qui habebat in manu sua mensuram lineam de linteis, et mensus est longitudinem aedificii, sex cubitos: et latitudinem, sex cubitos in latitudine.
verses.english: I saw a man standing beside the temple. He held a measuring line made of linen in his hand. The man measured the length of the building, which was six cubits. The breadth of the building was six cubits in width.

verses.latin: Et mensus est latitudinem ostii, cubitos tres, et latitudinem ostiorum, cubitos tres.
verses.english: Then he measured the width of the entrance, three cubits, and the width of the doorways, three cubits.

verses.latin: Et mensus est atrium, cubitos viginti: et in latitudine, cubitos viginti; et introivit ad templum.
verses.english: He measured the court: twenty cubits in length, and twenty cubits in breadth. Then he went into the temple.

verses.latin: Et mensus est parietem templi, cubitos duos: et latitudinem aedificii, cubitos sex, et latitudinem aedium, cubitos septem.
verses.english: He measured the wall of the temple: two cubits. The width of the building was six cubits, and the breadth of the chambers was seven cubits.

verses.latin: Et mensus est de aedibus, cubitos viginti, et latitudinem, cubitos viginti, contra templum; et dixit mihi:
verses.english: He measured the chambers: twenty cubits, and twenty cubits in breadth, opposite the temple. And he said to me:

verses.latin: Hae aedificia, quae respiciunt ad aquilonem, aedificia sancta sunt, quia ibi comedent sacerdotes, qui offerunt in sancta de filiis Sadoc, qui custodiunt custodiam meam: hi comedent sancta sanctorum, et in his manducabunt.
verses.english: “These chambers facing north are the holy chambers. The priests who offer the holy sacrifices of the sons of Zadok, who guard My sanctuary, will eat there. They will eat the most holy offerings in these chambers.

verses.latin: Et quibuscumque intrant, de sacerdotibus, ingrediantur in eis: non egredientur autem de sanctis in atrium exterius, sed ibi reponent vestimenta sua, in quibus ministrant, quia sancta sunt: induentque sibi vestimenta alia, et sic procedent ad populum.
verses.english: The priests who enter these chambers can go in, but they cannot leave the holy place to enter the outer court. Rather, they will leave their priestly garments there, where they serve, because the garments are holy. They will put on other garments before going out to the people.”

verses.latin: Et mensus est templum, cubitos centum, et in longitudine, cubitos centum.
verses.english: He measured the temple: one hundred cubits long, and one hundred cubits in length.

verses.latin: Et mensus est etiam latera aedificii per circuitum, cubitos centum.
verses.english: He also measured the sides of the building all around: one hundred cubits.

verses.latin: Et mensus est longitudinem aedificii, contra faciem quae erat juxta solitudinem ejus, ex utraque parte, cubitos centum.
verses.english: He measured the length of the building that faced the empty space on both sides, one hundred cubits.

verses.latin: Et mensus est longitudinem aedificii, contra faciem quae erat ex solitudine retro, et galearum ejus ex hac et ex illa parte, cubitos centum, et templum interius, et vestibula atrii.
verses.english: He measured the length of the building that faced the empty space behind it, and the galleries on this and that side, one hundred cubits. And the inner temple and the vestibules of the court were included.

verses.latin: Post vestibulum autem forinsecus erat, in atrium exterius, et per circuitum, cubilia triginta, et in circuitu cubilia.
verses.english: Outside of the vestibule, the outer court extended around, and around the court were thirty chambers.

verses.latin: Et erat in parietibus, qui erant inter cubilia, fenestrae, et in cubilibus fenestrae per circuitum, contra cubilia, et pictura palmarum.
verses.english: The walls between the chambers had windows, and the chambers had windows all around facing the chambers. The walls were decorated with the carvings of palm trees.

verses.latin: Et erat atrium exterius contra viam, in cubilia ad plateam, et facies contra faciem ad viam cubilium.
verses.english: The outer court faced the road into the chambers to the square. The faces were positioned opposite one another, facing the road of the chambers.

verses.latin: Et mensus est portam atrii exterioris, quae respiciebat ad aquilonem, et mensus est longitudinem ejus, et latitudinem, et fenestras ejus, et palmas ejus: secundum mensuras portae quae respiciebat ad viam orientalem: et ascendebatur in eam per septem gradus.
verses.english: He measured the gate of the outer court that faced north. He measured its length, its breadth, its windows, and its palm trees. These were measured according to the measurements of the gate that faced east. One could ascend into it by seven steps.

verses.latin: Et mensus est longitudinem ejus, cubitos centum, et latitudinem, cubitos quinquaginta.
verses.english: He measured its length: one hundred cubits, and its breadth: fifty cubits.

verses.latin: Et fenestrarum ejus, et palmorum ejus, et picturarum ejus, juxta mensuras portae quae respiciebat ad viam orientalem, et ascendebatur in eam per septem gradus, et erat vestibulum contra eas.
verses.english: The windows, the palm trees, and the decorations were according to the measurements of the gate that faced east. One ascended into it by seven steps, and there was a vestibule in front of them.

verses.latin: Et erat porta atrii interioris contra portam septentrionalem, et contra orientalem, et mensus est de porta ad portam, cubitos centum.
verses.english: There was a gate of the inner court opposite the northern gate and the eastern gate, and he measured from gate to gate: one hundred cubits.

verses.latin: Et duxit me ad viam australem: et ecce, porta australis: et mensus est ostia ejus et postes, juxta mensuras superiorum.
verses.english: Then he led me to the southern side, and look—there was the southern gate. He measured its doorways and its posts, following the same measurements as before.

verses.latin: Et erant in ea fenestrae et palmae ex utraque parte: juxta mensuras portae alterius.
verses.english: There were windows and palm trees on either side of it, and they were according to the measurements of the other gates.

verses.latin: Et erant septem gradus, per quos ascendebatur in eam: et vestibulum erat contra eas: et erant palmae ex hac et ex illa parte in postibus ejus.
verses.english: There were seven steps by which one could ascend to it, and there was a vestibule in front of them. There were palm trees on each side of its posts.

verses.latin: Et erat porta atrii interioris per viam australem: et mensus est a porta ad portam australem, cubitos centum.
verses.english: There was a gate of the inner court on the southern side, and he measured from gate to gate: one hundred cubits.

verses.latin: Et duxit me in atrium interius per viam australem: et mensus est portam australem juxta mensuras easdem.
verses.english: He led me into the inner court by the southern side, and he measured the southern gate according to those same measurements.

verses.latin: Et fenestras ejus, et palmas ejus, et postes ejus, juxta mensuras superiorum. Et erant in ea fenestrae per circuitum, et in postibus ejus.
verses.english: Its windows, its palm trees, and its posts were according to the measurements of the others. There were windows all around, and in its posts.

verses.latin: Et erat porta atrii interioris, cubitos viginti, et latitudo, cubitos viginti, et ante eam erant cubilia.
verses.english: The gate of the inner court was twenty cubits long and twenty cubits broad, and chambers were in front of it.

verses.latin: Et erat porta atrii exterioris ad viam australem, et palmae in postibus ejus: et ascensus ejus per octo gradus.
verses.english: The outer court’s gate was on the southern side, and there were palm trees on its posts. Its ascent was by eight steps.

verses.latin: Et duxit me in atrium interius per viam orientalem: et mensus est portam juxta mensuras easdem.
verses.english: He led me into the inner court by the eastern side, and he measured the gate according to the same measurements.

verses.latin: Et fenestras ejus, et palmas ejus, et postes ejus, juxta mensuras superiorum. Et erant in ea fenestrae per circuitum, et in postibus ejus.
verses.english: Its windows, its palm trees, and its posts were according to the measurements of the others. There were windows all around, and in its posts.

verses.latin: Et erat porta atrii exterioris ad viam orientalem: et mensus est cubilia juxta mensuras ejusdem.
verses.english: The outer court’s gate was on the eastern side, and he measured the chambers according to the same measurements.

verses.latin: Et duxit me in atrium interius ad viam aquilonis: et mensus est juxta mensuras easdem.
verses.english: Then he led me into the inner court by the northern side, and he measured the gate according to the same measurements.

verses.latin: Et fenestras ejus, et palmas ejus, et postes ejus, juxta mensuras superiorum. Et erant in ea fenestrae per circuitum, et in postibus ejus.
verses.english: Its windows, its palm trees, and its posts were according to the measurements of the others. There were windows all around, and in its posts.

verses.latin: Et erant cubilia in postibus portae, in quibus lavabant holocaustum.
verses.english: There were chambers in the posts of the gate where the burnt offerings were washed.

verses.latin: Et in introitu portae erant mensae duae, super quas immolabant holocaustum et pro peccato, et pro delicto.
verses.english: At the entrance of the gate were two tables, upon which the burnt offerings, sin offerings, and guilt offerings were sacrificed.

verses.latin: Et in pariete forinsecus, in introitu portae, mensae duae, et in pariete portae, mensae duae, ubi immolabant victimas.
verses.english: On the outer wall, at the entrance of the gate, were two tables, and on the wall of the gate were two tables where the sacrifices were made.

verses.latin: Et in introitu portae quae respiciebat ad aquilonem, mensae duae, et mensae duae in introitu portae, quae respiciebat ad viam australem.
verses.english: At the entrance of the gate that faced north, there were two tables. Two tables were also at the entrance of the gate that faced south.

verses.latin: Et mensae erant quatuor ex utraque parte, juxta pariete portae: mensarum, quatuor cubitorum; et mensarum, cubito uno et dimidio.
verses.english: On both sides of the gate’s wall were four tables. The tables were four cubits long, and the tables were one and a half cubits wide.

verses.latin: Et mensae ad holocaustum erant, cubito uno: et dimidio, longae: et cubito uno et dimidio, latae: et mensae ad vasa, in quibus immolabant.
verses.english: The tables for the burnt offerings were one and a half cubits long, and one and a half cubits wide. The tables were for the vessels used to slaughter the sacrifices.

verses.latin: Et erant hami palmarum, unius cubiti, per circuitum intus: et in mensis erat caro oblationum.
verses.english: There were hooks of one cubit, placed all around the inner edge of the walls. Upon the tables was the meat of the offerings.

verses.latin: Et duxit me ad atrium interius: et ecce, mensae in atrio interiore, ex utraque parte, et in introitu templi.
verses.english: He then led me into the inner court, and look—there were tables in the inner court, on both sides of the entrance of the temple.

verses.latin: Et dixit mihi: Haec mensa est quae est ante faciem Domini.
verses.english: And he said to me, “This table is before the face of the Lord.”

verses.latin: Et duxit me in atrium exterius: et duxit me per quatuor angulos atrii: et ecce, in unoquoque angulo atrii, atrium.
verses.english: Then he led me into the outer court. He led me through the four corners of the court. And look—in each corner of the court was a court.

verses.latin: Et erant in angulis atrii claustra, quadraginta cubitorum longorum, et triginta latitudinis: mensura una erat in quatuor angulis.
verses.english: In the corners of the court were cloisters forty cubits long and thirty cubits wide. The measurements of the four corners were the same.

verses.latin: Et erant aedificia in unoquoque angulo atrii, et in latitudine triginta cubitorum, et in longitudine quadraginta cubitorum: mensura una in ipsis quatuor.
verses.english: In each corner of the court there were also buildings thirty cubits wide and forty cubits long. These four had the same measurements.

verses.latin: Et introivit ad vestibulum portae, et mensus est portae: cubitos duodecim, et latitudinem, cubitos sex.
verses.english: He entered the vestibule of the gate and measured the gate: twelve cubits high, and six cubits wide.

verses.latin: Et adduxit me ad portam quae respiciebat ad orientem.
verses.english: And the angel brought me to the gate facing east.

verses.latin: Et ecce gloria Dei Israël ingrediebatur per viam orientalem: et vox sonitus quasi sonitus aquarum multarum, et terra splendebat a gloria ejus.
verses.english: And I looked, and the glory of the God of Israel was coming from the east. The sound was like the sound of many waters, and the land shone because of his glory.

verses.latin: Et species quam vidi, fuit sicut conspectus ejus quem videram cum venissem ad conterendum civitatem: et species sicut conspectus ejus juxta fluvium Chobar: et cecidi in faciem meam.
verses.english: The vision I saw was like the vision I had when I came to destroy the city. The vision was like the one I saw near the river Chebar, and I fell to the ground.

verses.latin: Et gloria Domini ingressa est templum per viam quae respiciebat ad portam orientalem.
verses.english: And the glory of the Lord came into the temple by the gate facing east.

verses.latin: Et levavit me spiritus, et introduxit in atrium interius: et ecce gloria Domini replevit templum.
verses.english: Then the Spirit lifted me up and brought me into the inner court, and I saw that the glory of the Lord filled the temple.

verses.latin: Et audivi loquentem ad me de templo, et virum stantem juxta me.
verses.english: I heard someone speaking to me from inside the temple, and a man was standing beside me.

verses.latin: Et dixit ad me: Fili hominis, locus solii mei, et locus vestigiorum pedum meorum, ubi habitabo in medio filiorum Israël in sempiternum: et domus Israël non polluent nomen sanctum meum ultra, ipsi et reges eorum, in fornicationibus suis, et in morticinis regum suorum, in excelsis eorum.
verses.english: And he said to me, “Son of man, this is the place of my throne and the place of my feet, where I will live among the Israelites forever. The house of Israel will not defile my holy name again, neither they, nor their kings, by their acts of sexual immorality, nor by the dead bodies of their kings, nor by their high places.

verses.latin: Qui posuerunt limen suum juxta limen meum, et postes suos juxta postes meos: et paries inter me et eos, et polluentes nomen sanctum meum in abominationibus quas fecerunt: propter quod consumpsi eos in ira mea.
verses.english: They placed their threshold next to my threshold, and their doorposts beside my doorposts, with only a wall between me and them, so that they defiled my holy name by the abominations they committed. Therefore, I consumed them in my wrath.

verses.latin: Nunc igitur longe faciant fornicationem suam, et morticina regum suorum a me, et habitabo in medio eorum in sempiternum.
verses.english: Now let them put away their sexual immorality and the dead bodies of their kings far from me, and I will dwell among them forever.

verses.latin: Tu fili hominis, indica domui Israël templum, et confundantur de iniquitatibus suis: et metiantur fabricam.
verses.english: Son of man, describe the temple to the house of Israel, and let them be ashamed of their sins, and let them measure the design.

verses.latin: Et si erubescunt de universis quae fecerunt, indic et figuram templi, et dispositionem ejus, et egressus ejus, et introitus ejus, et omnem figuram ejus, et cuncta ritus ejus, et universas leges ejus: et scribes in oculis eorum, ut custodiant omnem figuram ejus et cuncta ritus ejus, et faciant ea.
verses.english: And if they are ashamed of all that they have done, show them the design of the temple, its arrangement, its exits and entrances, its entire design, all its regulations, and all its laws. Write it down in their sight, so that they may observe its entire design, all its regulations, and perform them.

verses.latin: Haec est lex templi: In summitate montis omnis circuitus ejus sanctus sanctorum est: haec est ergo lex templi.
verses.english: This is the law of the temple: The entire area surrounding the summit of the mountain is most holy. So, this is the law of the temple.

verses.latin: Et haec mensura altaris in cubito, qui cubitus erat cubitus et palmus: in sinu cubiti palmus unus, et latitudo cubiti cubitus unus, et corona ejus per circuitum palmus unus: et haec sublimitas altaris.
verses.english: These are the measurements of the altar in cubits, each cubit being a cubit and a handbreadth. The base of the altar is one cubit high, and its width is one cubit. The rim around it is one handbreadth wide, and this is the height of the altar.

verses.latin: Et a sinu terrae usque ad sinum inferiorem, duorum cubitorum, et latitudo cubiti unius: et a sinu parvo usque ad sinum magnum, quatuor cubitorum, et latitudo unius cubiti.
verses.english: From the base of the altar to the lower ledge, two cubits high, and one cubit wide. From the small ledge to the large ledge, four cubits high, and one cubit wide.

verses.latin: Et altare, quatuor cubitorum: et ex ipso altari, quatuor cornua.
verses.english: The altar is four cubits high, and from the altar itself, four horns.

verses.latin: Et altare duodecim cubitorum longum, et duodecim latum, quadrangulum per quatuor angulos ejus.
verses.english: The altar is twelve cubits long and twelve cubits wide, forming a square at its four corners.

verses.latin: Et sinum quatuordecim cubitorum longum, et quatuordecim latum, in quatuor angulis ejus: et corona in circuitu ejus dimidii cubiti, et sinum ejus unius cubiti in circuitu: et gradus ejus respicientes ad orientem.
verses.english: The ledge is fourteen cubits long and fourteen cubits wide at its four corners. The rim around it is half a cubit, and its base is one cubit around. Its steps face east.

verses.latin: Et dixit ad me: Fili hominis, haec dicit Dominus Deus: Isti gradus qui sunt in atrio interiore, et exteriorem, et facient in quo sunt hostiarii, ad orientem.
verses.english: And he said to me, “Son of man, this is what the Lord God says: These are the steps that lead to the inner court and the outer court, where the priests, who are the gatekeepers, will be facing east.

verses.latin: Et dixit ad me: Fili hominis, haec dicit Dominus Deus: Si dederit princeps donum cujusquam ex filiis Israël, libare debet pro eo: et offeret coram Domino, et faciet ea.
verses.english: And he said to me, “Son of man, this is what the Lord God says: If the prince gives a gift from the sons of Israel, he must offer a sacrifice for it before the Lord, and he shall make these offerings.

verses.latin: Sacerdotes autem facient oblationem in eo, et holocaustum, et pacificas, et adorabunt me super altare, et sacrificabunt pro eis.
verses.english: The priests will offer an oblation of a holocaust and peace offerings, and they will worship me upon the altar, and they will sacrifice for them.

verses.latin: Cum ergo oblationem fecerit princeps, ingredietur ad viam atrii, quae respicit ad orientem, et faciet holocaustum et pacificas, sicut facere solet.
verses.english: When the prince offers an oblation, he must enter by the way of the court that faces east and offer the holocaust and peace offerings, as he usually does.

verses.latin: In via autem portae faciet, et faciet holocaustum, et pacificas coram Domino.
verses.english: He will do this in the gateway, and he will offer the holocaust and peace offerings before the Lord.

verses.latin: Et in die sabbati faciet holocaustum vituli immaculati, et sex arietum, et arietum immaculatorum.
verses.english: On the Sabbath day, he shall offer a holocaust of a perfect young bull, six rams, and unblemished rams.

verses.latin: Et in die mensis, vitulum de armento immaculatum, et sex agnos de grege immaculatos.
verses.english: On the first day of each month, he will offer a perfect young bull from the herd, and six unblemished lambs from the flock.

verses.latin: Et faciet holocaustum et pacificas, ut faciat coram Domino.
verses.english: And he shall offer the holocaust and the peace offerings before the Lord.

verses.latin: Et in die mensis primi, vitulum de armento immaculatum, et sex agnos de grege immaculatos.
verses.english: On the first day of each month, he will offer a perfect young bull from the herd, and six unblemished lambs from the flock.

verses.latin: Et faciet holocaustum et pacificas, ut faciat coram Domino.
verses.english: And he shall offer the holocaust and the peace offerings before the Lord.

verses.latin: Et revertit me ad viam portae sanctuarii exterioris, quae respiciebat ad orientem: et erat clausa.
verses.english: Then the Lord brought me back to the way of the outer sanctuary’s gate, which faces east: and it was closed.

verses.latin: Et dixit mihi Dominus: Filius hominis, haec est porta, per quam ingredi debent principes, ut comedant panem coram Domino: per viam vestibuli portae ingredientur, et per viam ejus egredientur.
verses.english: The Lord said to me, “Son of man, this is the gate by which the princes will enter, so they may eat food before the Lord. They will enter through the vestibule of the gate, and they will exit through the same way.”

verses.latin: Et adduxit me per viam portae septentrionalis in conspectu domus: et vidi, et ecce replevit gloria Domini domum Domini, et cecidi in faciem meam.
verses.english: Then the Lord brought me by the north gate in front of the house: and I saw, and behold, the glory of the Lord filled the Lord’s house, and I fell on my face.

verses.latin: Et dixit mihi Dominus: Filius hominis, animadverte, et vide oculis tuis, et auribus tuis audi omnia quae ego loquor ad te de omnibus caerimoniis domus Domini, et de cunctis legibus ejus: et observa introitum domus, cum universis exitibus sanctuarii.
verses.english: The Lord said to me, “Son of man, note and see with your eyes, and hear with your ears everything that I speak to you concerning all of the ceremonies of the Lord’s house, and all of its laws. Pay close attention to the entrance to the house, along with all the exits of the sanctuary.”

verses.latin: Et dices ad domum Israel, quae rebelles sunt: Haec dicit Dominus Deus: Sufficiant vobis omnes abominationes vestrae, domus Israel,
verses.english: Then you shall say to the house of Israel, who have rebelled: “These are the words of the Lord God: ‘Let all your abominations be enough for you, house of Israel,

verses.latin: eo quod introduxeritis filios alienos, incircumcisos corde et incircumcisos carne, ut essent in sanctuario meo, et contaminarent domum meam, et offerrent panes meos, adipem et sanguinem, et dissolvistis pactum meum in omnibus abominationibus vestris.
verses.english: because you have brought in the foreigners, uncircumcised in heart and uncircumcised in flesh, to be in my sanctuary and contaminate my house. You have offered my bread, the fat, and the blood. You have broken my covenant by all your abominations.

verses.latin: Et non custodistis ordinationes sanctorum meorum: sed posuistis custodes observationis meae in sanctuario meo pro vobis.
verses.english: You have not kept my holy ordinances, but you have appointed others to be the keepers of my observances in my sanctuary for you.

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus Deus: Nullus alienigena incircumcisus corde et incircumcisus carne ingrediatur in sanctuarium meum: ex omni alienigena qui est in medio filiorum Israel.
verses.english: These are the words of the Lord God: “No foreigner, uncircumcised in heart and uncircumcised in flesh, shall enter my sanctuary, out of all the foreigners who are among the children of Israel.

verses.latin: Sed Levitae, qui recesserunt a me, cum errarent Israel, et abierunt a me post idola sua, portabunt iniquitatem suam.
verses.english: “But the Levites who departed from me, when Israel went astray, and went after their idols, they shall bear their iniquity.

verses.latin: Eruntque ministri in sanctuario meo, et custodes portarum domus, et ministri domus: ipsi occident holocaustum et victimas populi, et ipsi stabunt coram eis, ut ministrent eis.
verses.english: They will be ministers in my sanctuary, and keepers of the gates of the house, and ministers in the house: they themselves will slaughter the burnt offerings and sacrifices of the people, and they shall stand before them, in order to minister to them.

verses.latin: Pro eo quod ministraverunt eis coram idolis eorum, et facti sunt domui Israel in scandalum iniquitatis: propterea levavi manum meam super eos, dicit Dominus Deus, et portabunt iniquitatem suam.
verses.english: Because they ministered to them before their idols, and became a stumbling block of iniquity to the house of Israel: therefore, I raised my hand against them, says the Lord God, and they shall bear their iniquity.

verses.latin: Et non accedent ad me ut sacerdotio fungantur mihi, neque ulli sanctis meis, et ad ea quae sancta sunt, et quae sanctissima: sed ipsi portabunt confusionem suam, et abominationes suas quas operati sunt.
verses.english: They will not approach me to function as priests to me, nor to any of my holy things, nor to the most holy things: but they will bear their shame, and their abominations which they have committed.

verses.latin: Et dabo eos custodes observationis domus, in omni ministerio ejus, et in omnibus quae fiunt in ea.
verses.english: And I will give them to be the keepers of the house’s observances, in all its ministry, and in all things that are done in it.

verses.latin: Sed Levitae, filii Sadoc, qui custodierunt caerimonias sanctuarii mei, cum erraret filii Israel a me, ipsi accedant ad me, ut ministrent mihi, et stent coram me, ut offerant mihi adipem et sanguinem, ait Dominus Deus.
verses.english: “But the Levites, the sons of Zadok, who kept the ceremonies of my sanctuary when the children of Israel went astray from me, they shall approach me, to minister to me, and they shall stand before me, to offer me fat and blood, says the Lord God.

verses.latin: Ipsi ingredientur in sanctuarium meum, et ipsi accedant ad mensam meam, ut ministrent mihi, et custodiant observationes meas.
verses.english: “They shall enter my sanctuary, and they shall approach my table, to minister to me, and keep my observances.

verses.latin: Et cum ingredientur portam atrii interioris, tunicas lineas induent, nec aliquid quod sudores faciat, induent, cum ministrant in porta atrii interioris et intus.
verses.english: “When they enter the gate of the inner court, they will wear linen tunics, and they will not put on anything that causes sweat, when they minister in the gate of the inner court and inside.

verses.latin: Galeas lineas habebunt super capita sua, et femoralia linea induent: non accingent se in sudorem.
verses.english: “They will have linen helmets on their heads, and linen breeches will be put on: they will not gird themselves in sweat.

verses.latin: Et cum egredientur in atrium exterius ad populum, deponent vestimenta sua, in quibus ministraverant, et operient se vestibus aliis: ne sanctificent populum in vestibus suis.
verses.english: “When they go out to the outer court to the people, they will take off their garments in which they ministered, and cover themselves with other clothes: so they do not sanctify the people in their garments.

verses.latin: Et non tondent caput, neque dimittent crines suos, sed attondent capita sua.
verses.english: “They will not shave their heads, nor will they let their hair grow long, but they will trim their heads.

verses.latin: Et vinum non bibent sacerdos, quando ingressuri sunt ad atrium interius.
verses.english: “No priest shall drink wine when they are about to enter the inner court.

verses.latin: Et viduam, et repudiatam non accipient sibi uxores, sed virgines de semine domus Israel, vel quae ceciderunt de viduitate sacerdotum, accipient.
verses.english: “They will not take a widow or a divorced woman for a wife, but they will take virgins of the house of Israel’s seed, or those who have fallen from the widowhood of the priests.

verses.latin: Et docent populum quid sit inter sanctum et profanum, et quid inter pollutum et mundum ostendent eis.
verses.english: “They shall teach the people what is between the holy and the profane, and what is between the polluted and the clean they shall show to them.

verses.latin: Et in causa judicii ipsi stabunt, et judicabunt juxta judicia mea: et leges meas et ordinationes meas custodient in omnibus solemnitatibus meis, et sabbata mea sanctificabunt.
verses.english: “And in a matter of judgment they shall stand, and they shall judge according to my judgments: and they will keep my laws and my ordinances in all my solemnities, and they shall sanctify my Sabbaths.

verses.latin: Et ad mortuum hominem non ingredientur, ne contaminentur, sed in patre et in matre, et in filio et in filia, fratre et sorore, quando moriuntur, contaminabuntur.
verses.english: “They will not enter to a dead person, lest they become contaminated, but they will be contaminated in their father and in their mother, and in their son and in their daughter, brother and sister, when they die.

verses.latin: Et postquam fuerint mundati, septem diebus numerabunt.
verses.english: “And after they are purified, they will count for seven days.

verses.latin: Et in die quo intrant in sanctuarium ad ministrandum in sanctuario, offerent pro peccato suo, dicit Dominus Deus.
verses.english: “On the day that they enter into the sanctuary to minister in the sanctuary, they shall offer for their sin, says the Lord God.

verses.latin: Et erit eis in hereditatem: ego hereditas eorum, et possessionem non dabitis eis in Israel: ego enim possessio eorum.
verses.english: “It shall be for them as an inheritance: I am their inheritance, and you will not give them a possession in Israel: for I am their possession.

verses.latin: Oblationem, et pro peccato, et pro delicto ipsi comedent, et omne votum in Israel ipsorum erit.
verses.english: “They will eat the offering for sin, and for the offense, and every vow in Israel shall be theirs.

verses.latin: Et omne quod offertur de primitiis et de omnibus quae voventur, eorum erunt.
verses.english: “And everything that is offered from the firstfruits and from all that is vowed, shall be theirs.

verses.latin: Et primitias omnium frugum vestrarum, et omnem quae offertur in donum manuum vestrarum, sacerdotum erunt: et dabitis primitias farinae vestrae sacerdoti, et benedicat domui tuae.
verses.english: “The firstfruits of all your produce, and everything that is offered as a gift of your hands, shall be for the priests: and you will give the firstfruits of your flour to the priest, and he shall bless your house.

verses.latin: Omne morticinum et laceratum, de avibus et de jumentis, non comedent sacerdotes.
verses.english: “The priests shall not eat anything that has died a natural death, or has been torn to pieces, whether birds or animals.

verses.latin: Et cum diviseritis terram in possessionem, separabitis primitias Domino, sanctificantes partem terrae.
verses.english: When you divide the land, set aside a portion for the Lord, making it holy.

verses.latin: Longitudinis erit spatium, viginti et quinque milium, latitudinis decem milium: sanctum erit in omni termino ejus per circuitum.
verses.english: The length will be twenty-five thousand units of measure, and the width ten thousand. This area will be holy on all sides.

verses.latin: De hac mensura metiemini longitudinem, viginti et quinque milium, latitudinem decem milium: et erit illic fanum sanctum et sanctum sanctorum.
verses.english: You will measure out of this area a length of twenty-five thousand units of measure, and a width of ten thousand. There will be the holy sanctuary and the holiest of holies there.

verses.latin: Sancta pars terrae erit sacerdotibus, ministris sanctuarii, qui accedunt ad ministerium Domini: et erit eis locus ad domos, et loca sancta pro sanctuario.
verses.english: The holy part of the land will be for the priests, the ministers of the sanctuary, who serve the Lord. It will be their place for houses and holy places for the sanctuary.

verses.latin: Viginti et quinque milia longitudo, et decem milia latitudo, eritque Levitis, qui ministrant in domo: ipsi possidebunt viginti gazophylacia.
verses.english: Twenty-five thousand units of measure in length, and ten thousand in width, will be for the Levites, who minister in the house. They will possess twenty chambers.

verses.latin: Et possessionem civitatis dabitis quinque milia latitudinis, et viginti et quinque milia longitudinis: juxta separationem sancti, ad omnem domum Israël.
verses.english: You will give the city's possession a width of five thousand units of measure, and a length of twenty-five thousand, next to the holy portion, for all the house of Israel.

verses.latin: Principi autem dabitis ex utraque parte possessionis sanctuarii, et possessionis civitatis: ante separationem sanctuarii, et possessionem civitatis, a plaga occidentis ad plagam orientalem: et erit princeps in possessione, in utraque parte terminorum.
verses.english: You will give to the prince from both sides of the sanctuary's possession and the city's possession, before the separation of the sanctuary and the city's possession, from the west side to the east side. The prince will be in the possession on both sides of the borders.

verses.latin: In terra sua possidebit: et non spoliabit principes meos ultra, de possessione populi mei: sed possessionem tradet domui Israël, juxta tribus eorum.
verses.english: He will possess land. My princes will not spoil my people's possession any further. But they will give the possession to the house of Israel, according to their tribes.

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Sufficiat vobis, principes Israël: auferte violentiam, et rapinas, et facite judicium et justitiam: separate spoliationes vestras a populo meo, dicit Dominus Deus.
verses.english: This is what the Lord God says: “Enough, you leaders of Israel! Stop your violence and robbery! Do what is just and right. Stop oppressing my people,

verses.latin: Statera justa, et ephah justa, et bath justa, erunt vobis: ut faciatis: ephah et bath, unum erit mensura: ut capiat decem partem chori.
verses.english: Use an honest balance, an honest ephah, and an honest bath. The ephah and the bath will have the same measure, able to hold a tenth of a homer.

verses.latin: Hæc est mensura: saccum ephah, et bath, et choro: choro, est mensura decem partium ephah.
verses.english: This is the measure: The ephah and the bath are one unit. The homer is ten ephahs.

verses.latin: Et sextam partem ephah, ex choro: ex choro, sextam partem, ex bath: erit mensura secundum bath.
verses.english: The sixth part of the ephah is equal to one homer. One sixth of a bath is one measure, according to the bath.

verses.latin: Hæc est oblatio, quam offeretis: sextam partem ephah de choro frumenti, et sextam partem ephah de choro hordei.
verses.english: This is the offering you are to present: one sixth of an ephah from a homer of wheat, and one sixth of an ephah from a homer of barley.

verses.latin: Et statutum olei, bath olei, erit decem partem chori, et decem bath chori: quia decem bath faciunt chorum.
verses.english: The portion of oil will be one bath of oil for every ten baths of the homer, because ten baths make a homer.

verses.latin: Et ovem unam de grege, de ducentis: in pascuis Israël, in sacrificium pro peccato, et holocausto, et pacificis, ut expietur pro eis, dicit Dominus Deus.
verses.english: You must sacrifice one sheep from every two hundred in the pastures of Israel, for a sin offering, and a burnt offering, and peace offerings, to make atonement for them,

verses.latin: Omnis populus terrae, in oblationem sanctam dabit principes Israël.
verses.english: All the people of the land will give this holy offering to the leaders of Israel.

verses.latin: Super principem erit holocaustum, et sacrificium, et libamen, in sollemnitatibus, et in sabbatis, et in neomeniis, in omnibus sollemnitatibus domus Israël: ipse faciet pro peccato, et pro holocausto, et pro pacificis, ut expietur pro domo Israël.
verses.english: It will be the prince's duty to provide the burnt offerings, sacrifices, and drink offerings, at the festivals, the Sabbaths, and the new moons, at all the festivals of the house of Israel. He will make the sin offering, the burnt offering, and the peace offerings, to make atonement for the house of Israel.

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus: In primo, prima mensis, tolles vitulum immaculatum, et expiabis sancta.
verses.english: This is what the Lord God says: “In the first month, on the first day of the month, you must take a young, perfect bull, and purify the sanctuary.

verses.latin: Et sumet sacerdos de sanguine sacrificii pro peccato, et ponet super postes domus, et super quatuor angulos plateae altaris, et super postes portae atrii interioris.
verses.english: The priest will take some of the blood of the sin offering and put it on the doorposts of the house, on the four corners of the altar, and on the doorposts of the gate of the inner court.

verses.latin: Et sic facies in septima mensis, pro quolibet errante, et pro ignaro, et expiabis domum.
verses.english: You must do the same on the seventh day of the month, for anyone who has made a mistake or is ignorant, to make atonement for the house.

verses.latin: In primo mense, quarta decima die mensis, erit vobis Pascha: sollemnitas septem dierum, panes azymos comedetis.
verses.english: In the first month, on the fourteenth day of the month, you will have the Passover, a seven-day festival, and you will eat unleavened bread.

verses.latin: Et faciet princeps in die illa pro se, et pro universo populo terrae, vitulum pro peccato.
verses.english: The prince will provide a young bull as a sin offering for himself and for all the people of the land.

verses.latin: Et in septem diebus sollemnitatis, faciet holocaustum Domino, septem vitulos, et septem arietes immaculatos, in die singulo, et hircum pro peccato, singulis diebus.
verses.english: During the seven days of the festival, the prince will provide a burnt offering to the Lord: seven young, perfect bulls and seven perfect rams each day, and a male goat each day, as a sin offering.

verses.latin: Et sacrificium, et libamen in holocausto faciet singulis diebus, septem dierum, in sacrificium pro peccato, et in holocausto, et in libamine olei.
verses.english: He will provide a grain offering and a drink offering with each burnt offering for seven days. He will provide the sin offering, the burnt offering, and the oil for a drink offering.

verses.latin: In septimo mense, in quinta decima die mensis, in sollemnitate, faciet simile, septem diebus, juxta legem sacrificii pro peccato, et holocausti, et libaminis olei.
verses.english: In the seventh month, on the fifteenth day of the month, at the festival, he will do the same for seven days, according to the law of the sin offering, the burnt offering, and the oil for a drink offering.

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus Deus: Porta interior atrii orientalis clausa erit sex diebus, et in die sabbati aperietur; sed et in die calend. aperietur.
verses.english: The Lord God says, “The inner gate of the east court will be shut for six days a week. But on the Sabbath, it will be opened; and it will also be opened on the first day of the month.

verses.latin: Et intrabit princeps per viam vestibuli forinsecus, et stabit in vestibulo portae foris, et faciet holocaustum suum, et pacificas suas. Et adorabit in limine portae: et egredietur, et non claudetur porta usque ad vesperam.
verses.english: The prince will enter through the entrance of the outer gate, and he will stand in the vestibule of the gate. He will offer his burnt offering and his peace offerings. He will worship at the threshold of the gate. He will exit, and the gate will not be shut until evening.

verses.latin: Adorabit autem populus terrae in introitu portae illius in conspectu Domini in sabbatis et in calendis.
verses.english: The people of the land will worship at the entrance to that gate, in the presence of the Lord, on the Sabbaths and on the first day of the month.

verses.latin: Holocaustum autem, quod offeret princeps Domino, in die sabbati, sex arietes immaculatos, et arietem immaculatum.
verses.english: The burnt offering that the prince offers to the Lord on the Sabbath will be six unblemished rams and one unblemished ram.

verses.latin: Et oblationem mensurae ephah in ariete, et in arietibus oblationem, quantum potuerit, et oleum hin in mensuram ephah.
verses.english: He will offer a grain offering of one ephah for the ram, and he will offer a grain offering as much as he is able for the rams, and one hin of oil for each ephah.

verses.latin: In die calend. vitulum immaculatum, et sex agnos immaculatos, et arietem immaculatum.
verses.english: On the first day of the month, he will offer a young, unblemished bull, six unblemished lambs, and one unblemished ram.

verses.latin: Et oblationem mensurae ephah pro vitulo, et mensuram ephah pro ariete: et in agnis, quantum potuerit, et oleum hin in mensuram ephah.
verses.english: He will offer a grain offering of one ephah for the bull, one ephah for the ram. And for the lambs, he will offer whatever he is able, and one hin of oil for each ephah.

verses.latin: Cum autem intraverit princeps, per viam vestibuli, ingredietur, et per viam ejus egredietur.
verses.english: When the prince enters, he will enter by the way of the vestibule, and he will exit by the same way.

verses.latin: Cum autem ingrediatur populus terrae coram Domino in solemnitatibus, qui ingreditur per viam portae aquilonis, ut adoret, per viam portae meridianae egredietur: et qui ingreditur per viam portae meridianae, egredietur per viam portae aquilonis: non revertetur per viam portae per quam introivit, sed contra eam egredietur.
verses.english: When the people of the land come before the Lord during the feasts, the one who enters by way of the north gate to worship will exit by way of the south gate. The one who enters by the south gate will exit by the north gate. They will not return by the way of the gate by which they entered, but they will exit opposite it.

verses.latin: Princeps autem in medio eorum ingredietur, cum intrant, et cum egrediuntur, et non claudetur porta.
verses.english: The prince will enter in their midst when they enter, and when they exit. The gate will not be shut.

verses.latin: In festivitatibus quoque et in solemnitatibus erit oblatio mensurae ephah in tauro, et mensurae ephah in ariete: et in agnis quantum potuerit, et oleum hin in mensuram ephah.
verses.english: Also during the festivals and solemnities, the offering will be one ephah for a bull, and one ephah for a ram. For the lambs, it will be as much as he is able, and one hin of oil for each ephah.

verses.latin: Cum fecerit princeps voluntariam holocaustum vel pacificas voluntarias, aperiet ei portam, quae respicit ad orientem: et faciet holocaustum suum, et pacificas suas, sicut facit in sabbato: et egredietur: et postquam egressus fuerit, claudetur porta.
verses.english: When the prince offers a voluntary burnt offering or voluntary peace offerings, the gate that faces east will be opened for him. He will offer his burnt offering and his peace offerings, just as he does on the Sabbath. He will exit, and after he has exited, the gate will be shut.

verses.latin: Et holocaustum semel in die offeres Domino, agnum anniculum immaculatum: et mane offeres eum.
verses.english: Each day, you will offer a burnt offering to the Lord, a one-year-old, unblemished lamb. You will offer it in the morning.

verses.latin: Et oblationem super eo mane offeres, sextam partem ephah, et oleum tertiam partem hin, ad temperandam farinam: oblationem Domino semper jure.
verses.english: You will offer a grain offering with it in the morning, a sixth part of an ephah, and one third of a hin of oil to mix with the flour, as a grain offering to the Lord, always by right.

verses.latin: Et facient agnum, et oblationem, et oleum, mane semper, in holocaustum perpetuum.
verses.english: They will offer the lamb, the grain offering, and the oil every morning, as a perpetual burnt offering.

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus Deus: Si dederit princeps donum alicui de filiis suis, hereditas ejus erit filiorum ejus: possidebit eam. Hereditatem suam.
verses.english: The Lord God says: “If the prince gives a gift to one of his sons, it will be the inheritance of his sons. He will possess it as his inheritance.

verses.latin: Si autem dederit de hereditate sua donum servo suo, erit ejus usque ad annum remissionis: et revertetur ad principem: filiorum ejus erit hereditas.
verses.english: But if he gives a gift from his inheritance to one of his servants, it will belong to him until the year of remission. It will return to the prince. The inheritance will be for his sons.

verses.latin: Et non sumet de hereditate populi, ut expellat eos de possessione sua, sed de possessione sua hereditatem suam haereditabit filiis suis.
verses.english: He will not take from the people’s inheritance to expel them from their possession, but from his own possession he will inherit his inheritance for his sons.”

verses.latin: Et introduxit me per viam quae erat juxta portam, ad gazophylacium sanctuarii, sacerdotum, quod respiciebat ad aquilonem: et ecce ibi locus in latere, contra occidentem.
verses.english: He led me through the way that was next to the gate, to the treasury of the sanctuary of the priests, which faced north. There was a place there at its side, facing west.

verses.latin: Et dixit ad me: Hic est locus, ubi coquent sacerdotes pro delicto et pro peccato: et ubi coquent, ut non transferant in atrium populi.
verses.english: He said to me, “This is the place where the priests will cook the sin offering and the trespass offering. They will cook it so that they do not transfer it into the court of the people.”

verses.latin: Et eduxit me in atrium exterius, et circumduxit me per quatuor angulos atrii: et ecce atrium in angulo atrii.
verses.english: Then he led me into the outer court and led me around the four corners of the court. There was a court in the corner of the court.

verses.latin: In quatuor angulis atrii erant atria clausa, quadraginta cubitorum longitudo, et triginta latitudo: mensura una erat in quatuor.
verses.english: In the four corners of the court were enclosed courts, forty cubits long and thirty wide. The measure was the same in all four.

verses.latin: Et erat structura per circuitum in circuitu: sub atriis circa illud. Et coctio sub structura per circuitum.
verses.english: There was a structure around all of them. Under the courts, there was a structure around them. There was a place for cooking under the structure around.

verses.latin: Et dixit ad me: Hae coquinae sunt, ubi coquent qui ministrant in domo.
verses.english: He said to me: “These are the kitchens, where those who minister in the house will cook.”

verses.latin: Et reduxit me ad ostium domus: et ecce aquae egrediebantur de sub limine domus ad orientem: facies enim domus respiciebat ad orientem: aquae autem descendebant a latere dextro templi ad austrum.
verses.english: Then he led me back to the door of the temple, and I saw water flowing out from beneath the threshold of the temple toward the east. (For the façade of the temple looked toward the east.) The water came down from the right side of the temple toward the south.

verses.latin: Et eduxit me per viam portae aquilonis, et circumduxit me per viam forinsecus portae forinsecus ad viam quae respicit ad orientem: et ecce aquae redundantes a latere dextro.
verses.english: And he led me through the way of the north gate and went around me outside to the outer gate to the road facing east. And I saw the water flowing from the right side.

verses.latin: Et egressus vir qui habebat funiculum in manu, mensus est mille cubitos, et transduxit me per aquas usque ad talos.
verses.english: The man who had a measuring line in his hand went east. He measured a thousand cubits and then led me through the water, and the water reached my ankles.

verses.latin: Et rursum mensus est mille cubitos, et transduxit me per aquas usque ad genua.
verses.english: Then he measured another thousand cubits and led me through the water, and the water reached my knees.

verses.latin: Et mensus est rursum mille cubitos, et transduxit me per aquas usque ad lumbos.
verses.english: He measured another thousand cubits and led me through the water, and the water reached my waist.

verses.latin: Et mensus est mille cubitos, et fluvius erat quem non potui transvadere: quia intenderant aquae, et natare oportebat, et non poteras transire.
verses.english: He measured another thousand cubits, and it was a river that I could not cross, because the water had risen to such a height that it was deep enough to swim in. It was a river that could not be crossed.

verses.latin: Et dixit mihi: Fili hominis, vidisti? Et eduxit me et convertit me ad ripam fluvii.
verses.english: He said to me, “Son of man, have you seen this?” Then he led me back to the bank of the river.

verses.latin: Cumque rediissem, ecce in ripa fluvii ligna multa nimis ex utraque parte.
verses.english: And when I had returned, I saw many trees on both sides of the river.

verses.latin: Et dixit mihi: Aquae istae quae egrediuntur in plagam orientalem, et descendentes in solitudinem, ingredientur mare, et eicientur: et sanabuntur aquae.
verses.english: And he said to me, “These waters that are flowing toward the east and descending into the desert will enter the sea and be cast out, and the waters of the sea will be healed.

verses.latin: Et omnis anima vivens quae movebitur, quocumque venerit fluvius, vivet: et erunt pisces plurimi, postquam venerint illuc aquae istae, et sanabuntur, et vivent omnia ad quae venerit fluvius.
verses.english: “Wherever the river flows, every living creature that swarms there will live. There will be great numbers of fish, for these waters flow there and the sea will be healed. And everything will live wherever the river goes.

verses.latin: Et stabunt juxta eum piscatores, et ab Engaddi usque ad Engallim erit exsiccatio velificiorum: et erunt in eo pisces juxta genera sua, sicut pisces maris magni, plurimi nimis.
verses.english: “Fishermen will stand beside the sea from Engedi to Eneglaim. They will be places for spreading nets. Their fish will be of many kinds, like the fish of the Great Sea, very many.

verses.latin: Paludes autem ejus et lacus ejus non sanabuntur, sed dabuntur in salem.
verses.english: “But its swamps and marshes will not be healed; they will be given over to salt.

verses.latin: Et juxta fluium ex utraque ripa ascendent omne lignum pomiferum: non defluet folium ex eo, et non deficiet fructus ejus: per menses enim suos adferet primitiva, quia aquae ejus de sanctis egredientur: et erunt fructus ejus in cibum, et folia ejus ad medicinam.
verses.english: “On both banks of the river there will grow all kinds of fruit trees. Their leaves will not wither, nor their fruit fail. Each month they will bear fresh fruit because the water for them flows from the sanctuary. Their fruit will be for food, and their leaves for healing.”

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus Deus: Ecce ego, et visitabo te, et congregabo dispersos tuos ex gentibus, et congregabo te de terris in quibus dispersus es, et dabo tibi terram Israel.
verses.english: Thus says the Lord God: “Behold, I will visit you, and I will gather you from the nations, and I will bring you home from the lands where you have been scattered, and I will give you the land of Israel.

verses.latin: Et venies illuc, et auferes omnes abominationes ejus, et universas offensiones ejus.
verses.english: “You will come home, and you will remove all of your abominations and all of your offenses.

verses.latin: Et dabo tibi cor novum, et spiritum novum ponam in visceribus vestris: et auferam cor lapideum de carne vestra, et dabo vobis cor carneum.
verses.english: “I will give you a new heart, and I will put a new spirit within you. I will remove the stony heart from your flesh and give you a heart of flesh.

verses.latin: Et ponam spiritum meum in medio vestri: et faciam quod in praeceptis meis ambuletis, et judicia mea custodiatis, et faciatis.
verses.english: “I will put My Spirit within you, and I will cause you to walk in My statutes and be careful to observe My judgments.

verses.latin: Et habitabitis in terra quam dedi patribus vestris, et eritis mihi in populum, et ego ero vobis in Deum.
verses.english: “You will dwell in the land that I gave to your fathers, and you will be My people, and I will be your God.”

verses.latin: Et salvabo vos de cunctis immunditiis vestris: et vocabo frumentum, et multiplicabo illud, et non imponam vobis famem.
verses.english: “And I will deliver you from all your uncleanness. And I will call for the grain and multiply it and will bring no famine on you.

verses.latin: Et multiplicabo fructum ligni, et incrementum agri, ut non portetis ultra opprobrium gentium pro fame.
verses.english: “I will multiply the fruit of the trees and the increase of the field, so that you will not suffer reproach among the nations because of famine.
