verses.latin: Et recordabimini malarum viarum vestrarum, et operum non bonorum, et displicebunt vobis iniquitates vestrae, et scelera vestra.
verses.english: “Then you will remember your evil ways and your deeds that were not good, and you will despise yourselves for your iniquities and your abominations.

verses.latin: Non propter vos facio, dicit Dominus Deus, sciatis: sit vobis confusum et erubescite in viis vestris, domus Israel.
verses.english: “Not for your sake do I do this, says the Lord God; let it be known to you. Be ashamed and confounded for your ways, O house of Israel.”

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus Deus: In die qua emundavero vos ex omnibus iniquitatibus vestris, et habitare feci civitates, et aedificata fuerint deserta,
verses.english: Thus says the Lord God: “On the day that I cleanse you from all your iniquities, I will cause the cities to be inhabited, and the waste places will be rebuilt.

verses.latin: et terra quae deserta erat, colatur, quae solitudinis erat in conspectu omnis transeuntis.
verses.english: “And the land that was desolate will be tilled instead of being desolate in the sight of everyone who passes by.

verses.latin: Et dicent: Terra illa desolata facta est ut hortus voluptatis: et civitates quae destructae erant, et desertae, et dirutae, munitae sunt.
verses.english: “And they will say, ‘This land that was desolate has become like the garden of Eden, and the cities that were ruined, desolate, and destroyed are fortified.’

verses.latin: Et scient gentes quae reliquae fuerint in circuitu vestro, quia ego Dominus aedificavi dissipata, et plantavi ea quae desolata fuerant. Ego Dominus locutus sum, et feci.
verses.english: “Then the nations that are left all around you will know that I, the Lord, have rebuilt the ruined places and planted that which was desolate. I, the Lord, have spoken, and I will do it.”

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus Deus: Adhuc in hoc requiramur a domo Israel, ut faciam eis: multiplicabo eos quasi gregem hominum.
verses.english: Thus says the Lord God: “In addition to this, I will be inquired of by the house of Israel, to do this for them: I will increase their numbers like a flock of people.

verses.latin: Quasi gregem sanctum, quasi gregem Hierusalem in solemnitatibus ejus: sic erunt civitates desolatae plenae grege hominum: et scient quia ego Dominus.
verses.english: “Like the flock for the holy days, like the flock of Jerusalem at its appointed feasts, so will the ruined cities be filled with flocks of people. Then they will know that I am the Lord.”

verses.latin: Et hae sunt tribus filiorum Israël, et portae, quas possidebunt.
verses.english: These are the tribes of the sons of Israel. Each will have a gate of its own.

verses.latin: A plaga septentrionali in longitudinem, a via Hethalon, usque ad introitum Emath, Chaser Enan in confinio Damasci ad viam Emath, et erunt latera ad orientem et ad occidentem: Dan una.
verses.english: From the northern boundary, the length begins at the road of Hethalon, to the entrance of Emath, and at the boundary of Damascus, near the road of Emath. The eastern and western boundaries are Dan.

verses.latin: Et in confinio Dan, a plaga orientis usque ad plagam maris, Aser una.
verses.english: Near the border of Dan, on the east side, to the sea, Asher will have its land.

verses.latin: Et in confinio Aser, a plaga orientis usque ad plagam maris, Nephthali una.
verses.english: Near the border of Asher, on the east side, to the sea, Naphtali will have its land.

verses.latin: In confinio Nephthali, a plaga orientis usque ad plagam maris, Manasse una.
verses.english: Near the border of Naphtali, on the east side, to the sea, Manasseh will have its land.

verses.latin: Et in confinio Manasse, a plaga orientis usque ad plagam maris, Ephraim una.
verses.english: Near the border of Manasseh, on the east side, to the sea, Ephraim will have its land.

verses.latin: In confinio Ephraim, a plaga orientis usque ad plagam maris, Ruben una.
verses.english: Near the border of Ephraim, on the east side, to the sea, Reuben will have its land.

verses.latin: Et in confinio Ruben, a plaga orientis usque ad plagam maris, Juda una.
verses.english: Near the border of Reuben, on the east side, to the sea, Judah will have its land.

verses.latin: In confinio Juda, a plaga orientis usque ad plagam maris, haec est pars quam auferetis.
verses.english: Near the border of Judah, on the east side, to the sea, this is the portion you shall set aside.

verses.latin: Et pars sancta erit, viginti quinque milia longitudinis, et decem milia latitudinis. Haec erit pars sacerdotum.
verses.english: The sacred portion will be twenty-five thousand units long, and ten thousand units wide. This will be the priests' part.

verses.latin: Et hoc erit sacerdotibus, de filiis Sadoc, qui custodierunt caeremonias meas, et non erraverunt, quando errabant filii Israël, sicut errabant Levitæ.
verses.english: This is the portion for the priests, the sons of Zadok, who kept my ceremonies and did not go astray when the sons of Israel went astray, as the Levites did.

verses.latin: Igitur erit eis de parte terrae, pars sancta sanctorum, juxta terminum Levitarum.
verses.english: It will be their sacred portion of the land, a most holy portion, near the border of the Levites.

verses.latin: Levitis quoque juxta terminos sacerdotum, quinque et viginti milia longitudinis, decem vero milia latitudinis.
verses.english: The Levites will have a portion near the priests' borders, twenty-five thousand units long, and ten thousand units wide.

verses.latin: Et non vendent ex eis, neque permutabunt, neque transferent primicias terrae: quia sanctificata Domino.
verses.english: They may not sell or exchange any of it, nor transfer the first fruits of the land, for they are sanctified to the Lord.

verses.latin: Reliquum vero, quod relinquitur in latitudine, quinque milia, et profana erunt civitati, in habitacula et suburbana: et civitas erit in medio eorum.
verses.english: The rest, which remains in width, will be five thousand units. It will be for the city, for dwellings and suburbs. The city will be in their midst.

verses.latin: Et haec mensura: plaga septentrionalis, quadringentorum et quinquaginta, et plaga meridiana, quadringentorum et quinquaginta, et ad plagam orientalem, quadringentorum et quinquaginta, et ad plagam maris, quadringentorum et quinquaginta.
verses.english: This is the city's measurement: on the north side, four thousand five hundred; on the south, four thousand five hundred; on the east, four thousand five hundred; and on the west, four thousand five hundred.

verses.latin: Suburbana autem civitatis erunt: ad septentrionem, ducenti et quinquaginta, et ad meridianam plagam, ducenti et quinquaginta, ad orientem quoque, ducenti et quinquaginta, et ad mare, ducenti et quinquaginta.
verses.english: The city's suburbs will be: on the north side, two hundred and fifty units; on the south side, two hundred and fifty; on the east side, two hundred and fifty; and on the west, two hundred and fifty.

verses.latin: Reliqua vero, quae supererunt longitudinis, juxta mensuram sanctae partis, decem milia ad orientem, et decem milia ad occidentem: et erit fructus ejus in cibum civitati.
verses.english: The rest of the length, according to the measurement of the holy portion, will be ten thousand units on the east, and ten thousand on the west, and its fruit will be for food for the city.

verses.latin: Et qui laborant in civitate, laborabunt de omnibus tribubus Israël.
verses.english: Those who work in the city will work from all the tribes of Israel.

verses.latin: Omnis autem pars, viginti quinque milia, in longitudine, et decem milia in latitudine, erit de parte sancta.
verses.english: All the portions, twenty-five thousand units in length, and ten thousand in width, will be from the sacred portion.

verses.latin: Reliquae vero de parte, a parte sacerdotum, et Levitarum, erunt principes, viginti quinque milia longitudinis, et decem milia latitudinis: et pars eorum erit sancta.
verses.english: The remaining portion, from the portion of the priests and the Levites, will belong to the leaders, twenty-five thousand units in length and ten thousand in width. Their portion will be holy.

verses.latin: De possessione autem Levitarum et sacerdotum, erit in medio, et erit pars inter fines Juda et Beniamin.
verses.english: From the possession of the Levites and the priests, it will be in the middle, and it will be between the borders of Judah and Benjamin.

verses.latin: Porro reliquae tribus: a plaga orientis usque ad plagam maris, Beniamin una.
verses.english: As for the other tribes, from the east side to the sea, Benjamin will have its land.

verses.latin: In confinio Beniamin, a plaga orientis usque ad plagam maris, Simeon una.
verses.english: Near the border of Benjamin, from the east side to the sea, Simeon will have its land.

verses.latin: Et in confinio Simeon, a plaga orientis usque ad plagam maris, Isachar una.
verses.english: Near the border of Simeon, from the east side to the sea, Issachar will have its land.

verses.latin: In confinio Isachar, a plaga orientis usque ad plagam maris, Zabulon una.
verses.english: Near the border of Issachar, from the east side to the sea, Zebulun will have its land.

verses.latin: In confinio Zabulon, a plaga orientis usque ad plagam maris, Gad una.
verses.english: Near the border of Zebulun, from the east side to the sea, Gad will have its land.

verses.latin: Et in confinio Gad, ad plagam austri ad meridiem, erit terminus a Thamar usque ad aquas contradicitionis, in Cades: et ad torrentem usque ad mare magnum.
verses.english: Near the border of Gad, towards the south, the border will be from Tamar to the waters of Meribah in Kadesh, and to the torrent, to the great sea.

verses.latin: Haec est terra, quam sorte dividetis tribubus Israël: et hae sunt partes eorum, ait Dominus Deus.
verses.english: This is the land that you will divide by lot among the tribes of Israel. These are their portions, says the Lord God.

verses.latin: Et hae sunt exitus civitatis: a plaga septentrionali, quadringenti et quinquaginta.
verses.english: These are the exits of the city: on the north side, four thousand five hundred.

verses.latin: Portae civitatis, secundum tribus Israël, tres portae ad aquilonem: porta Ruben una, porta Juda una, porta Levi una.
verses.english: The gates of the city, according to the tribes of Israel: three gates on the north side: the gate of Reuben, one gate of Judah, one gate of Levi.

verses.latin: Et ad orientem, quadringenti et quinquaginta: et tres portae, porta Joseph una, porta Beniamin una, porta Dan una.
verses.english: On the east side, four thousand five hundred, and three gates: the gate of Joseph, one gate of Benjamin, one gate of Dan.

verses.latin: Et ad meridiem, quadringenti et quinquaginta: et tres portae, porta Simeon una, porta Isachar una, porta Zabulon una.
verses.english: On the south side, four thousand five hundred, and three gates: the gate of Simeon, one gate of Issachar, one gate of Zebulun.

verses.latin: Ad mare, quadringenti et quinquaginta: et tres portae, porta Gad una, porta Aser una, porta Nephthali una.
verses.english: On the west side, four thousand five hundred, and three gates: the gate of Gad, one gate of Asher, one gate of Naphtali.

verses.latin: Circumdata erit civitas, octodecim milium: et nomen civitatis ex illa die, Dominus ibi.
verses.english: The city will be surrounded by eighteen thousand units, and the name of the city from that day forward will be: The Lord Is There.
